original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya sandhi nir mo tsa nam s'u tra sya by'a khy'a na ma /
analyzed: a'arya sandhi nir mo tsa nam s'u tra sya by'a khy'a na ma /
translated: Āryasandhinirmocanasūtravyākhyāna

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo'i rnam par bshad pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo'i rnam par bshad pa /
translated: Explanation of the Sūtra Unravelling the Thought

original: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels!

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo 'di ni mdor bsdu na don rnam pa lngas bstan te /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo 'di ni mdor bsdu na don rnam pa lngas bstan te /
translated: This Sūtra Unravelling the Thought is taught in brief by way of five topics:

original: bsdus pa'i don dang / dgos pa dang / tshig gi don dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / brgal ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don dang / dgos pa dang / tshig gi don dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / brgal ba'i don to //
translated: the summarized meaning, the purpose, the meaning of the words, the connection, and the reply to objections.

original: de la re zhig bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la re zhig bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The summarized meaning is twofold:

original: gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the presentation of the special introduction and the presentation of the body of the sūtra.

original: de la gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The presentation of the special introduction is twofold:

original: thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'o //🔽de la thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa ni gang gi dus na /
analyzed: thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'o // de la thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa ni gang gi dus na /
translated: the special common nidāna and the special uncommon nidāna.

original: gang gis bshad pa'i mdo sde thams cad kyi thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'o //🔽de yang phun sum @2a # //
analyzed: gang gis bshad pa'i mdo sde thams cad kyi thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'o // de yang phun sum @2a # //
translated: The special common nidāna is the time when the Buddha taught the sūtras.

original: tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: The special common nidāna is taught by the two perfections.

original: dus phun sum tshogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus phun sum tshogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of time and the perfection of the teacher.

original: de la gang gi dus na bshad ce na /
analyzed: de la gang gi dus na bshad ce na /
translated: When was it taught?

original: dus phun sum tshogs pa nas te /🔽de ni mdo las /
analyzed: dus phun sum tshogs pa nas te / de ni mdo las /
translated: It was taught at the perfection of time.🔽That is taught in the sūtras:

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: Thus, I heard at one time.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung zhing mdo sde dkon mchog 'di lta bu dag mngon sum du thos pa'i skabs yod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung zhing mdo sde dkon mchog 'di lta bu dag mngon sum du thos pa'i skabs yod pa'o //
translated: Its perfection is the opportunity to hear this kind of precious sutra directly when a Tathagata appears in the world.

original: gang gis bshad ce na ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /🔽de yang mdo las /
analyzed: gang gis bshad ce na ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ste / de yang mdo las /
translated: Who explains it? The perfection of the teacher.🔽And that is indicated in the sutra by the words

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The Blessed One.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni legs pa drug dang ldan pa dang ; bdud bzhi bcom pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni legs pa drug dang ldan pa dang ; bdud bzhi bcom pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Its perfection is possessing the qualities in the Blessed One's own continuum, such as possessing the six excellences and having conquered the four maras.

original: de gnyis ni mdo sde thams cad la spyir 'dra bar bstan pa yin pas thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni mdo sde thams cad la spyir 'dra bar bstan pa yin pas thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since these two are taught in common to all sutras, it is called the general introduction.

original: de la thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa ni gang na ci 'dra ba zhig ji lta bu dag dang bzhugs pa'i rim gyis mdo sde'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de la thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa ni gang na ci 'dra ba zhig ji lta bu dag dang bzhugs pa'i rim gyis mdo sde'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The special introduction is the special introduction to the sutra, which is set forth by the place, the manner, the persons, and the sequence in which the Buddha resides.

original: de ni phun @2b sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: de ni phun @2b sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the three perfections:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of the place of the Lord, the perfection of the qualities, and the perfection of the retinue.

original: de la gang la bzhugs she na /
analyzed: de la gang la bzhugs she na /
translated: What is the place?

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The perfection of the place.

original: de ni mdo las gzhal med khang chen po zhes gsungs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni mdo las gzhal med khang chen po zhes gsungs pas bstan to //
translated: This is taught by the statement in the sutra, “in the great palace.”

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las /
translated: The perfection of the qualities is taught by the statement in the sutra,

original: rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba bkod pa 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i 'od zer rgya chen po rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba nas rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po chen po yon tan mtha' yas pas brgyan pa'i
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba bkod pa 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i 'od zer rgya chen po rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba nas rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po chen po yon tan mtha' yas pas brgyan pa'i
translated: The world system was called Array of the Blazing Best of the Seven Precious Substances, and it was filled with the light of the great radiance of the great light rays called Arising of the Great Light.🔽

original: bkod pa la brten nas bzhugs te zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bkod pa la brten nas bzhugs te zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with the qualities mentioned in the sutra from “he is endowed with the light rays that emerge from the supreme array of the blazing seven precious substances that fill the immeasurable world systems” up to “he is seated on the great king of jeweled lotuses adorned with infinite qualities.🔽”

original: ci 'dra ba cig bzhugs she na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba cig bzhugs she na /
translated: What is he like?

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pas te /
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pas te /
translated: He is endowed with perfect qualities.

original: de ni mdo las bcom ldan 'das zhes gsungs pas bstan to //🔽de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las /🔽legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ni mdo las bcom ldan 'das zhes gsungs pas bstan to // de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las / legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: That is indicated by the sutra’s statement, “the Bhagavān.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa de zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa de zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ” His perfection is indicated by the sutra from “he is endowed with a well-understood mind” up to “he is endowed with the qualities mentioned in the sutra from the limits of space.🔽”

original: de ji lta bu dag dang bzhugs she na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu dag dang bzhugs she na /
translated: With what is he endowed?

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dag dang ste /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dag dang ste /
translated: He is endowed with a perfect retinue.

original: de la 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: de la 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: The excellence of retinue is twofold:

original: nyan thos kyi 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the excellence of the śrāvaka retinue and the excellence of the bodhisattva retinue.

original: de la nyan thos kyi 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las /
translated: The excellence of the śrāvaka retinue is indicated in the sūtra:

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun tshad med pa thams cad kyang cang shes pa zhes gsungs pas bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun tshad med pa thams cad kyang cang shes pa zhes gsungs pas bstan to //
translated: The śrāvaka saṅgha is immeasurable, and all are skilled in mind.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las /
translated: The excellence of that is indicated in the sūtra:

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Buddha’s sons,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la shin tu zhugs pa sha stag ces gsungs pa'i bar gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la shin tu zhugs pa sha stag ces gsungs pa'i bar gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: who are completely engaged in the Tathāgata’s teachings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las /
translated: The excellence of the bodhisattva retinue is indicated in the sūtra:

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa thams cad kyang gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa thams cad kyang gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The bodhisattvas who have gathered from different buddha realms are immeasurable, and all are completely engaged in the great stages.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las /🔽theg pa chen po'i chos kyi nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba nas sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad rab @3a * //
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las / theg pa chen po'i chos kyi nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba nas sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad rab @3a * //
translated: Its excellence is indicated in the sutra from🔽the passage that begins, “The Dharma of the Great Vehicle is the deliverance called” up to the passage that states,

original: tu zhi bar byed pa'i sa mngon du gyur pa sha stag ces gsungs pa'i bar gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tu zhi bar byed pa'i sa mngon du gyur pa sha stag ces gsungs pa'i bar gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “the stage that pacifies all the harm of all sentient beings has been actualized.”

original: de ni mdo sde thams cad la spyir 'dra bar bstan pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni mdo sde thams cad la spyir 'dra bar bstan pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not a general teaching about all the sutras.

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo 'di la sogs pa kha cig gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par can yin pas na /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo 'di la sogs pa kha cig gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par can yin pas na /
translated: It is a special introduction to the sutras such as the noble Lotus Sutra.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the “special introduction that is not shared in common.”

original: de ni re zhig gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pas bsdus pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pas bsdus pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the meaning that is included in the introduction that is special and not shared in common.

original: de la mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The body of the sutra is presented in the following way.

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo 'di'i mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa mtha' dag gi bden pa gnyis po don dam pa'i bden pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo 'di'i mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa mtha' dag gi bden pa gnyis po don dam pa'i bden pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the two truths, ultimate truth and conventional truth, are taught in order to understand the entire body of this sutra, the noble sutra of the Lotus of the True Doctrine.

original: de la don dam pa'i bden pa ni mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i bden pa ni mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
translated: Ultimate truth should be understood as having five characteristics:

original: brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ; gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang / tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ; gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang / tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: the characteristic of being inexpressible, the characteristic of being nondual, the characteristic of transcending the domain of argument, the characteristic of transcending difference and nondifference,

original: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: and the characteristic of being of one taste in everything.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni mtshan nyid drug dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni mtshan nyid drug dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
translated: Conventional truth should be understood as having six characteristics:

original: sems kyi mtshan nyid dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyis rab tu dbye ba dang theg pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dbye ba bstan
analyzed: sems kyi mtshan nyid dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyis rab tu dbye ba dang theg pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dbye ba bstan
translated: It is the characteristics of mind, the characteristics of phenomena, the characteristics of the lack of entityness of phenomena, the presentation of the designation of phenomena, the presentation of the classification of the path of serenity and insight that are included in yoga, the presentation of the vehicles that is based on the presentation of the path, the presentation of the classification of vehicles according to the vehicles,

original: pa dang / theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa kho na las brtsams nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba sgrub pa'i rab tu dbye bas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pa dang / theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa kho na las brtsams nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba sgrub pa'i rab tu dbye bas bstan pa ste /
translated: the presentation of the classification of the activities of the tathāgatas that is based on the presentation of the designation of the vehicles alone,🔽and the presentation of the classification of the three natures.

original: mtshan nyid bcu gcig po de dag ni mdo las /
analyzed: mtshan nyid bcu gcig po de dag ni mdo las /
translated: These eleven characteristics are mentioned in the sūtra:

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin kun 'dris kyis brjod du med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin kun 'dris kyis brjod du med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa las brtsams te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Su­vi­bhaktālam­bana­saṃbhava­rati­rāja spoke about the ultimate, which is the characteristic of the inexpressible and nondual.

original: byang chub sems dpa' don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la dri ba dris pa zhes gsungs pa la sogs @3b pa mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa'i le'u bcu 'byung ba las don dam pa'i mtshan nyid dang po gnyis ni le'u dang po sbyar ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la dri ba dris pa zhes gsungs pa la sogs @3b pa mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa'i le'u bcu 'byung ba las don dam pa'i mtshan nyid dang po gnyis ni le'u dang po sbyar ro //
translated: The Bodhisattva, the Proclaimer of the Definitive Meaning of the Profound Meaning, asked the question.

original: mtshan nyid lhag ma dgu ni le'u lhag ma dgu dang go rims bzhin du 'og nas rgya cher ston te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid lhag ma dgu ni le'u lhag ma dgu dang go rims bzhin du 'og nas rgya cher ston te /
translated: The remaining nine characteristics are taught extensively below in the remaining nine chapters, in order.

original: de ni mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pas bsdus pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pas bsdus pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: That is the teaching of the summarized meaning, which is included in the presentation of the body of the sutra.

original: de la dgos pa ni 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo bstan pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa nges par dgrol ba dang bden pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya ba dang / tshogs gnyis rdzogs par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de la dgos pa ni 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo bstan pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa nges par dgrol ba dang bden pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya ba dang / tshogs gnyis rdzogs par bya ba dang /
translated: As for the purpose, this teaching of the sutra of the Noble Definitive Meaning unties the intention of the Tathagata, makes one skilled in the characteristics of the two truths, perfects the two accumulations, and makes one skilled in the three vehicles.

original: bdag med pa gnyis chud par bya ba dang / sgrib pa gnyis spong ba dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa gnyis thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis chud par bya ba dang / sgrib pa gnyis spong ba dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa gnyis thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The two kinds of selflessness are comprehended, the two obscurations are eliminated, and the two kinds of perfect enlightenment are attained.

original: des ni dgongs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni dgongs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the very essence of the intention, the cause, and the perfect result.

original: de la tshig gi don ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde'i lus mtha' dag gi ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyi tshig gi don so sor ston pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshig gi don ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde'i lus mtha' dag gi ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyi tshig gi don so sor ston pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is the teaching of the individual meanings of the collections of names, phrases, and letters of the entire body of the sutra, beginning with “Thus have I heard, at one time.

original: de la mtshams sbyar ba ni tshig gi don de dag gi snga ma dang sbyor ba dang / tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba'i go rims snga phyi mi 'gal bar mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de la mtshams sbyar ba ni tshig gi don de dag gi snga ma dang sbyor ba dang / tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba'i go rims snga phyi mi 'gal bar mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: The connection is the non-contradictory sequence of connecting the former words with the latter words of those meanings of the words.

original: brgal ba'i lan ni rigs pa dang mi 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyis dris pa'i lan gdab pa dang / nyid kyi dogs pa bsu zhing gtan tshigs kyis dgrol ba la sogs pas the tshom gyi rnam pa thams cad gcod pa ste /
analyzed: brgal ba'i lan ni rigs pa dang mi 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyis dris pa'i lan gdab pa dang / nyid kyi dogs pa bsu zhing gtan tshigs kyis dgrol ba la sogs pas the tshom gyi rnam pa thams cad gcod pa ste /
translated: The reply to objections is taught without contradicting reasoning, and so the reply to questions asked by others, the anticipation of one's own doubts and the resolution of them by means of reasoning and so on, all serve to eliminate every aspect of doubt.

original: de ltar na dgos pa dang / tshig gi don dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / brgal ba'i lan de dag ni mdo sde'i mgo 'jug gi lus mtha' dag dang spyir mthun mthun du sbyar te bstan pa yin gyi gnas skabs so sor dbye ba ni med do //
analyzed: de ltar na dgos pa dang / tshig gi don dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / brgal ba'i lan de dag ni mdo sde'i mgo 'jug gi lus mtha' dag dang spyir mthun mthun du sbyar te bstan pa yin gyi gnas skabs so sor dbye ba ni med do //
translated: Thus, the purpose, the meaning of the words, the connection and the reply to objections are all taught in general in relation to the entire body of the sutra, but they are not divided into individual sections.

original: de la dang por bsdus pa'i don ma bstan na mdo sde'i don bde blag tu khong du chud par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir de rnam par bsal ba'i phyir dang por bsdus pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: de la dang por bsdus pa'i don ma bstan na mdo sde'i don bde blag tu khong du chud par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir de rnam par bsal ba'i phyir dang por bsdus pa'i don bstan to //
translated: If the summarized meaning is not taught at the beginning, the meaning of the sutra will not be easily comprehended. Therefore, in order to clarify it, the summarized meaning is taught at the beginning.

original: de'i 'og tu dgos pa ma bstan na nyan pa po rtog pa sngon du gtong ba dag nan tan gyis nyan pa po la sogs par khas mi len pas de'i phyir de rnam par bsal ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu dgos pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dgos pa ma bstan na nyan pa po rtog pa sngon du gtong ba dag nan tan gyis nyan pa po la sogs par khas mi len pas de'i phyir de rnam par bsal ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu dgos pa bstan to //
translated: If the purpose were not taught after that, then listeners who are inclined to think would not accept the teaching as something to be taken seriously, so in order to eliminate that, the purpose is taught after that.

original: de'i 'og tu tshig don ma bstan na nyan pa po @4a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshig don ma bstan na nyan pa po @4a * //
translated: If the meaning of the words were not taught after that,

original: shes rab rtul po de dag la rmongs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de rnam par bsal ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu tshig gi don bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab rtul po de dag la rmongs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de rnam par bsal ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu tshig gi don bstan to //
translated: then those listeners of dull faculties would be confused, so in order to eliminate that, the meaning of the words is taught after that.

original: de'i 'og tu mtshams sbyar ba ma bstan na smyon tshig ltar snga phyi 'brel ba med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de rnam par bsal ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu mtshams sbyar ba bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mtshams sbyar ba ma bstan na smyon tshig ltar snga phyi 'brel ba med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de rnam par bsal ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu mtshams sbyar ba bstan to //
translated: If the connection were not taught after that, then the text would be like the ravings of a madman, with no connection between earlier and later parts, so in order to eliminate that, the connection is taught after that.

original: de'i 'og tu brgal ba'i lan ma brjod na rigs pas ma grol bas thams cad the tshom za bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir de rnam par bsal ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu brgal ba'i lan brjod de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu brgal ba'i lan ma brjod na rigs pas ma grol bas thams cad the tshom za bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir de rnam par bsal ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu brgal ba'i lan brjod de /
translated: If one does not state the reply to the objection after that, then one is not liberated by reasoning, and all will be doubtful. Therefore, in order to eliminate that doubt, the reply to the objection is stated after that.

original: de ltar rnam pa lnga po de dag ni nges pa kho nar brjod par bya ba'i rtsis mgo yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa lnga po de dag ni nges pa kho nar brjod par bya ba'i rtsis mgo yin no //
translated: Thus, these five aspects are definitely the headings to be stated.

original: de la mdo sde 'di'i ming 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa zhes bya ba ni don bzhin mdo sde'i ming du btags pa yin te /
analyzed: de la mdo sde 'di'i ming 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa zhes bya ba ni don bzhin mdo sde'i ming du btags pa yin te /
translated: The name of this sutra is the Noble Holy Sutra Unraveling the Intention. It is named after the sutra's meaning, which is as follows.

original: de yang gsung rab tu gtogs pa'i mdo sde thams cad kyi ming mdor bsdu na gnas skabs rnam pa bzhi las btags pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang gsung rab tu gtogs pa'i mdo sde thams cad kyi ming mdor bsdu na gnas skabs rnam pa bzhi las btags pa yin te /
translated: In brief, the name of all the sutras included in the scriptures is designated from four aspects.

original: yul dang / gang zag dang / dpe dang / don gyi gnas skabs las so //
analyzed: yul dang / gang zag dang / dpe dang / don gyi gnas skabs las so //
translated: They are designated from the aspects of place, person, example, and meaning.

original: de la yul gyi gnas skabs las btags pa ni yul gang du bshad pa'i gnas skabs las mdo sde'i ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: de la yul gyi gnas skabs las btags pa ni yul gang du bshad pa'i gnas skabs las mdo sde'i ming du btags pa ste /
translated: Among those, the designation from the aspect of place is the name of the sutra designated from the aspect of the place where it was explained.

original: dper na lang ka'i grong rdal dang / ga ya mgo'i rir bshad pas 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa dang / ga ya mgo'i ri zhes mdo sde'i ming du btags pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lang ka'i grong rdal dang / ga ya mgo'i rir bshad pas 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa dang / ga ya mgo'i ri zhes mdo sde'i ming du btags pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the name of the sutra is taken from the city of Lanka and Mount Gayashirsha, and the sutra is called the noble Descent into Lanka, and the noble Mount Gayashirsha.

original: gang zag gi gnas skabs las btags pa ni gang zag gang gis zhus pa dang bstan pa'i gnas skabs las mdo sde'i ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag gi gnas skabs las btags pa ni gang zag gang gis zhus pa dang bstan pa'i gnas skabs las mdo sde'i ming du btags pa ste /
translated: The name of the sutra is taken from the occasion of the question and the occasion of the teaching by a certain person.

original: dper na byang chub sems dpa' gtsug na rin po ches zhus pa dang / dri ma med par grags pas bstan pas 'phags pa gtsug na rin po ches zhus pa dang / dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa zhes mdo sde'i ming du btags pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na byang chub sems dpa' gtsug na rin po ches zhus pa dang / dri ma med par grags pas bstan pas 'phags pa gtsug na rin po ches zhus pa dang / dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa zhes mdo sde'i ming du btags pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the name of the sutra is taken from the question of the bodhisattva Ratnasikhin and the teaching of Vimalakirti, and the sutra is called the noble Ratnasikhin and the noble Vimalakirti.

original: dpe'i gnas skabs las btags pa ni dpe gang gis don mtshon pa'i gnas skabs las mdo sde'i ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: dpe'i gnas skabs las btags pa ni dpe gang gis don mtshon pa'i gnas skabs las mdo sde'i ming du btags pa ste /
translated: The name of the sutra is taken from the occasion of the example that illustrates the meaning.

original: dper na s'a lu'i ljang pa dang / rdo rje rnon po'i dpes mtshon te bshad pas 'phags pa s'a lu'i ljang pa dang / rdo rje gcod pa zhes mdo sde'i ming du btags pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na s'a lu'i ljang pa dang / rdo rje rnon po'i dpes mtshon te bshad pas 'phags pa s'a lu'i ljang pa dang / rdo rje gcod pa zhes mdo sde'i ming du btags pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the sutra called the Rice Seedling Sutra and the Diamond Cutter Sutra, which are named after their contents.

original: don gyi gnas skabs las @4b btags pa ni don gang gis bstan pa'i gnas skabs las mdo sde'i ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: don gyi gnas skabs las @4b btags pa ni don gang gis bstan pa'i gnas skabs las mdo sde'i ming du btags pa ste /
translated: It is designated from the point of view of the content that is taught.

original: dper na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis bstan pas 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes mdo sde'i ming du btags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis bstan pas 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes mdo sde'i ming du btags pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the sutra called the Perfection of Wisdom and the Buddha's Teaching, and the sutra called the Noble Perfection of Wisdom and the Buddha's Stage, are named after their contents.

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo 'di yang don gyi gnas skabs las btags pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo 'di yang don gyi gnas skabs las btags pa yin te /
translated: This sutra, the Noble Unravelling of the Intention, is also designated from the point of view of its content.

original: 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa dang ldem por dgongs pa zab mo'i don nges par gtan la 'bebs shing nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mdud pa ma lus pa gcod pas 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa zhes mdo sde'i ming du btags pa
analyzed: 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa dang ldem por dgongs pa zab mo'i don nges par gtan la 'bebs shing nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mdud pa ma lus pa gcod pas 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa zhes mdo sde'i ming du btags pa
translated: This is called the sutra of the noble Definitive Explanation of the Intention because it definitely establishes the profound meaning of the intention and hidden intention of the Tathagata and cuts all the knots of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience without exception.

original: yin te / dper na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rin po che phrogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yin te / dper na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rin po che phrogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is like, for example, the sutras called Dependent Origination and Stealing Jewels.

original: de la 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad las ring du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad las ring du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, noble means gone far, that is, gone far from all nonvirtuous, sinful dharmas.

original: dgongs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa dang ldem por dgongs pa zab mo dag go //
analyzed: dgongs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa dang ldem por dgongs pa zab mo dag go //
translated: Intention refers to the profound intentions and hidden intentions of the Tathagata.

original: yang tshig gi don rnam pa gcig tu na nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mdud pa la yang bya'o //
analyzed: yang tshig gi don rnam pa gcig tu na nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mdud pa la yang bya'o //
translated: Moreover, in another sense, the words intention and hidden intention also refer to the knots of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: nges par 'grel pa zhes bya ba ni nges par gtan la 'bebs pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'grel pa zhes bya ba ni nges par gtan la 'bebs pa ste /
translated: Ascertainment means definite determination.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa dang ldem por dgongs pa zab mo'i don nges par gtan la 'bebs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa dang ldem por dgongs pa zab mo'i don nges par gtan la 'bebs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means definitely determining the profound meaning of the Tathagata's thought and indirect intention.

original: yang tshig gi don rnams gcig tu na ma lus par gcod pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang tshig gi don rnams gcig tu na ma lus par gcod pa'i don te /
translated: Moreover, the meaning of the words is that it completely cuts off all, because

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mdud pa ma lus par gcod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mdud pa ma lus par gcod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it means completely cutting off the knots of the afflictive and knowledge obscurations.

original: de la tshig gi don spyir bsdu na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa zab mo nges par bkrol bas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mdud pa ma lus par gcod pas na /
analyzed: de la tshig gi don spyir bsdu na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa zab mo nges par bkrol bas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mdud pa ma lus par gcod pas na /
translated: In that regard, if the meaning of the words is generally summarized, it is called the definitive elucidation of the profound thought of the Tathagata because it completely cuts off the knots of the afflictive and knowledge obscurations.

original: de ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa yang yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is both a definitive elucidation of the thought and

original: mdud pa ma lus par gcod pa yang yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mdud pa ma lus par gcod pa yang yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: a complete cutting off of the knots.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo zhes bya ba'i mdo sde gzhan dag las grags pa dang 'dra bar sbyar te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo zhes bya ba'i mdo sde gzhan dag las grags pa dang 'dra bar sbyar te /
translated: This is similar to what is known in other sutras as the Mahayana sutras.🔽

original: theg pa zhes bya ba ni 'di las 'gro bar byed pas theg pa'am bgrod par bya ba yin pas theg pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa zhes bya ba ni 'di las 'gro bar byed pas theg pa'am bgrod par bya ba yin pas theg pa ste /
translated: The Mahayana is so called because it is the vehicle of the great beings, the bodhisattvas, and because it is the vehicle that goes to the great result, the great enlightenment.🔽The great beings are the bodhisattvas, and the great result is the great enlightenment.

original: lam dang 'bras bur @5a * //🔽'brel pa'i theg pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lam dang 'bras bur @5a * // 'brel pa'i theg pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The great vehicle is the vehicle of the great beings, and it is the vehicle that goes to the great result.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa las chen po rnam pa bdun po chos chen po dang / sems bskyed pa chen po dang / mos pa chen po dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa chen po dang / tshogs pa chen po dang /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa las chen po rnam pa bdun po chos chen po dang / sems bskyed pa chen po dang / mos pa chen po dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa chen po dang / tshogs pa chen po dang /
translated: The great vehicle is so called because it is superior to the vehicles of the sravakas and so on by means of seven greatnesses: the greatness of Dharma, the greatness of generating the mind, the greatness of interest, the greatness of superior intention, the greatness of provisions,

original: dus chen po dang / yang dag par 'grub pa chen pos khyad par du 'phags pas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus chen po dang / yang dag par 'grub pa chen pos khyad par du 'phags pas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: the greatness of time and the greatness of perfect accomplishment.

original: chen po bdun po de dag las dang po drug ni tha ma'i rgyur gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: chen po bdun po de dag las dang po drug ni tha ma'i rgyur gyur pa yin la /
translated: Of these seven greatnesses, the first six are causes of the last, the perfect accomplishment.

original: tha ma ni dang po drug gi 'bras bur gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni dang po drug gi 'bras bur gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: The last is the result of the first six.

original: mdo sde zhes bya ba ni don mdo tsam du ston par byed pas mdo'o //
analyzed: mdo sde zhes bya ba ni don mdo tsam du ston par byed pas mdo'o //
translated: The Sutra is so called because it teaches the meaning in brief.

original: yang gcig tu na skud pa'i gzungs kyi me tog phreng mang po'i rgyun 'dzin pa bzhin du don mdo tsam du ston pa'i mdo sde 'dis chos mngon pa'i don glag glag po mang po dag 'dzin pas na mdo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang gcig tu na skud pa'i gzungs kyi me tog phreng mang po'i rgyun 'dzin pa bzhin du don mdo tsam du ston pa'i mdo sde 'dis chos mngon pa'i don glag glag po mang po dag 'dzin pas na mdo zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, just as a garland is a collection of many flowers held together by a thread, so the Sutra holds together the many meanings of the Abhidharma in brief, and for that reason it is called Sutra.

original: de ltar na mdo sde'i ming bstan pa'i skabs 'di nyid kyis brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa dang / 'brel pa'i 'brel pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na mdo sde'i ming bstan pa'i skabs 'di nyid kyis brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa dang / 'brel pa'i 'brel pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, in this very section on the name of the Sutra, the subject matter, the purpose, the ultimate purpose and the relationship are taught.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod du gtogs pa theg pa chen po'i mdo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod du gtogs pa theg pa chen po'i mdo //
translated: The subject matter is the Mahayana Sutra included in the Bodhisattva Canon.

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ji skad bstan pa de nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas brjod par bya ba'i don med pa'i mdo stong pa se'u bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu yang ma yin la /

translated: Thus, this sutra has a meaning to be expressed,

analyzed: dgos pa'i 'bras bu yang yod /

original: thob pa'i bya ba thabs kyi 'brel pa yang yod pa yin pas /
analyzed: thob pa'i bya ba thabs kyi 'brel pa yang yod pa yin pas /

analyzed: rnal 'byor dam pas bdag la phan par 'dod pa /

analyzed: 'gro ba @5b mtha' dag gi don gtso bor byed pa /
translated: who make the welfare of all beings their primary goal,

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu mchog 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di la dad pa mchog gi gnas yin par mos pa bskyed cing mi g-yel bar nan tan gyis snying por bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu mchog 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di la dad pa mchog gi gnas yin par mos pa bskyed cing mi g-yel bar nan tan gyis snying por bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and who desire the supreme result of unsurpassed enlightenment should generate the faith of conviction in this sutra and, without distraction, should practice it with perseverance as their essence.

original: de ltar mi slu ba'i gtam glengs nas /
analyzed: de ltar mi slu ba'i gtam glengs nas /
translated: Having thus discussed this infallible teaching,

analyzed: da ni gleng gzhi'i khyad par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste / de la gleng gzhi ni gang du don 'brel par byed cing sbyor bar byed pa'am /
translated: now I will explain the meaning of the words that set forth the particular nidana, and so on.🔽Nidana is that which connects and relates a meaning,

original: yang na phan tshun nges par sbyin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni gleng gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na phan tshun nges par sbyin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni gleng gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: or it is that from which the arising of the mutual ascertainment of a meaning occurs.

original: de yang gang gi dus na gang gis bshad pas thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / gang na ci 'dra ba zhig ji lta bu dag dang bzhugs pa'i rim gyis thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gang gi dus na gang gis bshad pas thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / gang na ci 'dra ba zhig ji lta bu dag dang bzhugs pa'i rim gyis thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the special common nidāna is presented by the time and the one who explains, and the special uncommon nidāna is presented by the place, the one who resides there, and the manner in which they reside.

original: de la dang por gang gi dus na gang gis bshad pas thung mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang por gang gi dus na gang gis bshad pas thung mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag par bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, first, the special common nidāna is presented by the time and the one who explains, and this will be explained.

original: de yang phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: de yang phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: Moreover, it is taught by two kinds of perfection:

original: dus phun sum tshogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus phun sum tshogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of time and the perfection of the teacher.

original: de la gang gi dus na bshad ce na dus phun sum tshogs pa na ste /
analyzed: de la gang gi dus na bshad ce na dus phun sum tshogs pa na ste /
translated: Now, when is it explained? It is explained at the time of the perfection of time.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that,

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “Thus have I heard at one time.”

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ba'i tshig gi phrad 'di dpe dang / lung 'bogs pa dang / dris pa gtan la rnam par 'bebs pa dang / khas len pa dang / tshig gi lan dag la 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ba'i tshig gi phrad 'di dpe dang / lung 'bogs pa dang / dris pa gtan la rnam par 'bebs pa dang / khas len pa dang / tshig gi lan dag la 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is the expression of this phrase, which occurs in similes, in the recitation of scriptures, in the resolution of questions, in promises, and in answers to questions.

original: de la dpe la ni phyug pa la rnam thos kyi bu lta bu zhes byas na rnam thos kyi bu dang 'dra bar shes pa lta bu'o //🔽lung 'bogs pa la ni /
analyzed: de la dpe la ni phyug pa la rnam thos kyi bu lta bu zhes byas na rnam thos kyi bu dang 'dra bar shes pa lta bu'o // lung 'bogs pa la ni /
translated: In similes, it is like saying, “He is rich like Vaisravana,” where one understands that he is like Vaisravana.

original: 'di skad lhogs shig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di skad lhogs shig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the recitation of scriptures, it is like saying, “Recite it like this.”

original: dris pa rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa la ni bdag gis 'di skad thos te de bzhin du bshad do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dris pa rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa la ni bdag gis 'di skad thos te de bzhin du bshad do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the resolution of questions, it is like saying, “I heard it like this and explained it like that.”

original: khas len pa la ni de bzhin bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: khas len pa la ni de bzhin bya'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In promises, it is like saying, “I will do it like that.”

original: tshig gi lan la ni de de lta'o zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshig gi lan la ni de de lta'o zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: In answers to questions, it is like saying, “It is like that.”

original: de ltar rnam pa mang du yang 'dren mod kyi skabs 'dir ni 'di skad ces bya ba'i tshig gi phrad 'di khas len pa la bya bar shes par bya ste /🔽de yang yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' la @6a * //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa mang du yang 'dren mod kyi skabs 'dir ni 'di skad ces bya ba'i tshig gi phrad 'di khas len pa la bya bar shes par bya ste / de yang yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' la @6a * //
translated: Although there are many ways of interpreting this phrase, in this context it should be understood as referring to the acceptance of the statement, “Thus have I heard.”🔽Moreover, the bodhisattvas who are the compilers of the scriptures request the bodhisattva who is the teacher, “Please teach just as you have heard it.”

original: khyod kyis ji skad thos pa de bzhin bshad par gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa dang / des bdag gis ji skad thos pa de bzhin bshad par bya'o zhes khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis ji skad thos pa de bzhin bshad par gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa dang / des bdag gis ji skad thos pa de bzhin bshad par bya'o zhes khas blangs pa'o //
translated: And he accepts by saying, “I will teach just as I have heard it.”

original: yang na ji skad smras pa de kho na bzhin du bdag gis 'di skad thos te de bzhin bstan par bya'o ;
analyzed: yang na ji skad smras pa de kho na bzhin du bdag gis 'di skad thos te de bzhin bstan par bya'o ;
translated: Or else, “Just as it was said, I have heard it in just this way and will teach it in just this way.”

original: / gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par bya ba ste /
analyzed: / gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par bya ba ste /
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: des ni yan lag gzhan gyis sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' bsal par dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni yan lag gzhan gyis sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' bsal par dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he intends to eliminate the extremes of superimposition and denial by means of another part of the statement.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du ste /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du ste /
translated: The phrase by me means that the Buddha's teaching was heard directly from the Lord himself.

original: gzhan las gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It was not heard from another person by way of a transmission from one to another.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni nyan nus pa'i rna ba'i dbang pos zin pa ste /
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni nyan nus pa'i rna ba'i dbang pos zin pa ste /
translated: The phrase was heard means that the teaching was received with an ear faculty that was capable of hearing.

original: 'dis kyang yan lag gzhan gyi sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i nges pa sel te /🔽byis pa gang dag nyan mi nus pa de dag ni yan lag la sgro 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: 'dis kyang yan lag gzhan gyi sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i nges pa sel te / byis pa gang dag nyan mi nus pa de dag ni yan lag la sgro 'dogs pa'am /
translated: This phrase also eliminates the doubt that the other branches are either exaggerated or denigrated.

original: skur pa 'debs par byed kyi 'di ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs par byed kyi 'di ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the childish, who are incapable of hearing, either exaggerate or denigrate the branches, but the Buddha is not like that.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus gcig gi tshe ste /
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus gcig gi tshe ste /
translated: At one time means at one time period.

original: de yang nyan pa'i tshe bar chad med pa'i rgyun la dus gcig ces bya'i /
analyzed: de yang nyan pa'i tshe bar chad med pa'i rgyun la dus gcig ces bya'i /
translated: Moreover, that time period is called one time because it is an uninterrupted continuum during which the teaching is heard.

original: gzhan du na yi ge dang / rtsa ba dang / tshig gzung ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir cig car byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du na yi ge dang / rtsa ba dang / tshig gzung ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir cig car byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be possible for the teaching to be heard all at once, because the time periods for hearing the words, the roots, and the phrases are different.

original: yang na gzungs thob pas yi ge 'bru gcig la chos thams cad kyi rnam grangs yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir dus gcig kho na yang yin no //
analyzed: yang na gzungs thob pas yi ge 'bru gcig la chos thams cad kyi rnam grangs yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir dus gcig kho na yang yin no //
translated: Or else, it is only at one time, because, by obtaining retention, one holds in mind the enumeration of all dharmas in a single syllable.

original: yang gcig tu na rna ba'i dbang po rnam par dag pa thob pas yi ge 'bru gcig yongs su rtogs pas gzhan la yang thogs pa med pa'i phyir yang dus gcig kho na yin no //
analyzed: yang gcig tu na rna ba'i dbang po rnam par dag pa thob pas yi ge 'bru gcig yongs su rtogs pas gzhan la yang thogs pa med pa'i phyir yang dus gcig kho na yin no //
translated: Or else, it is only at one time, because, by obtaining the pure ear faculty, one comprehends all the others without obstruction, having comprehended a single syllable.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na dus zhes bya ba'i tshogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na dus zhes bya ba'i tshogs pa la bya ste /
translated: Or else, time is a collection of moments.

original: dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa tshogs so zhes tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa tshogs so zhes tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: At one time, the Lord, together with his retinue, was assembled.

original: de ni dus phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni dus phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: This is the excellence of time.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung zhing /
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung zhing /
translated: The excellence of time is the opportunity for the appearance of a Tathagata in the world,

original: mdo sde dkon mchog 'di lta bu dag mngon sum du thos pa'i skabs yod pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde dkon mchog 'di lta bu dag mngon sum du thos pa'i skabs yod pa'o //
translated: and for the direct hearing of such precious Sutras.

original: gal te de ltar na yang rdzogs ldan gyi dus la sogs pa ni skye dgu'i tshe lo dpag tu med cing longs spyod kyi 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa yang yin pas dus phun sum tshogs pa zhes @6b gdags su rung gi /'di'i tshe ni rtsod pa'i dus🔽la bab ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang rdzogs ldan gyi dus la sogs pa ni skye dgu'i tshe lo dpag tu med cing longs spyod kyi 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa yang yin pas dus phun sum tshogs pa zhes @6b gdags su rung gi /'di'i tshe ni rtsod pa'i dus la bab ste /
translated: But this is the age of conflict🔽when the five degenerations are rampant.

original: snyigs ma lnga bdo ba yin na ji ltar dus phun sum tshogs pa gdags su rung zhe na /
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga bdo ba yin na ji ltar dus phun sum tshogs pa gdags su rung zhe na /
translated: How can it be the best of times?

original: rdzogs ldan gyi dus la sogs pa'i tshe na skye dgu'i tshe lo dpag tu med cing longs spyod kyi 'byor ba phun sum tshogs pa yin yang skye dgu gcig tu bag med par spyod cing /
analyzed: rdzogs ldan gyi dus la sogs pa'i tshe na skye dgu'i tshe lo dpag tu med cing longs spyod kyi 'byor ba phun sum tshogs pa yin yang skye dgu gcig tu bag med par spyod cing /
translated: Even though the lifespan of beings is immeasurable and they have abundant resources during the age of completeness and so on, beings are heedless and

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi mtshan yang mi grag pa yin pas dus phun sum tshogs pa zhes mi gdags la /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi mtshan yang mi grag pa yin pas dus phun sum tshogs pa zhes mi gdags la /
translated: the names of the Three Jewels are not even heard, so it is not called the best of times.

original: dus mtha'i tshe na ni nad la sogs pa'i bar gyi bskal bas g-yen spyod zhing dge ba'i ming yang mi grag pas de ni dus kyi tha chad yin gyi ;
analyzed: dus mtha'i tshe na ni nad la sogs pa'i bar gyi bskal bas g-yen spyod zhing dge ba'i ming yang mi grag pas de ni dus kyi tha chad yin gyi ;
translated: At the end of time, the intermediate eon of sickness and so on will be rampant and even the name of virtue will not be heard, so that is the worst of times.

original: 'di'i tshe na rtsod pa'i dus la bab tu zin kyang de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung zhing mdo sde dkon mchog 'di lta bu dag mngon sum du thos pa'i skabs yod pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa mang ba dang / gang gis dkon mchog gsum gyi mtshan thos pa tsam dang ;
analyzed: 'di'i tshe na rtsod pa'i dus la bab tu zin kyang de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung zhing mdo sde dkon mchog 'di lta bu dag mngon sum du thos pa'i skabs yod pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa mang ba dang / gang gis dkon mchog gsum gyi mtshan thos pa tsam dang ;
translated: Even though the time of conflict has arrived, there are occasions when the Tathagata appears in the world and such precious sutras as this are directly heard, there are many who realize them, and even those who merely hear the names of the Three Jewels

original: se gol gtogs pa'i yud tsam zhig dge ba'i sems bskyed pa de dag thams cad kyang dus gzhan na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes de bzhin gshegs pas lung ston pa'i gnas skabs
analyzed: se gol gtogs pa'i yud tsam zhig dge ba'i sems bskyed pa de dag thams cad kyang dus gzhan na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes de bzhin gshegs pas lung ston pa'i gnas skabs
translated: and generate a virtuous mind for just the time it takes to snap one's fingers, the Tathagata declares that all of them will fully awaken to unsurpassable, perfect buddhahood at another time.

original: yin pas gcig tu snyigs ma lnga bdo ba yang ma yin pas de'i phyir dus phun sum tshogs pa zhes gdags su rung ngo //
analyzed: yin pas gcig tu snyigs ma lnga bdo ba yang ma yin pas de'i phyir dus phun sum tshogs pa zhes gdags su rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not that the five degenerations are rampant in one place, and thus it is suitable to designate it as the perfect time.

original: gang gis bshad ce na /
analyzed: gang gis bshad ce na /
translated: By whom is it explained?

original: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: By the perfect teacher.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “The Bhagavān.”

original: de la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni legs pa rnam pa drug po rang dbang dang / rab tu sbyangs pa dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / grags pa dang / dpal dang / che ba nyid sogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni legs pa rnam pa drug po rang dbang dang / rab tu sbyangs pa dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / grags pa dang / dpal dang / che ba nyid sogs pa la bya ste /
translated: Here, “Bhagavān” refers to the six kinds of excellence: self-mastery, complete training, good form, fame, glory, and greatness, etc.

original: sgra nges par sbyor ba las ji skad du /
analyzed: sgra nges par sbyor ba las ji skad du /
translated: As it is said in the grammatical treatises:🔽Self-mastery, complete training, good form, fame,

original: rang dbang dang ni rab sbyangs dang // gzugs bzang ba dang grags pa dang // dpal dang che ba nyid sogs pa //
analyzed: rang dbang dang ni rab sbyangs dang // gzugs bzang ba dang grags pa dang // dpal dang che ba nyid sogs pa //
translated: glory, greatness, etc.

original: drug po rnams la legs bshad ni //🔽zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: drug po rnams la legs bshad ni //🔽zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: These six are called excellence.

original: de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam pa thams cad du bral ba med de mnga' bas na de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam pa thams cad du bral ba med de mnga' bas na de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is never devoid of all of these, and he possesses them all. Therefore, the Tathāgata is called the Blessed One.

original: de la rang dbang ji lta bu na @7a * //
analyzed: de la rang dbang ji lta bu na @7a * //
translated: What is his independence?

original: nyon mongs pas gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is not dependent on others because he is not subject to the afflictions.

original: rab tu sbyangs pa ni ye shes kyi me'i gdung bas nyon mongs pa'i bud shing rab tu bsregs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu sbyangs pa ni ye shes kyi me'i gdung bas nyon mongs pa'i bud shing rab tu bsregs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is well-disciplined because the fuel of the afflictions is completely burned up by the fire of his knowledge.

original: gzugs bzang ba ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan mchog sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs bzang ba ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan mchog sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is well-formed because he possesses the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: grags pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grags pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is famous because he is endowed with all the special qualities.

original: dpal ni 'gro ba thams cad kyis bsten par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpal ni 'gro ba thams cad kyis bsten par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is glorious because he is worthy of being relied upon by all beings.

original: che ba nyid ni sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du phan pa dang bde ba mdzad pa rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: che ba nyid ni sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du phan pa dang bde ba mdzad pa rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: The greatness of the Buddha is due to his constant application to the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings in every way.

original: / tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i don to //
analyzed: / tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “collection” is the meaning of “possessing.”

original: rang dbang la sogs pa drug car dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang dbang la sogs pa drug car dang sbyar ro //
translated: The six, beginning with “self-mastery,” are to be applied to each of the four.

original: yang tshig gi don rnam pa gcig tu na /🔽bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang tshig gi don rnam pa gcig tu na / bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ste /
translated: Another interpretation of the meaning of the words is as follows:

original: bdud bzhi ni phung po'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud do //
analyzed: bdud bzhi ni phung po'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud do //
translated: He is the Bhagavat because he has conquered the four demons: the demon of the aggregates, the demon of the lord of death, the demon of the afflictions, and the demon of the sons of the gods.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni zag pa bzhi po lta ba'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang / 'dod pa'i zag pa zad pas de dag go rims bzhin du bcom par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni zag pa bzhi po lta ba'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang / 'dod pa'i zag pa zad pas de dag go rims bzhin du bcom par rig par bya'o //
translated: The Bhagavat is to be known as the conqueror of these four demons in order, because he has exhausted the four corruptions: the corruption of views, the corruption of the afflictions, the corruption of the life-span, and the corruption of the kalpa.

original: de ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: This is the perfection of the teacher.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni legs pa drug dang ldan pa dang bdud bzhi bcom pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni legs pa drug dang ldan pa dang bdud bzhi bcom pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Its perfection is endowed with the six excellences and the qualities possessed by the Transcendent Destroyer and Possessor himself, such as the destruction of the four demons.

original: de ltar dus phun sum tshogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa de gnyis ni mdo sde thams cad spyir 'dra bar bstan pa yin pas na thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dus phun sum tshogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa de gnyis ni mdo sde thams cad spyir 'dra bar bstan pa yin pas na thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since these two, the perfection of time and the perfection of teacher, are taught as the general similarity of all the sūtras, they are called the presentation of the particulars of the common nidāna.

original: thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words and so on of the presentation of the particulars of the common nidāna have been explained.

original: // / de ltar thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar thun mong gi gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the presentation of the particulars of the common nidāna,

original: de ni thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the meaning of the words and so on of the presentation of the particulars of the uncommon nidāna will be explained.

original: de yang gang na ci 'dra ba zhig ji lta bu dag dang bzhugs pa'i rim gyis mdo 'di'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gang na ci 'dra ba zhig ji lta bu dag dang bzhugs pa'i rim gyis mdo 'di'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The setting of this sutra is presented in terms of where it was, what it was like, and with whom the Buddha was dwelling.

original: de ni phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis bstan de /
analyzed: de ni phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis bstan de /
translated: It is taught in terms of three perfections:🔽the perfection of the place of the Bhagavat, the perfection of his qualities, and the perfection of his retinue.

original: bcom ldan @7b 'das kyi gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / de la gang na bzhugs she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan @7b 'das kyi gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / de la gang na bzhugs she na /
translated: Where was he dwelling?

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa na ste /
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa na ste /
translated: In a perfect place.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gzhal med khang chen po zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gzhal med khang chen po zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that, it says “in a great palace.”

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas phun sum tshogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas phun sum tshogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The perfection of the place of the Bhagavat is the completely pure buddhafield.

original: gzhal med khang chen po bya ba'i sgra nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: gzhal med khang chen po bya ba'i sgra nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: It is taught by the very words “great palace.”

original: de ni dang po kho nas bstan dgos te /
analyzed: de ni dang po kho nas bstan dgos te /
translated: That should be taught first of all.

original: 'jig rten pa thams cad las 'das pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas yin no zhes yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa thams cad las 'das pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas yin no zhes yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and it is the abode of omniscience that transcends all mundane states.

original: de bstan pa yang gdul bya rnams de la mos pa bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar smon lam 'debs pa dang / rgya chen po la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dga' ba yang dag par bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: de bstan pa yang gdul bya rnams de la mos pa bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar smon lam 'debs pa dang / rgya chen po la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dga' ba yang dag par bskyed pa dang /
translated: The teaching of that is for the purpose of generating the aspiration for that in disciples, for making prayers for birth in a pure buddhaverse, for generating the joy of bodhisattvas who aspire to the vast,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa la mos pa rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams bstan par bya ba dang / gang du bzhugs te chos dkon mchog 'di bshad pa'i gnas de yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa la mos pa rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams bstan par bya ba dang / gang du bzhugs te chos dkon mchog 'di bshad pa'i gnas de yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: for revealing the element of the superior intention of those who aspire to the superior intention, and for revealing the place where this jewel of the Dharma was taught.

original: gzhan du na gang du bzhugs te bshad pa mi shes pas kun la the tshom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na gang du bzhugs te bshad pa mi shes pas kun la the tshom du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, since it would not be known where it was taught, there would be doubt about everything.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bco brgyad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bco brgyad du rig par bya ste /
translated: Its perfection should be known as eighteenfold.

original: kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshad phun sum tshogs pa dang / yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag po phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshad phun sum tshogs pa dang / yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag po phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: The perfection of color, the perfection of shape, the perfection of size, the perfection of place, the perfection of cause, the perfection of nature, the perfection of master,

original: zham 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / phyogs phun sum tshogs pa dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'tshe ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / phyir rgol ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: zham 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / phyogs phun sum tshogs pa dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'tshe ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / phyir rgol ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: the perfection of attendants, the perfection of direction, the perfection of enjoyment, the perfection of accomplishment of action, the perfection of absence of harm, the perfection of absence of opposition,

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag po'i gnas kyi bye brag phun sum tshogs pa dang / bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sgo phun sum tshogs pa dang / rten phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag po'i gnas kyi bye brag phun sum tshogs pa dang / bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sgo phun sum tshogs pa dang / rten phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of abode, the perfection of the particular abode of the master, the perfection of vehicle, the perfection of door, and the perfection of support.

original: phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bco brgyad po de dag ni mdo las /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bco brgyad po de dag ni mdo las /
translated: These eighteen excellences are described in the sutra.

original: rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba bkod pa /🔽'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med @8a * //
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba bkod pa / 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med @8a * //
translated: The array of the seven precious substances is blazingly supreme.

original: pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i 'od zer chen po rab tu byung ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i 'od zer chen po rab tu byung ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The great light rays that fill the immeasurable world systems are called “arising.”🔽The array of the king of precious lotuses is adorned with infinite qualities.

original: rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po yon tan mtha' yas pas brgyan pa'i bkod pa la brten pa na bzhugs te zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyi tshig bcu dgu las kha dog phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo'i tshig dang po /🔽gnyis dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po yon tan mtha' yas pas brgyan pa'i bkod pa la brten pa na bzhugs te zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyi tshig bcu dgu las kha dog phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo'i tshig dang po / gnyis dang sbyar ro //
translated: The first of the nineteen phrases of the sutra, “the array of the seven precious substances is blazingly supreme,” is applied to the excellence of color.

original: dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams ni mdo'i tshig lhag ma rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams ni mdo'i tshig lhag ma rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The remaining phrases of the sutra are applied to the remaining excellences, such as the excellence of shape, in order.

original: de la dang po kha dog phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la dang po kha dog phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Now, in the first of these, the excellence of color,

original: rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba bkod pa 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i 'od zer chen po rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba bkod pa 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i 'od zer chen po rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The Tathāgata taught the Sūtra of the Questions of Ratnacūḍa, which is called “The Great Radiance That Arises from the Array of the Blazing of the Seven Supreme Precious Substances That Fills Immeasurable World Systems.”

original: de la rin po che sna bdun zhes bya ba ni gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'ur++ya dang / spug dang / rdo'i snying po dang / mu tig dmar po dang / ke ke ru'o //
analyzed: de la rin po che sna bdun zhes bya ba ni gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'ur++ya dang / spug dang / rdo'i snying po dang / mu tig dmar po dang / ke ke ru'o //
translated: Here, the “seven precious substances” are gold, silver, beryl, coral, emerald, red pearl, and chrysoberyl.

original: mchog tu 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni rin po che sna bdun po de dag nyid kha dog mchog tu 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni rin po che sna bdun po de dag nyid kha dog mchog tu 'bar ba'o //
translated: “Blazing” means that the seven precious substances have the color of fire.

original: yang na gzhal med khang chen po'i khyad par de nyid rin po che sna bdun po de dag gi kha dog mchog tu 'bar ba la yang bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhal med khang chen po'i khyad par de nyid rin po che sna bdun po de dag gi kha dog mchog tu 'bar ba la yang bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the “blazing” can refer to the color of the seven precious substances that make up the special features of the great celestial mansion.

original: bkod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyan gyi khyad par gzhan te /
analyzed: bkod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyan gyi khyad par gzhan te /
translated: “Array” refers to other special ornaments.

original: gzhal med khang chen po de nyid rgyan gyi khyad par gzhan dang yang ldan no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhal med khang chen po de nyid rgyan gyi khyad par gzhan dang yang ldan no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The great celestial mansion is also endowed with other special ornaments.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i 'od zer zhes bya ba ni de ltar mchog tu 'bar ba de las 'od zer gang dag byung bas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa dag snang bas khyab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i 'od zer zhes bya ba ni de ltar mchog tu 'bar ba de las 'od zer gang dag byung bas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa dag snang bas khyab par byed pa'o //
translated: The light rays called “filling the immeasurable world systems with light” are those that arise from that blazing light and fill the immeasurable world systems of the ten directions with light.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i 'od zer de dag che ba yin te /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i 'od zer de dag che ba yin te /
translated: “Great” means that those light rays that fill the immeasurable world systems with light are great.

original: de ltar na 'od zer de dag ni 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med par rgyas par 'gengs pa yang yin la /🔽'od zer chen po yang yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'od zer de dag ni 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med par rgyas par 'gengs pa yang yin la / 'od zer chen po yang yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, those light rays fill the immeasurable world systems and are great light rays.🔽Thus, they are called “filling the immeasurable world systems with great light rays.”

original: rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzhal med khang chen po de nyid las 'od zer chen po de dag rab tu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzhal med khang chen po de nyid las 'od zer chen po de dag rab tu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: “Arising” means that those great light rays arise from that great celestial mansion.

original: tshig de nyid kyis ni kha dog phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de nyid kyis ni kha dog phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: That very phrase teaches the perfection of color.

original: de ltar kha dog phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar kha dog phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of color,

original: de'i dbyibs ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de'i dbyibs ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: what is its shape like?

original: de'i phyir dbyibs phun sum @8b tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyibs phun sum @8b tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in terms of the perfection of shape,

original: gnas tha dad pa shin tu rnam par phye ba mtha' yas par rnam par gnas pa zhes gsungs te /🔽de'i dbyibs ni gnas tha dad pa shin tu rnam par phye ba /
analyzed: gnas tha dad pa shin tu rnam par phye ba mtha' yas par rnam par gnas pa zhes gsungs te / de'i dbyibs ni gnas tha dad pa shin tu rnam par phye ba /
translated: it is said, “it is established in infinite, distinct places.”

original: mtha' yas par rnam par gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas par rnam par gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Its shape is to be connected with “it is established in infinite, distinct places.”

original: de la gnas tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu zad pa ma yin gyi gnas kyi bye brag tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs mang du yod pa'i don to //
