analyzed: de la gnas tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu zad pa ma yin gyi gnas kyi bye brag tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs mang du yod pa'i don to //
translated: There, “distinct places” means not just one, but has the meaning of many different kinds of places.

original: shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba ni blo sngon du btang nas cha rnam par bzhag pas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba ni blo sngon du btang nas cha rnam par bzhag pas brgyan pa'o //
translated: “Distinct” means that it is adorned with the arrangement of parts that are preceded by the mind.

original: ji ltar sems yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing blo sngon du btang nas cha rnam par gzhag pa srid par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing blo sngon du btang nas cha rnam par gzhag pa srid par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can the Buddha land, whose nature is the complete purity of mind, be established as a part by the mind?

original: de ni phyi rol gyi bsgrub pas yongs su grub pa ma yin gyi /🔽bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas 'jug pa'i shes rab kyi rnam pa la dpyod pa'i tshe smon lam gyi dbang gis de de ltar mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gis na de ltar spros pa med
analyzed: de ni phyi rol gyi bsgrub pas yongs su grub pa ma yin gyi / bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas 'jug pa'i shes rab kyi rnam pa la dpyod pa'i tshe smon lam gyi dbang gis de de ltar mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gis na de ltar spros pa med
translated: It is not established by external establishment.🔽When the Lord was a bodhisattva, he analyzed the aspects of the wisdom that engages with exertion. By the power of his vow, he made such exertion.

original: pa lhun gyis grub pa'i gnas skabs na yang cha rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam par rig pa 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par rig pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang snang ste 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: pa lhun gyis grub pa'i gnas skabs na yang cha rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam par rig pa 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par rig pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang snang ste 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, even in the state of effortless non-elaboration, the consciousness that establishes parts arises. Therefore, consciousness appears to the Buddhas and bodhisattvas, but there is no contradiction.

original: mtha' yas par zhes bya ba ni grangs mtha' yas pa dang / yul mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas par zhes bya ba ni grangs mtha' yas pa dang / yul mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: Infinite means infinite in number and infinite in range.

original: rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags par gnas pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags par gnas pa'am /
translated: Well-ordered means well-ordered in terms of excellence,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs su gnas pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs su gnas pa'am /
translated: or well-ordered in terms of variety,

original: 'byam klas par gnas pa'i don te de ni dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byam klas par gnas pa'i don te de ni dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: or well-ordered in terms of immensity. This is the perfection of shape.

original: de ltar dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of shape,

original: de'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: how big is it?

original: de'i phyir tshad phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in terms of the perfection of size,

original: rgya yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rgya yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said to be unbounded in extent.

original: de'i tshad ni rgya 'di tsam zhes tshad gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshad ni rgya 'di tsam zhes tshad gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its size cannot be measured, saying It is this much.

original: de la rgya zhes bya ba ni tha gru'i khyon no //
analyzed: de la rgya zhes bya ba ni tha gru'i khyon no //
translated: Here, extent means the area.

original: yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rgya 'di tsam zhes tshad gzung du med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rgya 'di tsam zhes tshad gzung du med pa'o //
translated: Unbounded means its size cannot be measured, saying It is this much.

original: yang na rgya che zhes bya ba ni tha gru'i khyon ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na rgya che zhes bya ba ni tha gru'i khyon ma yin gyi /
translated: Or else, extensive does not refer to the breadth of the field,

original: shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs cha ste /
analyzed: shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs cha ste /
translated: but to the directional parts of the east, etc.

original: phyogs cha tha dad pa'i cha yongs su bcad mi nus pa'i rgya yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs cha tha dad pa'i cha yongs su bcad mi nus pa'i rgya yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The field is said to be unbounded because it is impossible to delimit the directional parts that are different.

original: de ni tshad phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshad phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the perfection of measure.

original: @9a * // de ltar tshad phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas yongs su ma chad pa de khams gsum par gtogs pa zhig yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: @9a * // de ltar tshad phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas yongs su ma chad pa de khams gsum par gtogs pa zhig yin nam zhe na /
translated: Having taught the perfection of measure, is that unbounded field included in the three realms?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de'i phyir yul phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the perfection of object,

original: khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said that the field of the buddhas is the domain that transcends the three realms.

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa de nyid khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa de nyid khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because that perfect abode has the domain that transcends the three realms.

original: de la spyod yul zhes bya ba ni gnas sam yul la bya ste /
analyzed: de la spyod yul zhes bya ba ni gnas sam yul la bya ste /
translated: Here, domain refers to abode or object.

original: dngos su na gzhal med khang chen po de nyid yin par blta'o //
analyzed: dngos su na gzhal med khang chen po de nyid yin par blta'o //
translated: In fact, it is the great immeasurable mansion itself.

original: de bas na spyod yul de nyid khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na spyod yul de nyid khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, that domain is transcendent to the three realms.

original: de ni spyod yul yang yin la khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa yang yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni spyod yul yang yin la khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa yang yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is both a domain and transcendent to the three realms.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khams gsum pa ni rang gi sa pa'i sred pa dag gis bdag gir byas pa yin pas dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas brtas par 'gyur ba dang de'i rnam par smin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: khams gsum pa ni rang gi sa pa'i sred pa dag gis bdag gir byas pa yin pas dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas brtas par 'gyur ba dang de'i rnam par smin pa yin gyi /
translated: The three realms are appropriated by the craving of one's own level and are thus enhanced by the door of objective perception and concomitance.

original: spyod yul de ni khams gsum pa'i sred pa dag gis bdag gir byas pa ma yin pas dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas brtas par 'gyur ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: spyod yul de ni khams gsum pa'i sred pa dag gis bdag gir byas pa ma yin pas dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas brtas par 'gyur ba yang ma yin la /
translated: That domain is not appropriated by the craving of the three realms and is thus not enhanced by the door of objective perception and concomitance.

original: rnam par smin pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir de ni rnam par smin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir de ni rnam par smin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not a maturation because it is transcendent to the level of maturation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bas na de'i phyir khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ste de ni yul phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bas na de'i phyir khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ste de ni yul phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: Since it is similar to nirvana, it is said to transcend the three realms.

original: de ltar yul phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar yul phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of the object,

original: gal te khams gsum pa'i sred pa dag gis bdag gir ma byas pa dang rnam par smin pa'i sa las 'das pa'i phyir de'i rnam par smin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te khams gsum pa'i sred pa dag gis bdag gir ma byas pa dang rnam par smin pa'i sa las 'das pa'i phyir de'i rnam par smin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: if it is not appropriated by the craving of the three realms and it transcends the level of karmic maturation, then it is not karmic maturation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba yin na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba yin na /
translated: If it is similar to nirvana,

original: de lta na de mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bar rgyu med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na de mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bar rgyu med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be the error of being causeless, like nirvana.

original: ci ste rgyu can zhig yin na ni khams gsum pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur bas de'i rgyu khams gsum pa las gzhan pa 'ga' zhig brjod dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu can zhig yin na ni khams gsum pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur bas de'i rgyu khams gsum pa las gzhan pa 'ga' zhig brjod dgos so zhe na /
translated: But if it has a cause, then it would be the domain of the three realms, so one must state that its cause is something other than the three realms.

original: de'i phyir rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the perfection of the cause,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said to arise from the root of the merit of the supramundane, which is superior to that.

original: @9b de la 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //🔽de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes de nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: @9b de la 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so // de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes de nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: Here, the supramundane is nonconceptual intuition.🔽The root of the merit that is superior to that is just that pure mundane intuition attained subsequent to that nonconceptual intuition.

original: las byung ba zhes bya ba ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de la gnas phun sum tshogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa de byung ba ste /
analyzed: las byung ba zhes bya ba ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de la gnas phun sum tshogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa de byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from that root of merit, because that intuition of the pure mundane level arises from the root of merit of pure mundane intuition.

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes de nyid gnas phun sum tshogs pa'i rnam par rig par snang ba'i don to //
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes de nyid gnas phun sum tshogs pa'i rnam par rig par snang ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the appearance of the intuition of the perfection of the basis is just that pure mundane intuition.

original: de bas na de ni rgyu med pa yang ma yin la dbang po la sogs pa rgyu mi mthun pa las byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ni rgyu med pa yang ma yin la dbang po la sogs pa rgyu mi mthun pa las byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not arise without a cause, nor does it arise from an incompatible cause such as the sense organs.

original: gal te de lta na yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i chos de khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyur ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i chos de khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyur ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how could the pure mundane qualities that are attained subsequent to the nondiscernment transcend the three realms and be the cause of evolutionary development?

original: de ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes mi bya'i de las gzhan gang 'byung ba la ltos nas rgyu zhes brjod pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes mi bya'i de las gzhan gang 'byung ba la ltos nas rgyu zhes brjod pa tsam du zad de /
translated: They are not called the cause of evolutionary development, but are merely called the cause in the sense that something else arises from them.

original: dper na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas lam la rjes su shes pa'i bar gyi tshogs bcu drug po dag las 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog 'byung ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas lam la rjes su shes pa'i bar gyi tshogs bcu drug po dag las 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog 'byung ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, the sixteen steps of the path of meditation, from the perseverance for the knowledge of the teaching on suffering up to the subsequent knowledge with regard to the path, are the cause of the supreme mundane state.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na tshig gi don de 'di ltar yang bshad de /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na tshig gi don de 'di ltar yang bshad de /
translated: There is another explanation of the meaning of the words.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mo //
translated: The supramundane path is the path of the noble disciples and the solitary sages.

original: de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zag pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zag pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The root of merit of his guru is the uncontaminated root of merit of the Tathāgata himself.

original: las byung ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i dbang gis rnam par rig pa de lta bu snang ba la bya ste /
analyzed: las byung ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i dbang gis rnam par rig pa de lta bu snang ba la bya ste /
translated: Arisen from action means that such an appearance of representation arises from the power of that root of merit of the Tathāgata.

original: de ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the perfection of cause.

original: de ltar rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas de'i rang bzhin ci 'dra zhe na /🔽de'i phyir rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas de'i rang bzhin ci 'dra zhe na / de'i phyir rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of cause, what is its nature like?🔽Therefore, in terms of the perfection of nature, it is said to have the characteristic of a representation that is extremely pure and governed.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Its nature is to be connected with the characteristic of a representation that is extremely pure and governed.

original: de la shin tu rnam par dag cing zhes bya ba ni gnas phun sum tshogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa de nyid bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du shin tu sbyar ba byas te /🔽yang dag pa ma yin @10a * //
analyzed: de la shin tu rnam par dag cing zhes bya ba ni gnas phun sum tshogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa de nyid bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du shin tu sbyar ba byas te / yang dag pa ma yin @10a * //
translated: In that, “extremely pure” means that the very cognition that appears as the perfection of the basis is extremely well cultivated for three incalculable aeons.

original: pa'i kun du rtog pa bsal zhing gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i kun du rtog pa bsal zhing gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: It is extremely pure because it is free from unreal imagination and has the nature of the abandonment of the grasped and the grasper.

original: dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa dngos po rnams la 'dod dgur dbang sgyur ba dang 'dra bar shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rnam par rig pa des rnam par rig pa tsam gyi spyod yul
analyzed: dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa dngos po rnams la 'dod dgur dbang sgyur ba dang 'dra bar shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rnam par rig pa des rnam par rig pa tsam gyi spyod yul
translated: “ Mastery” means that just as a yogin who has achieved the bases of mastery has control over things as he wishes, so the extremely pure cognition has control over the domain of the mere cognition of reality,

original: rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid de la dgyes dgur dbang sgyur zhing mnga' mdzad pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid de la dgyes dgur dbang sgyur zhing mnga' mdzad pa'i don to //
translated: which is the nature of cognition itself. The meaning is that it is the lord of that.

original: rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gnas kyi rnam pa lta bur snang ba de nyid kyi sems kyi rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gnas kyi rnam pa lta bur snang ba de nyid kyi sems kyi rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The characteristic of consciousness is the characteristic of mere representation of mind, which is the appearance itself in the aspect of the abode.

original: rnam par rig pa las gzhan pa'i phyi rol na rin po che la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan med pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa las gzhan pa'i phyi rol na rin po che la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan med pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that apart from consciousness, there is no external thing such as jewels, etc.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi spyod yul du snang ba lus longs spyod dang / gnas kyi rnam par snang ba dag kyang rang rang gi rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin mod kyi de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pas bskyed pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba yin pas shin tu rnam par dag cing
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi spyod yul du snang ba lus longs spyod dang / gnas kyi rnam par snang ba dag kyang rang rang gi rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin mod kyi de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pas bskyed pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba yin pas shin tu rnam par dag cing
translated: The appearances in the domain of experience of ordinary beings, such as the body, enjoyments, and abode, are indeed the characteristics of their individual consciousnesses. However, they are generated by false imagination and appear as the grasped and grasper. Therefore, they are not completely pure and

original: dbang sgyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang sgyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: are not mastered.

original: 'di ni de las bzlog pa yin pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de las bzlog pa yin pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the opposite of that, and so it is called the purification of the Buddha land.

original: shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ltar bstan pa de'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ltar bstan pa de'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: This characteristic of the extremely pure and sovereignly powerful representation is also called the perfect result of the perfect cause.

original: de la ci'i phyir 'bras bu zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir 'bras bu zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called result?

original: rnam par rig pa las tha mi dad kyang yul gyi rnam pa lta bur snang bas 'bras bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa las tha mi dad kyang yul gyi rnam pa lta bur snang bas 'bras bu zhes bya ste /
translated: Although it is not different from representation, it is called result because it appears as the aspect of an object.

original: dper na zad par sngon po la sogs par snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyis de'i rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa la snang ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na zad par sngon po la sogs par snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyis de'i rnam pa'i rnam par rig pa la snang ba bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like the appearance of the representation of that aspect in those who have entered the meditative absorption of the totality of blue and so on.

original: de ni rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the perfection of nature.

original: de ltar rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of nature,

original: gnas ni bdag pos yongs su zin pa yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas ni bdag pos yongs su zin pa yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag po gang zhe na /
translated: since the abode is possessed by an owner, what is its owner?

original: de'i phyir bdag po phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag po phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the perfection of the owner,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The phrase “the abode of the tathāgatas” is stated.

original: de ni bdag po'i khyad par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni bdag po'i khyad par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no //
translated: This is the special abode of the Lord Buddha, not of others.

original: yang na des de byin gyis brlabs te zin pa dang / yongs su bzung ba @10b yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na des de byin gyis brlabs te zin pa dang / yongs su bzung ba @10b yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, it is the abode of those who have been empowered by him, who have been taken hold of by him, and who have been accepted by him, not of others.

original: de ni bdag po phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bdag po phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the perfection of the abode.

original: de ltar bdag po phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag po phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the perfection of the abode in this way,

original: bdag pos ni zham 'bring ba yongs su zin pa'i phyir bdag po phun sum tshogs pa la zham 'bring ba yang dgos pas de'i phyir zham 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: bdag pos ni zham 'bring ba yongs su zin pa'i phyir bdag po phun sum tshogs pa la zham 'bring ba yang dgos pas de'i phyir zham 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: the perfection of the retinue is now taught, since the perfection of the abode is required for the retinue that is taken hold of by the Lord.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa'i dge 'dun dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa'i dge 'dun dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: With an immeasurable saṅgha of bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar bdag po phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i gnas de ni zham 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa yang yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar bdag po phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i gnas de ni zham 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa yang yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The place that is endowed with the perfection of the master is also endowed with the perfection of attendants.

original: zham 'bring ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi rjes su gang 'gro ba de ni de'i zham 'bring ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zham 'bring ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi rjes su gang 'gro ba de ni de'i zham 'bring ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Attendants are those who follow after someone.

original: byang chub sems dpa' grangs las 'das pa dag de na yod pa'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' grangs las 'das pa dag de na yod pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there are innumerable bodhisattvas there.

original: 'o na zham 'bring ba nyan thos la sogs pa dag ma smos par ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun nyi tshe smos she na /
analyzed: 'o na zham 'bring ba nyan thos la sogs pa dag ma smos par ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun nyi tshe smos she na /
translated: But why is only the bodhisattva saṅgha mentioned, without mentioning the attendants such as the śrāvakas?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bdud bzhi la sogs pa dgra'i rnam pa thams cad phyir bzlog nus pas de dag ni de'i zham 'bring ba yin gyi nyan thos la sogs pas ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bdud bzhi la sogs pa dgra'i rnam pa thams cad phyir bzlog nus pas de dag ni de'i zham 'bring ba yin gyi nyan thos la sogs pas ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The bodhisattvas are able to turn back all the forms of enemies such as the four māras, so they are their attendants, but the śrāvakas and so on are not like that.

original: de ni zham 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zham 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: That is the perfection of attendants.

original: de ltar zham 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar zham 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the perfect attendants,

original: zham 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa la phyogs phun sum tshogs pa yang dgos pas /
analyzed: zham 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa la phyogs phun sum tshogs pa yang dgos pas /
translated: since one who possesses perfect attendants also needs a perfect location,

original: de'i phyir phyogs phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: in order to demonstrate the perfect location,

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa mtha' yas pa rnam par rgyu ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa mtha' yas pa rnam par rgyu ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the text says, “infinite gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, demigods, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, humans, and nonhumans roam there.”

original: lha la sogs pa nyid de na phyogs yin te gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa nyid de na phyogs yin te gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The gods and so on are the location there, not others.

original: gnas de ni khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul yin no zhes sngar bstan pa la lha la sogs pa de dag ni khams gsum par gtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: gnas de ni khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul yin no zhes sngar bstan pa la lha la sogs pa de dag ni khams gsum par gtogs pa yin na /
translated: Since it was previously taught that this location is the domain that transcends the three realms, and since the gods and so on belong to the three realms,

original: der ji ltar lha la sogs pa phyogs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: der ji ltar lha la sogs pa phyogs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: How could the gods, etc. be in the directions?

original: lha la sogs pa 'di dag kyang gnas phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par de lta bur snang ba'i rnam par rig pa mthong bar nus pa sha stag yin pas 'gal ba med do //🔽yang na lha la sogs pa de lta bu bstan @11a * //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa 'di dag kyang gnas phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par de lta bur snang ba'i rnam par rig pa mthong bar nus pa sha stag yin pas 'gal ba med do // yang na lha la sogs pa de lta bu bstan @11a * //
translated: There is no contradiction, because the gods, etc. are able to see the representations of the perfect place, and they are able to see the representations of the perfect place.

original: pas 'dul ba'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de dag lta bur sprul pa ste /
analyzed: pas 'dul ba'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de dag lta bur sprul pa ste /
translated: Or else, the gods, etc. are emanations in that form in order to mature those beings who are to be disciplined by that teaching.

original: dper na rgyal po ka pi na gdul ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po ka pi na gdul ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the Lord manifested the retinue of a universal monarch in order to discipline King Kapi.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bya ba'i don du rang rang gi lus lha la sogs pa'i cha byad sna tshogs dang ldan par sprul ba yin pas nyes pa med de /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bya ba'i don du rang rang gi lus lha la sogs pa'i cha byad sna tshogs dang ldan par sprul ba yin pas nyes pa med de /
translated: Or else, the bodhisattvas emanate their own bodies in various forms of gods, etc. in order to worship the Tathagata.

original: de ni phyogs phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyogs phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: There is no fault, because that is the perfect place.

original: de ltar phyogs phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas phyogs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de dag longs spyod ji lta bur bstan te gnas she na /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas phyogs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de dag longs spyod ji lta bur bstan te gnas she na /
translated: Having thus taught the perfect place, how do those who have the perfect place abide in perfect enjoyment?🔽

original: de'i phyir longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Having thus taught the excellence of the place, he now teaches the excellence of the enjoyment of those who possess the excellence of the place.🔽With regard to that, he says:

original: chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen po'i longs spyod kyis bstan te de na gnas so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen po'i longs spyod kyis bstan te de na gnas so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: They enjoy the great joy and bliss of the taste of Dharma.

original: ston pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ston pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word “teacher” is used

original: zas de gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas de gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that food is the cause of their abiding.

original: chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen po des kyang de dag gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni de dag gi ston pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen po des kyang de dag gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni de dag gi ston pa yin no //
translated: And because they abide in that great joy and bliss of the taste of Dharma, he is their teacher.

original: 'o na gnas de ni khams gsum las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul yin no zhes sngar bstan /
analyzed: 'o na gnas de ni khams gsum las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul yin no zhes sngar bstan /
translated: But previously it was taught that that place is the domain of one who has transcended the three realms.

original: de na zas yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de na zas yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How then can there be food there?

original: gal te zag pa med pa'i chos de dag gi zas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zag pa med pa'i chos de dag gi zas yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the food of those uncontaminated dharmas,

original: de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: That is also illogical.

original: zas ni srid pa gso bar byed pa yin gyi de ni srid pa gcod par byed pa yin pas de dag zas kyis gnas zhes byar mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: zas ni srid pa gso bar byed pa yin gyi de ni srid pa gcod par byed pa yin pas de dag zas kyis gnas zhes byar mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: Food sustains existence, but since that is the severence of existence, it is illogical to say that they abide through food.

original: de ni dper na gzugs la sogs pa'i khams su 'phags pa dag zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa na des de dag gi lus gnas par gyur pa dang 'dra bar zag pa med pa'i chos ni de dag gi zas dang 'dra bar
analyzed: de ni dper na gzugs la sogs pa'i khams su 'phags pa dag zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa na des de dag gi lus gnas par gyur pa dang 'dra bar zag pa med pa'i chos ni de dag gi zas dang 'dra bar
translated: That is like the noble ones abiding in uncontaminated meditative attainment, since the elements of form and so on sustain their bodies.

original: ston pa yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: ston pa yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since uncontaminated phenomena are like their food, there is no contradiction.

original: gal te 'phags pa dag gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas su zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin des gnas pa ma yin gyi sngon 'das pa'i dus su zas gang yang rung ba ston pa'i zas da
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa dag gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas su zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin des gnas pa ma yin gyi sngon 'das pa'i dus su zas gang yang rung ba ston pa'i zas da
translated: If the noble ones who enter uncontaminated meditative attainment in the abodes of form and so on do not abide through that uncontaminated meditative attainment but abide through food that sustains them in the past,

original: ltar gnas pa yin pas dpe de mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: ltar gnas pa yin pas dpe de mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: then that example is illogical.

original: de dag 'das pa'i zas dang ldan zhes byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de dag 'das pa'i zas dang ldan zhes byar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable to say that they abide by means of past food.

original: 'das pa ni med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa ni med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the past does not exist.

original: de dang 'dra bar 'dir yang gal te de dag de na zag pa med pa'i @11b chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa ma yin gyi 'das pa'i dus kyi zas gzhan gyis bstan te gnas par gyur na med pas bstan te gnas pa'i
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar 'dir yang gal te de dag de na zag pa med pa'i @11b chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa ma yin gyi 'das pa'i dus kyi zas gzhan gyis bstan te gnas par gyur na med pas bstan te gnas pa'i
translated: If they were to abide by means of past food, it would be like saying that they abide by means of non existent food.

original: skyon du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: skyon du 'gyur bas /
translated: That would be a fault.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni 'das pa'i zas kyis bstan te gnas pa ma yin gyi chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni 'das pa'i zas kyis bstan te gnas pa ma yin gyi chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore they do not abide by means of past food, but they abide by means of the great joy and bliss of the taste of Dharma.

original: de ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the excellence of enjoyment.

original: de ltar longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the excellence of enjoyment,

original: longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de'i phrin las ci mdzad ce na /
analyzed: longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de'i phrin las ci mdzad ce na /
translated: what is the activity of those who possess the excellence of enjoyment?

original: de'i phyir bya ba sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /🔽sems can gyi don thams cad yang dag par thob par byed par nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas / sems can gyi don thams cad yang dag par thob par byed par nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, with the aim of teaching the perfection of accomplishing activity,🔽he says, “it is present in order to bring about the attainment of all the aims of sentient beings.”

original: sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba thams cad yang dag par thob par byed pas de'i nye bar gnas pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba thams cad yang dag par thob par byed pas de'i nye bar gnas pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is present in order to bring about the attainment of all the aims of all sentient beings.

original: don thams cad ces bya ba ni phan pa dang bde ba'i don to //
analyzed: don thams cad ces bya ba ni phan pa dang bde ba'i don to //
translated: All aims refers to the aims of benefit and happiness.

original: tshe 'di la phan pa dang tshe phyi ma la bde ba'o //🔽yang na 'jig rten pa'i don ni phan pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la phan pa dang tshe phyi ma la bde ba'o // yang na 'jig rten pa'i don ni phan pa'o //
translated: Benefit is in this life, and happiness is in future lives.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don ni bde ba'o //
translated: Or, mundane aims are benefit, and supramundane aims are happiness.

original: 'o na gnas de ni mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid de mngon par 'du byed pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gnas de ni mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid de mngon par 'du byed pa med pa yin na /
translated: But that stage has the characteristic of being unshakable, and it is not something that is formed.

original: ji ltar na sems can gyi don thams cad yang dag par thob par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems can gyi don thams cad yang dag par thob par byed ce na /
translated: So how does it bring about the attainment of all the aims of sentient beings?

original: de ni dper na 'phags pa rnams zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs kyang sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pa'i dbang gis sems can gyi don mdzad pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni dper na 'phags pa rnams zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs kyang sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pa'i dbang gis sems can gyi don mdzad pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be seen as being like the noble ones who, even while absorbed in the meditative concentration of peace, continuously perform the welfare of sentient beings by the power of their previous aspirations.

original: de ni bya ba sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bya ba sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the perfection of the accomplishment of activity.

original: de ltar bya ba sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bya ba sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of the accomplishment of activity,

original: bya ba sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa de la 'tshe ba med pa yang dgos pas de'i phyir 'tshe ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa de la 'tshe ba med pa yang dgos pas de'i phyir 'tshe ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: since the perfection of the accomplishment of activity requires the perfection of non-violence, therefore, in order to demonstrate the perfection of non-violence,

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said: “free from all harm of the stains of the afflictions.

original: de ni rang gi nang gi rgyud las byung ba'i gnod pa med par ston to //
analyzed: de ni rang gi nang gi rgyud las byung ba'i gnod pa med par ston to //
translated: ” This shows the absence of harm arising from one’s own continuum.

original: de la nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the so-called afflictions are attachment and so forth.

original: dri ma zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa de dag nyid dri ma'o //
analyzed: dri ma zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa de dag nyid dri ma'o //
translated: The so-called defilements are the very afflictions.

original: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma las byung ba'i gnod pa ste sdug bsngal sna tshogs so //
analyzed: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma las byung ba'i gnod pa ste sdug bsngal sna tshogs so //
translated: The so-called harm is the harm arising from the defilements of the afflictions, namely the various sufferings.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma de dag ni gnod @12a * //🔽pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma de dag ni gnod @12a * // pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Those defilements of the afflictions are the cause of harm.

original: de dag med pas de las byung ba'i gnod pa yang med do //
analyzed: de dag med pas de las byung ba'i gnod pa yang med do //
translated: Since they do not exist, the harm arising from them also does not exist.

original: 'o na de ji ltar 'tshe ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ji ltar 'tshe ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that he is endowed with the absence of harm?

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri mas byas pa'i gnod pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid 'tshe ba med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri mas byas pa'i gnod pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid 'tshe ba med pa yang yin te /
translated: That very absence of harm created by the defilements of the afflictions is also the absence of harm.

original: dper na bdag pos phan ma btags kyang ma gtses pa'i phyir bdag gi rje bo dpon gyis ma gtses so zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na bdag pos phan ma btags kyang ma gtses pa'i phyir bdag gi rje bo dpon gyis ma gtses so zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, even though the master does not benefit, since he does not harm, it is said that the master does not harm the self.

original: de ni 'tshe ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'tshe ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the perfection of the absence of harm.

original: de ltar 'tshe ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'tshe ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the perfection of the absence of harm,🔽he now teaches the perfection of equanimity.

original: nang gi gnod pa med pas 'tshe ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa la phyi rol gyi gnod pa'i rgyu yang med pas de'i phyir phyir rgol ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bdud thams cad yongs su spangs pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: nang gi gnod pa med pas 'tshe ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa la phyi rol gyi gnod pa'i rgyu yang med pas de'i phyir phyir rgol ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bdud thams cad yongs su spangs pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Since there is no internal harm, there is the perfection of non-violence. Since there is no cause of external harm, therefore, in terms of the perfection of the absence of adversaries, it is said that “all demons are completely abandoned.🔽”

original: des ni phyi rol gyi gnod pa med par ston to //
analyzed: des ni phyi rol gyi gnod pa med par ston to //
translated: This shows the absence of external harm.

original: de la bdud thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu'i bdud rnams so //
analyzed: de la bdud thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu'i bdud rnams so //
translated: “All demons” refers to the demons of the aggregates, afflictions, Lord of Death, and the son of the gods.

original: yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba ni de ngag gis de yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba ni de ngag gis de yongs su spangs te /
translated: “Completely abandoned” means that by that, they are completely abandoned.

original: de dag gis der mi brdzi ba'am des de dag yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: de dag gis der mi brdzi ba'am des de dag yongs su spangs te /
translated: They do not oppress him there, or he completely abandons them.

original: de na de dag med pa'o //
analyzed: de na de dag med pa'o //
translated: They do not exist there.

original: bdud de dag ni phyir rgol ba yin te de dag las rgyal nas ni de'i phyir rgol ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud de dag ni phyir rgol ba yin te de dag las rgyal nas ni de'i phyir rgol ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: Those demons are adversaries. Having conquered them, therefore, there is the perfection of the absence of adversaries.

original: de ltar phyir rgol ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyir rgol ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the perfection of the absence of adversaries,

original: phyir rgol ba med pa de'i phun sum tshogs pa de'i gnas kyi khyad par ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba med pa de'i phun sum tshogs pa de'i gnas kyi khyad par ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: what is the special location of that perfection of the absence of adversaries?

original: de'i phyir gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas thams cad kyi bkod pa las lhag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa'i gnas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas thams cad kyi bkod pa las lhag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa'i gnas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the perfection of location, he says, “the location of the Tathagata’s array, surpassing all arrays.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dam gzhan dag gi bkod pa las lhag pa ste /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dam gzhan dag gi bkod pa las lhag pa ste /
translated: ” That is, it surpasses the arrays of all Bodhisattvas or others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa dang ldan pa'i gnas yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa dang ldan pa'i gnas yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is the location endowed with the Tathagata’s array.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas nyid de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas nyid de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It appears as the Tathagata’s location.

original: thams cad kyi gnas las khyad par du 'phags pas na de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi gnas las khyad par du 'phags pas na de ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: That is the meaning. Since it is superior to all locations, it is the perfection of location.

original: de ltar gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the perfection of location,

original: der 'gro ba'i lam ci 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: der 'gro ba'i lam ci 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What is the path that goes there?

original: de'i phyir bdag po'i gnas kyi bye brag phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang @12b du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag po'i gnas kyi bye brag phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang @12b du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the perfection of the specific abode of the lord,

original: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “the emergence of great mindfulness, understanding, and realization.”

original: de la dran pa zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste /
translated: Therein, “mindfulness” is the wisdom born of listening,

original: thos na don phyin ci ma log par mngon par rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos na don phyin ci ma log par mngon par rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, having listened, one perfectly realizes the meaning without error.

original: blo gros zhes bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: blo gros zhes bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste /
translated: “Understanding” is the wisdom born of reflection,

original: thos pa'i don rig pas nges par rtogs par byed pa la nges pa'i blo gros skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa'i don rig pas nges par rtogs par byed pa la nges pa'i blo gros skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, having understood the meaning of what was heard, one generates the understanding that ascertains.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ste /
translated: “Realization” is the wisdom born of meditation,

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one realizes reality by the power of meditation.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni dran pa la sogs pa gsum char dang sbyar ta /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni dran pa la sogs pa gsum char dang sbyar ta /
translated: “Great” is applied to all three—mindfulness and so on—🔽and

original: de yang theg pa chen po'i chos la dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir dang theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / theg pa chen pos bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang theg pa chen po'i chos la dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir dang theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / theg pa chen pos bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called great because it arises from the observation of the Mahāyāna Dharma, it is the result of the Mahāyāna, and it is included in the Mahāyāna.

original: nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'dis nges par 'byung ba ste lam mo //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'dis nges par 'byung ba ste lam mo //
translated: It is called a going forth because it is a path that goes forth.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' de dag dran pa la sogs pa'i lam 'dis gnas nges nges par 'byung bas dran pa la sogs pas nges par 'byung bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' de dag dran pa la sogs pa'i lam 'dis gnas nges nges par 'byung bas dran pa la sogs pas nges par 'byung bar sbyar te /
translated: And because the bodhisattvas go forth by this path of mindfulness, etc., it is called a going forth by mindfulness, etc.

original: de ni bdag po'i gnas kyi bye brag phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bdag po'i gnas kyi bye brag phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the perfection of the special abode of the master.

original: de ltar bdag po'i gnas kyi bye brag phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas gang la zhon nas der 'jug pa'i bzhon pa yang dgos pas de'i phyir bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag po'i gnas kyi bye brag phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas gang la zhon nas der 'jug pa'i bzhon pa yang dgos pas de'i phyir bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of the special abode of the master, in order to teach the perfection of the vehicle, which is the vehicle by which one goes to that abode, he says,🔽The vehicle is the six perfections.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chen po bzhon pa yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chen po bzhon pa yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Great serenity and insight are the vehicle.

original: de la zhi gnas zhes bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de la zhi gnas zhes bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Serenity is one-pointedness of mind, concentration.

original: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni khyad par du mthong ba ste shes rab bo //
analyzed: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni khyad par du mthong ba ste shes rab bo //
translated: Insight is the special seeing, wisdom.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Great is as before.

original: de gnyis mnyam par 'jug pa ni bzhon pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis mnyam par 'jug pa ni bzhon pa yin te /
translated: The union of those two is the vehicle.

original: de gnyis kyi sa lam de nas gnas der 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi sa lam de nas gnas der 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because one goes to that place, the stage, by means of those two.

original: de ni bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: That is the perfection of the vehicle.

original: de ltar bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of the vehicle,

original: bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de sgo gang nas der 'jug par 'gyur ba'i sgo yang dgos pas de'i phyir sgo phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de sgo gang nas der 'jug par 'gyur ba'i sgo yang dgos pas de'i phyir sgo phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: since it is also necessary to teach the perfection of the door through which one who possesses the perfection of the vehicle enters there, therefore, in order to demonstrate the perfection of the door,🔽he says,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The great doors of liberation are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de la rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol pa ste mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol pa ste mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Liberation is nirvana.

original: sgo zhes bya ba ni sgo mo ste /
analyzed: sgo zhes bya ba ni sgo mo ste /
translated: A door is an entrance.

original: @13a * // mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: @13a * // mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i thabs so //
translated: It is a means of attaining nirvana.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Great is as before.

original: de yang dngos su na stong pa nyid la sogs pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po yin te /
analyzed: de yang dngos su na stong pa nyid la sogs pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po yin te /
translated: Moreover, emptiness and so forth are actually the great doors of liberation.

original: sgo de nas der 'jug par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgo de nas der 'jug par sbyar ro //
translated: They are connected with entering there through that door.

original: de la stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos bdag med pa ste /
translated: Emptiness refers to the selflessness of phenomena.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos med pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos med pa'o //
translated: It is the nonexistence of phenomena that are imagined natures.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The samadhi that focuses on that is called the great door of liberation that is emptiness.🔽Signlessness refers to the nonexistence of the three signs of the contaminated.

original: mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba la mtshan ma ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams dang skyes pa dang / bud med dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba la mtshan ma ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams dang skyes pa dang / bud med dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The signless means that which is devoid of signs. Signs are form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility, and male and female, birth and death, etc.

original: de dag gang la med pa de ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gang la med pa de ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: That which is devoid of those is signless.

original: de yang gang zhe na mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: What is that? It is nirvana.

original: de ni mtshan ma thams cad bsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma thams cad bsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the nature of the elimination of all signs.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: The samadhi that focuses on that is called the signless gate of liberation.

original: / smon pa med pa zhes bya ba la smon pa ni smon lam ste 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: / smon pa med pa zhes bya ba la smon pa ni smon lam ste 'dod pa'o //
translated: The wishless means that which is devoid of wish. Wish is prayer, desire.

original: de gang la med pa ni smon pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de gang la med pa ni smon pa med pa ste /
translated: That which is devoid of that is wishless.

original: de yang gang zhe na khams gsum pa sdug bsngal bar mthong na de la smon par bya ba med do snyam nas der smon lam mi 'de bas ba ni smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na khams gsum pa sdug bsngal bar mthong na de la smon par bya ba med do snyam nas der smon lam mi 'de bas ba ni smon pa med pa'o //
translated: What is that? It is the absence of expectancy, thinking, “If the three realms are seen as suffering, then there is no expectancy of them.”

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo chen po smon pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo chen po smon pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The samadhi that focuses on that is called the “absence of expectancy,” which is a gateway to liberation.

original: nas 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po de dag nas der 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: nas 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po de dag nas der 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The phrase “from which one enters” is connected to the phrase “one enters through those gateways to liberation, such as emptiness.”

original: de ni sgo phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sgo phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: That is the perfection of the gateway.

original: de ltar sgo phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sgo phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of the gateway,

original: sgo phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de gzhal med khang gzhan dag bzhin du gang la brten pa'i rten kyang dgos pa de'i phyir rten phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: sgo phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de gzhal med khang gzhan dag bzhin du gang la brten pa'i rten kyang dgos pa de'i phyir rten phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: the following is stated in order to teach the perfection of the support, which is necessary as the basis for those who possess the perfection of the gateway, just as there must be a basis for a palace.🔽With regard to that, the phrase “the perfection of the support” is stated first.

original: rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po chen po yon tan mtha' yas pas brgyan pa'i bkod pa la brten pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po chen po yon tan mtha' yas pas brgyan pa'i bkod pa la brten pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The great king of precious lotuses is said to be based on the array adorned with infinite qualities.

original: dper na chu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la brten pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i gzhal med khang dag pa dang nam mkha' la brten pa bzhin du gzhal med khang 'di yang rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po chen po yon tan mtha' yas pas brgyan pa'i bkod pa la brten te @13b zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na chu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la brten pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i gzhal med khang dag pa dang nam mkha' la brten pa bzhin du gzhal med khang 'di yang rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po chen po yon tan mtha' yas pas brgyan pa'i bkod pa la brten te @13b zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: For example, just as the circle of water and so on are based on the circle of earth and so on, and the worldly celestial palaces are based on the pure space, so too this celestial palace is based on the great king of precious lotuses adorned with the array of infinite qualities.

original: de la rin po che'i padma zhes bya ba ni padma de nyid rin po che yang yin la padma yang yin te /
analyzed: de la rin po che'i padma zhes bya ba ni padma de nyid rin po che yang yin la padma yang yin te /
translated: Among them, precious lotus means that very lotus is a precious jewel and also a lotus.

original: rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi padma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi padma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means a lotus with the nature of a precious jewel.

original: rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba ni de nyid rin po che'i rgyal po chen po yang yin la padma'i rgyal po chen po yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba ni de nyid rin po che'i rgyal po chen po yang yin la padma'i rgyal po chen po yang yin pa'o //
translated: Great king means that very lotus is a great precious king and also a great lotus king.

original: yang na rin po che'i padma ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs las byung ba 'khor gyi padma dag yin no //
analyzed: yang na rin po che'i padma ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs las byung ba 'khor gyi padma dag yin no //
translated: Or else, the jeweled lotuses are the lotuses of the retinue, which arise from the blessings of the bodhisattvas.

original: rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa de dag gi bla ma ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa de dag gi bla ma ste /
translated: The great king is the guru of those bodhisattvas, etc.

original: chos kyi rgyal po chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i padma chen po nyid yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i padma chen po nyid yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The great Dharma king is the Bhagavat Buddha, who is the great lotus that arises from the root of virtue.

original: yon tan mtha' yas pas brgyan pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa che ba'i yon tan las rgyan sna tshogs su grub pa'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas pas brgyan pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa che ba'i yon tan las rgyan sna tshogs su grub pa'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: Adorned with infinite qualities means that the great array of the various ornaments is established from the great qualities of the Buddha's powers, fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: bkod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyan de'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: bkod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyan de'i khyad par ro //
translated: Array means the particular ornament.🔽The particular array of that ornament is the great array.

original: la brten pa zhes bya ba ni rgyan de'i khyad par gyi bkod pa chen po de la gzhal med khang de brten ces bya ba'i tha chig ste /
analyzed: la brten pa zhes bya ba ni rgyan de'i khyad par gyi bkod pa chen po de la gzhal med khang de brten ces bya ba'i tha chig ste /
translated: The palace is supported by that.

original: de ni rten phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rten phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the excellence of the support.

original: na bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni rgyan gyi bkod pa chen po la brten pa'i gzhal med khang chen po de na bcom ldan 'das bzhugs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: na bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni rgyan gyi bkod pa chen po la brten pa'i gzhal med khang chen po de na bcom ldan 'das bzhugs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase was dwelling is to be supplied with the phrase in that great palace which is the array of great adornments, the Lord was dwelling.

original: bzhugs zhes bya ba ni spyod lam dang / lha dang tshangs pa dang / 'phags pa'i bzhugs pa bla na med pa dag gis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhugs zhes bya ba ni spyod lam dang / lha dang tshangs pa dang / 'phags pa'i bzhugs pa bla na med pa dag gis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The word dwelling means that he was dwelling in the unsurpassed dwellings of the gods, Brahma, and the noble ones.

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the excellence of the abode has been explained.

original: // / ci 'dra ba cig bzhugs she na //
analyzed: // / ci 'dra ba cig bzhugs she na //
translated: What kind of dwelling was it?

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: It was the excellence of the qualities.

original: de'i phyir de'i dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in terms of that, the phrase the Lord is stated.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa ni de las gzhan pa'i ston pa rnams las khyad par du bya ba dang / gzhan dag kyang dang ba rab tu bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa ni de las gzhan pa'i ston pa rnams las khyad par du bya ba dang / gzhan dag kyang dang ba rab tu bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the excellence of the qualities of the Lord is taught in order to distinguish him from other teachers and to generate faith in others.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: Its excellence should be understood as having twenty one aspects.

original: mngon par byang chub ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / sgrib pa mi mnga' pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / 'dul ba'i thabs kyi yon tan gyi khyad par dang / 'dul ba la so sor rtog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang /🔽sangs rgyas thams cad dang phrin las kyi @14a * //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / sgrib pa mi mnga' pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / 'dul ba'i thabs kyi yon tan gyi khyad par dang / 'dul ba la so sor rtog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / sangs rgyas thams cad dang phrin las kyi @14a * //
translated: The excellence of the qualities of manifest enlightenment, the excellence of the qualities of being free of the obscurations, the excellence of the qualities of the means of training, the excellence of the qualities of discernment with regard to training,

original: mdzad pa mthun pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / mu stegs can zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / bdud zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang /
analyzed: mdzad pa mthun pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / mu stegs can zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / bdud zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang /
translated: the excellence of the qualities of the activities of all buddhas being the same, the excellence of the qualities of eliminating adverse factors, the excellence of the qualities of overpowering the tirthikas, the excellence of the qualities of overpowering Mara,

original: chos bstan pa rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / dus gsum lung ston pa yon tan gyi khyad par dang / dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'bab pa la sogs pa kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / the tshom gyi rnam pa thams cad gcod pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang /
analyzed: chos bstan pa rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / dus gsum lung ston pa yon tan gyi khyad par dang / dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'bab pa la sogs pa kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / the tshom gyi rnam pa thams cad gcod pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang /
translated: the quality of teaching the Dharma, the quality of prophesying the three times, the quality of displaying the descent from the Tusita palace and so on, the quality of resolving all doubts,

original: theg pa thams cad kyis 'dul ba de dag la snang ba'i sku kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / shin tu rnam par mkhyen nas ci rigs par gdams ngag stsol ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sku yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang /
analyzed: theg pa thams cad kyis 'dul ba de dag la snang ba'i sku kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / shin tu rnam par mkhyen nas ci rigs par gdams ngag stsol ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sku yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang /
translated: the quality of displaying the body that appears to those to be tamed by all vehicles, the quality of giving instructions through thorough knowledge, the quality of upholding the body free of afflictions,

original: sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par sbyor ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi sku la bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / sangs rgyas kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par sbyor ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi sku la bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / sangs rgyas kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang /
translated: the special qualities that connect one to the lineage of the Buddha without interruption, the special qualities that abide in the nature body of the Buddha, the special qualities that abide in the enjoyment body of the Buddha,

original: mtshan nyid kyi yon tan gyi khyad par dang / 'bras bu thob pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / yon tan mi zad pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi yon tan gyi khyad par dang / 'bras bu thob pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / yon tan mi zad pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ro //
translated: the special qualities of the characteristics, the special qualities of attaining the result, and the special qualities of inexhaustible qualities.

original: phun sum tshogs pa nyi shu gcig po de dag ni mdo las /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa nyi shu gcig po de dag ni mdo las /
translated: These twenty-one perfections are mentioned in the sutra:

original: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Endowed with a well-understood mind…”

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa de zhes gsungs pa'i tshig nyi shu rtsa gcig dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa de zhes gsungs pa'i tshig nyi shu rtsa gcig dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: and so forth, up to “…the extent of the realm of space.”

original: de la dang por mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la dang por mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: First, in order to demonstrate the special qualities of manifest, complete enlightenment,

original: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “endowed with the mind that fully comprehends.”

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The mind that fully comprehends is endowed with the mind that fully comprehends the existence of all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena just as they are and the existence of all phenomena just as they seem to be.

original: de la legs par bya ba'i tshig gi don ni rtogs par bya ba legs par rtogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par rtogs pa dang / ma lus par rtogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la legs par bya ba'i tshig gi don ni rtogs par bya ba legs par rtogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par rtogs pa dang / ma lus par rtogs pa'i don to //
translated: Here, the meaning of the word “fully” is to fully comprehend, to fully perfect, and to fully complete what is to be comprehended.

original: thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ji snyed pa nyid dang ji @14b lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid rtogs par thugs su chud pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ji snyed pa nyid dang ji @14b lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid rtogs par thugs su chud pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' ba ste /
translated: “Endowed with the mind that fully comprehends” means possessing the knowledge that fully comprehends the existence of all phenomena just as they are and the existence of all phenomena just as they seem to be.

original: de ni mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the special quality of the perfection of enlightenment.

original: de'i 'og tu sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special quality of the absence of obscuration, he says:

original: kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He does not have the two kinds of conduct.

original: byis pa dang nyan thos kyi spyod pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: byis pa dang nyan thos kyi spyod pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The two kinds of conduct of the childish and the śrāvakas are connected with the absence of the two obscurations, that of affliction and that of the knowable.

original: de la byis pa'i kun du spyod pa ni 'khor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: de la byis pa'i kun du spyod pa ni 'khor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: The conduct of the childish is the defilement of saṃsāra,

original: de'i bdag nyid gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the abode of that nature.

original: nyan thos kyi kun du spyod pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu nges pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi kun du spyod pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu nges pa ste /
translated: The conduct of the śrāvakas is the certainty of nirvāṇa,

original: gzhan gyi don bya ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bya ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it turns its back on the performance of the welfare of others.

original: de ltar na byis pa'i kun du spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na byis pa'i kun du spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Thus, the conduct of the childish is of the nature of the obscuration of affliction,

original: nyan thos kyi kun du spyod pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin yin pas de gnyis ni sgrib pa med pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi kun du spyod pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rang bzhin yin pas de gnyis ni sgrib pa med pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ma yin gyi /
