translated: The conduct of the śrāvakas is of the nature of the obscurations to omniscience. Therefore, they do not possess the special quality of being free from obscurations.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhugs pa yin pas de la kun du spyod pa de gnyis mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhugs pa yin pas de la kun du spyod pa de gnyis mi mnga' ste /
translated: But the Bhagavat abides in non-abiding nirvāṇa, and therefore he does not have those two kinds of conduct.

original: de ni sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the special quality of being free from obscurations.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dul ba'i thabs kyi yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dul ba'i thabs kyi yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special quality of the method of training,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he said, “He is the one who is dedicated to the supreme Dharma that is devoid of characteristics.”

original: de la mtshan nyid med pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid med pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Therein, the Dharma that is devoid of characteristics is nirvāṇa.

original: mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa gsum gyis sems can rnams der 'dul ba'i thabs yongs su mkhyen nas de bzhin du ston cing de dag der gzhol ba dang / 'bab pa dang / bab par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa gsum gyis sems can rnams der 'dul ba'i thabs yongs su mkhyen nas de bzhin du ston cing de dag der gzhol ba dang / 'bab pa dang / bab par mdzad pa ste /
translated: The phrase he is intent on the supreme means that he is aware of the means of training beings in accordance with their spiritual gene in the three vehicles, and he teaches them accordingly. He is intent on that, he is inclined toward that, and he is devoted to that.

original: de ni 'dul ba'i thabs kyi yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dul ba'i thabs kyi yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the special quality of his skill in means with regard to training.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dul ba las so sor rtog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dul ba las so sor rtog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, the special quality of his discernment of training is taught.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The phrase he is abiding in the Buddha's abode is stated from the perspective of that.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir thugs rje chen pos nyin mtshan du lan drug tu 'jig rten la gzigs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir thugs rje chen pos nyin mtshan du lan drug tu 'jig rten la gzigs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: There, the phrase Buddha's abode refers to great compassion, which is applied to the six times of day and night in order to view the world.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i gnas pas rtag tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i gnas pas rtag tu gnas pa ste /
translated: The phrase abiding means that he always abides in that abode.

original: de ni 'dul ba la so @15a * //
analyzed: de ni 'dul ba la so @15a * //
translated: This is the special quality of his discernment of training.

original: sor rtog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: sor rtog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the special quality of discerning wisdom.

original: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas thams cad dang / phrin las kyi mdzad pa mthun pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas thams cad dang / phrin las kyi mdzad pa mthun pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special quality of the concordant activity of all buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it says, “attains the state of equality with all buddhas.”

original: de la sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang phrin las mthun par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang phrin las mthun par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Here, “equality with all buddhas” means to engage in concordant activity with all buddhas.

original: brnyes pa zhes bya ba ni de dag dang phrin las mnyam ba nyid brnyes pa ste /
analyzed: brnyes pa zhes bya ba ni de dag dang phrin las mnyam ba nyid brnyes pa ste /
translated: “Attains” means to attain the state of equality with them.

original: de ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang phrin las kyi mdzad ba mthun pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang phrin las kyi mdzad ba mthun pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the special quality of the concordant activity of all buddhas.

original: de'i 'og tu mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special quality of abandoning the discordant class,🔽it says,

original: sgrib pa med pa'i rtogs pa thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i rtogs pa thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The statement “he has realized the knowledge that is free of obscurations” is made.

original: de la sgrib pa med pa'i rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la sgrib pa med pa'i rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i ye shes so //
translated: Therein, “the knowledge that is free of obscurations” is the pristine wisdom that is free of all the obscurations of the mental afflictions and the obscurations to that which is to be known.

original: thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes mngon sum du mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes mngon sum du mdzad pa ste /
translated: “He has realized” means that he has abandoned all the obscurations and has actualized the pristine wisdom that is free of obscurations.

original: de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the special quality of having abandoned the opposing factors.

original: de'i 'og tu mu stegs can zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mu stegs can zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special quality of having overcome the tīrthikas, he said,

original: phyir mi zlogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: phyir mi zlogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “he possesses the Dharma that is irreversible.”

original: de la phyir mi zlogs pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can dag gis phyir zlog mi nus pa'i chos dang de dag zil gyis mnan nas yang dag pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de la phyir mi zlogs pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can dag gis phyir zlog mi nus pa'i chos dang de dag zil gyis mnan nas yang dag pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma that is not turned back is the Dharma that cannot be turned back by the tīrthikas, and the Dharma that teaches the right path after overpowering them.

original: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i chos kyi khyad par brnyes pa ste /
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i chos kyi khyad par brnyes pa ste /
translated: Endowed with means that he has attained such a special Dharma.

original: de ni mu stegs can zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni mu stegs can zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the special quality of the virtue of overpowering the tīrthikas.

original: de'i 'og tu bdud zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas spyod yul gyis mi 'phogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bdud zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas spyod yul gyis mi 'phogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special quality of the virtue of overpowering the māras, he said, “not disturbed by the sphere of activity.”

original: de la spyod yul zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams te /
analyzed: de la spyod yul zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams te /
translated: Therein, the sphere of activity is the objects such as form, etc.

original: de dag ni sems 'khrul par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa dang ; dge ba'i srog gi bar chad byed pa yin pa'i phyir bdud ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sems 'khrul par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa dang ; dge ba'i srog gi bar chad byed pa yin pa'i phyir bdud ces bya'o //
translated: They are called māras because they are the cause of confusing the mind and because they create obstacles to the life of virtue.

original: mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams shin tu yongs su rdzogs par bsgoms pas yul shin tu yid du 'ong bas kyang bar chad byed par mi nus te /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams shin tu yongs su rdzogs par bsgoms pas yul shin tu yid du 'ong bas kyang bar chad byed par mi nus te /
translated: Invincible means that since the Bhagavān has cultivated the bases of subjugation to a supreme degree, even extremely pleasant objects cannot create obstacles for him.

original: yul de dag zil gyis @15b gnon cing rjes su chags pa dang khor khro bar mi 'gyur bas spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yul de dag zil gyis @15b gnon cing rjes su chags pa dang khor khro bar mi 'gyur bas spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since he subjugates those objects and is neither attached nor averse to them, his domain is invincible.

original: de ni bdud zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni bdud zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is a special quality of the Buddha's subjugation of Māra.

original: de'i 'og tu chos bstan pa rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos bstan pa rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Next, in order to demonstrate the special qualities of the Buddha's teaching of the Dharma, the text reads:

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The inconceivable is well-established.

original: de la bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams ma gtogs par rtog ge'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams ma gtogs par rtog ge'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: The inconceivable means that it is beyond the scope of speculation, except for the Blessed Buddhas and the great bodhisattvas.

original: rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa bzhi rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa bzhi rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa ste /
translated: The establishment means the establishment of the fourfold presentation.

original: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rigs pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bden pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rigs pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa ste /
translated: It is the establishment of the inconceivable presentations of the teaching, the vehicle, the truths, and reasoning.

original: de ni chos bstan pa rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni chos bstan pa rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the special quality of the establishment of the teaching.

original: de'i 'og tu dus gsum lung ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dus gsum lung ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special quality of the prediction of the three times,🔽he says,

original: dus gsum la mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dus gsum la mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The verse says, “He is the one who has perfected the equality of the three times.”

original: de la dus gsum zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams so //
analyzed: de la dus gsum zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams so //
translated: Here, the three times are the past, the future, and the present.

original: mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i dus la ji lta ba bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus la'ang de bzhin du khyad par lung ston pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i dus la ji lta ba bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus la'ang de bzhin du khyad par lung ston pa ste /
translated: “ He has perfected the equality” means that he has taught the Dharma in the present just as he did in the past and will do in the future.

original: de ni dus gsum lung ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni dus gsum lung ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the special quality of his knowledge of the three times.

original: de'i 'og tu dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'bab pa la sogs pa kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'bab pa la sogs pa kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special quality of his knowledge of descending from the Tuṣita Palace and so on,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: in order to demonstrate the special quality of his knowledge of the bodies that pervade all world systems,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa'i rnam par thar par mdzad pa'i ye shes kyi mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa'i rnam par thar par mdzad pa'i ye shes kyi mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The Tathāgatas’ wisdom has reached the culmination of the performance of the unshared liberations.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku tha dad pa la bya ste /🔽de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa na 'khor sna tshogs kyi dkyil na byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos kyi @16a * //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku tha dad pa la bya ste / de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa na 'khor sna tshogs kyi dkyil na byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos kyi @16a * //
translated: Therein, the “unshared” of the Tathāgatas refers to the different Enjoyment Bodies of the Tathāgatas.

original: longs spyod rdzogs par myong bar mdzad cing rgyud tha dad par bzhugs pas na ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs par myong bar mdzad cing rgyud tha dad par bzhugs pas na ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those are called “unshared” because in the completely purified Buddha lands, in the midst of various assemblies, the Bodhisattvas experience the enjoyment of the Dharma, and because they abide in different continuums.

original: rnam par thar par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku des sems can rnams rnam par thar par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku des sems can rnams rnam par thar par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The “performance of the liberations” refers to the liberation of sentient beings by that Enjoyment Body.

original: ye shes mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus sems can rnams rnam par thar par mdzad pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de'i mthar byon cing de lta bu'i sku la rtag tu bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste
analyzed: ye shes mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus sems can rnams rnam par thar par mdzad pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de'i mthar byon cing de lta bu'i sku la rtag tu bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste
translated: The phrase “he has perfected transcendent wisdom” means that the Bhagavat has arrived at the culmination of the transcendent wisdom by which he liberates sentient beings through his enjoyment body. The phrase “he is always present in such a body” means that he is always present in an enjoyment body.

original: / de ni sangs rgyas kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: / de ni sangs rgyas kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the distinctive quality of the excellence of his abiding in a buddha’s enjoyment body.

original: de'i 'og tu mtshan nyid kyi yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mtshan nyid kyi yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the distinctive quality of the excellence of his characteristics,

original: mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyis mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyis mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: the root text says, “He has realized the equality of the buddhas, who are free of middle and end.”

original: de la mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: In this passage, the phrase “the buddhas, who are free of middle and end” refers to the tathāgatas.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi mtha' yongs su spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni mtha' med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi mtha' yongs su spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni mtha' med pa yin la /
translated: They are free of middle and end because they are characterized by the complete abandonment of the extremes of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: yul yongs su ma chad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni dbus med pa yin no //
analyzed: yul yongs su ma chad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni dbus med pa yin no //
translated: It is without middle because it is not characterized by any limited object.

original: yang na sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni mtha' med pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni mtha' med pa yin la /
translated: Or else, it is without end because it is characterized by the abandonment of the prior and subsequent limits.

original: da ltar mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni dbus med pa yin no //
analyzed: da ltar mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni dbus med pa yin no //
translated: It is without middle because it is characterized by the non-abiding in the present.

original: mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas de'i sa ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas de'i sa ste /
translated: The equality of the buddhas is the stage of the buddhas, which is without end or middle.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: It is the equality of the compounded and the uncompounded.

original: thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba ni sa mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de thugs su chud pa ste /
analyzed: thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba ni sa mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de thugs su chud pa ste /
translated: The realization is the realization of the equality of the stages.

original: de yang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas mnyam pa nyid du yongs su mkhyen pa dang / de la byis pa dang nyan thos kyi kun du spyod pa'i sgrib pa gnyis mi mnga' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas mnyam pa nyid du yongs su mkhyen pa dang / de la byis pa dang nyan thos kyi kun du spyod pa'i sgrib pa gnyis mi mnga' ba'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, it is the thorough knowledge of the equality of the compounded and the uncompounded, and the non-existence of the two obscurations of the childish and the śhrāvaka that pertain to that.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the special quality of the defining characteristic of the tathāgatas.

original: de'i 'og tu 'bras bu thob pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'bras bu thob pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special qualities of attaining the result,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he said, “The realm of phenomena is limitless.”

original: de la chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: There, the “realm of phenomena” is the pure realm of phenomena.

original: klas pa zhes bya ba ni gting slebs pa'am mthar thug pa'am rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: klas pa zhes bya ba ni gting slebs pa'am mthar thug pa'am rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ Limitless” means reaching the bottom, or reaching the end, or realizing, which is to say, it is a synonym for “realizing.”

original: de rtogs pa yang lam bsgoms pas mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu thob pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de rtogs pa yang lam bsgoms pas mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu thob pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: That realization is the attainment of the ultimate result through the cultivation of the path, and therefore it is the special quality of attaining the result.

original: de'i @16b 'og tu yon tan mi zad pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i @16b 'og tu yon tan mi zad pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special quality of inexhaustible qualities,

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he said, “The realm of space is limitless.”

original: dper na nam mkha' ni 'jig pa dang chags pa'i dus dag na yang zad mi shes bas mi zad pa dang dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa mtha' dag la khyab pas thams cad du song ba dang / 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du mu thug pa med par rgya che ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni 'jig pa dang chags pa'i dus dag na yang zad mi shes bas mi zad pa dang dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa mtha' dag la khyab pas thams cad du song ba dang / 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du mu thug pa med par rgya che ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, space is inexhaustible because it is not exhausted at the time of the destruction and formation of the world, it pervades all things and nonthings, it is all pervasive, and it is vast, being unbounded until the end of samsara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan thams cad 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i dus dag na yang zad mi shes pas mi zad pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan mtha' dag la khyab pas thams cad du song ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan thams cad 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i dus dag na yang zad mi shes pas mi zad pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan mtha' dag la khyab pas thams cad du song ba dang /
translated: Similarly, the inexhaustible qualities of the Tathagata are inexhaustible because they are not exhausted at the time of the arising and destruction of all the qualities of the Tathagata, they are all pervasive because they pervade all mundane and supramundane qualities,

original: 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du mu thug pa med par sems can gyi don mdzad pas rgya che ba yang yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du mu thug pa med par sems can gyi don mdzad pas rgya che ba yang yin te /
translated: and they are vast because they benefit sentient beings until the end of samsara.

original: de'i phyir rnam par mkhyen nas ci rigs par gdams ngag stsol ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par mkhyen nas ci rigs par gdams ngag stsol ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a special quality of the Buddha to give advice appropriately, having understood.

original: de'i 'og tu kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sku yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sku yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special qualities of the body that is free of all afflictions, he said, “He has a body that is not conceptualized.”

original: de la rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku zhes bya ba la so so'i skye bo'i lus ni rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku zhes bya ba la so so'i skye bo'i lus ni rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin te /
translated: In this regard, the body of ordinary beings is produced from conceptualization.

original: de yang spros pa las ni rnam par rtog pa skye la /
analyzed: de yang spros pa las ni rnam par rtog pa skye la /
translated: Conceptualization arises from mental proliferation.

original: rnam par rtog pa las ni las dang nyon mongs pa 'byung /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las ni las dang nyon mongs pa 'byung /
translated: Karma and afflictions arise from conceptualization.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa las ni sdug bsngal gyi lus bskyed /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa las ni sdug bsngal gyi lus bskyed /
translated: The body of suffering is produced from karma and afflictions.

original: lus de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi lus yin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba yin pas /
analyzed: lus de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi lus yin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba yin pas /
translated: That body is an afflicted body. Because the Tathāgata is free from all mental proliferation, he is free of conceptualization.

original: las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i lus can ma yin te /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i lus can ma yin te /
translated: He does not have a body produced by karma and afflictions.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa mnga' ba yin pas na de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sku yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa mnga' ba yin pas na de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sku yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: Since he possesses the inconceivable body that is not conceptualized, this is the distinctive quality of the retention of the body that is free from affliction.

original: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par sbyor ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par sbyor ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the distinctive quality of the application that does not interrupt the lineage of the buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ye shes yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ye shes yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “the perfect reception of the wisdom of all bodhisattvas.”

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par sbyor ba yin gyi nyan thos la sogs pa gzhan ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par sbyor ba yin gyi nyan thos la sogs pa gzhan ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, “all bodhisattvas” refers to the bodhisattvas who apply themselves to not interrupting the lineage of the buddhas, and not to others such as the śrāvakas.

original: ye shes yang dag par blangs pa @17a * //
analyzed: ye shes yang dag par blangs pa @17a * //
translated: The perfect reception of wisdom

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bdag gi ye shes su yang dag par blangs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bdag gi ye shes su yang dag par blangs pa ste /
translated: The wisdom of the buddhas is taken up by the bodhisattvas as their own wisdom.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan gdags pa'i dam pas phan btags pa dang / yongs su gtad pa'i dam pas yongs su gtad de /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan gdags pa'i dam pas phan btags pa dang / yongs su gtad pa'i dam pas yongs su gtad de /
translated: And the Tathagata benefits them with the highest benefit of bodhisattvas and entrusts them with the highest entrustment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar mdzad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar mdzad de /
translated: He liberates the bodhisattvas who are fully matured and he benefits them with the highest benefit.

original: phan gdags pa'i dam pas phan btags la yongs su ma smin pa rnams ni phan gdags pa rnams lang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir na khyed kyis 'di dag yongs su smin par gyis shig ces yongs su gtad pa'i dam pas yongs su gtad pa'i sgo
analyzed: phan gdags pa'i dam pas phan btags la yongs su ma smin pa rnams ni phan gdags pa rnams lang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir na khyed kyis 'di dag yongs su smin par gyis shig ces yongs su gtad pa'i dam pas yongs su gtad pa'i sgo
translated: He entrusts them with the highest entrustment, saying, You must bring to full maturity those who are not yet fully mature.🔽This is the section on the disciples.

original: nas de dag kyang sems bskyed pa dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / lung ston pa dang / dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'thob cing /
analyzed: nas de dag kyang sems bskyed pa dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / lung ston pa dang / dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'thob cing /
translated: and they will attain the gnosis of omniscience through the stages of generating the mind of enlightenment, going for refuge to the Three Jewels, practicing the Dharma in accordance with the teachings, realizing the teachings, receiving predictions, receiving empowerment, and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: The lineage of the buddhas will not be broken.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis de ltar sbyor bar mdzad pas na de ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par sbyor ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis de ltar sbyor bar mdzad pas na de ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par sbyor ba'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: Since the Bhagavān himself practices in that way, this is the special quality of engaging in not breaking the lineage of the buddhas.

original: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi sku la bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi sku la bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to explain the special qualities that exist in the body of the nature of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa dam pa'i pha rol du byon pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa dam pa'i pha rol du byon pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it says, “having arrived at the ultimate nondual state of the buddhas.”

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi sku de /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi sku de /
translated: The phrase “the two kinds of abodes of a buddha” refers to the body of a buddha that is the natural state.

original: chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'o //
translated: That is the Dharma Body.

original: de tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnyis su med pa yin te /
analyzed: de tha dad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnyis su med pa yin te /
translated: It is nondual because it is characterized by the absence of differentiation.

original: kun du spyod pa gnyis ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa gnyis ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because all of the two kinds of actions have been completely abandoned.

original: dam pa'i pha rol du byon pa zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis de la gzhol zhing de la rtag tu gnas pa'i don te /
analyzed: dam pa'i pha rol du byon pa zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis de la gzhol zhing de la rtag tu gnas pa'i don te /
translated: The phrase “having attained the highest perfection” means that one is intent upon that and one always abides in that, by means of the meditative absorption that has that as its object.

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi sku la bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi sku la bzhugs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the special quality that is present in the body of a buddha that is the natural state.

original: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la bzhugs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la bzhugs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: After that, the phrase “the body of a buddha that is the complete enjoyment of the Dharma” is stated.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ces bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gling bzhi ba bye ba phrag brgyas bsdus pa gcig gi 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad la bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ces bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gling bzhi ba bye ba phrag brgyas bsdus pa gcig gi 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad la bya'o //
translated: Here, all world systems refers to all Jambudvīpas included in a single trichiliocosm consisting of a billion four-continent worlds.🔽Or, that is just an illustration, for the domain and sphere of activity of the Buddha are the infinite world systems and the infinite realms of those to be trained.

original: yang gcig tu na de ni @17b mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul dang spyod yul ni 'jig rten gyi khams dang gdul ba'i khams mtha' yas pa thams cad yin pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa thams cad la yang
analyzed: yang gcig tu na de ni @17b mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul dang spyod yul ni 'jig rten gyi khams dang gdul ba'i khams mtha' yas pa thams cad yin pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa thams cad la yang
translated: Therefore, it should be understood to refer to all the infinite world systems in the ten directions.

original: bya'o // zhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya'o // zhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line endowed with the body that has entered means

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag gi gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sprul pa'i skus dang po dga' ldan gyi gnas nas 'bab pa nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag gi gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sprul pa'i skus dang po dga' ldan gyi gnas nas 'bab pa nas /
translated: that in all the four-continent worlds of those world systems, the emanation body first descends from the Tuṣita heaven,

original: tha ma yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ston pa'i bar gyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bcu gnyis la sogs pa cig car ston pa ste /
analyzed: tha ma yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ston pa'i bar gyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bcu gnyis la sogs pa cig car ston pa ste /
translated: He simultaneously displays all the twelve deeds of a Buddha, from the initial descent from the Tuṣita heaven to the final demonstration of the great transcendence of misery.

original: de ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'bab pa la sogs pa kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'bab pa la sogs pa kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the special quality of his display of the descent from the Tuṣita heaven and so forth.

original: de'i 'og tu the tshom gyi rnam pa thams cad gcod pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu the tshom gyi rnam pa thams cad gcod pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special quality of his cutting off all forms of doubt,

original: chos thams cad la the tshom med pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la the tshom med pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “He has the knowledge that is free from doubt regarding all phenomena.”

original: de la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni shes bya'i rnam pa'i chos ji snyed yod pa nyid dang ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid thams cad do //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni shes bya'i rnam pa'i chos ji snyed yod pa nyid dang ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid thams cad do //
translated: Therein, “all phenomena” refers to all the aspects of objects of knowledge, both their existence in general and their existence in specific ways.

original: the tshom med pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la the tshom za ba ma lus par bsal ba'i ye shes brnyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: the tshom med pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la the tshom za ba ma lus par bsal ba'i ye shes brnyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: “He has the knowledge that is free from doubt” means that he has attained the gnosis that completely eliminates all doubt regarding all phenomena.

original: de ni the tshom gyi rnam pa thams cad gcod pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni the tshom gyi rnam pa thams cad gcod pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the special quality of the elimination of all forms of doubt.

original: de'i 'og tu theg pa thams cad kyis 'dul ba de dag la snang ba'i sku kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu theg pa thams cad kyis 'dul ba de dag la snang ba'i sku kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special quality of the appearance of the body that is to be tamed by all vehicles,

original: spyod pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: spyod pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “he has the mind that possesses all practices.”

original: de la spyod pa thams cad ces bya ba ni gdul ba rnams kyi spyod pa ste 'dod chags spyad pa dang / zhe sdang spyad pa dang ; gti mug spyad pa dang / nga rgyal spyad pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i spyad pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de la spyod pa thams cad ces bya ba ni gdul ba rnams kyi spyod pa ste 'dod chags spyad pa dang / zhe sdang spyad pa dang ; gti mug spyad pa dang / nga rgyal spyad pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i spyad pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa thams cad do //
translated: Therein, “all practices” are the practices of those to be tamed, such as the practice of desire, the practice of anger, the practice of ignorance, the practice of pride, the practice of discursive thought, and so on.

original: ldan pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni gdul bde dag gi 'dod chags spyad pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa thams cad mkhyen nas de dag la mi sdug pa'am /
analyzed: ldan pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni gdul bde dag gi 'dod chags spyad pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa thams cad mkhyen nas de dag la mi sdug pa'am /
translated: “He has the mind that possesses all practices” means that, having known all the practices of those to be tamed, such as the practice of desire, he teaches them the antidote that is suitable for them, such as the meditation on the unattractive,

original: byams pa'am / rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: byams pa'am / rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am /
translated: the knowledge of the body that appears to those to be trained by any vehicle, the body that is manifested by means of any method, such as love, the dependent origination of this very condition,

original: khams rab tu dbye ba'am /
analyzed: khams rab tu dbye ba'am /
translated: the classification of the elements,

original: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa la sogs pa theg pa gang gis gdul bar 'gyur ba'i sku dang thabs kun du ston par mdzad pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' ba ste /🔽de ni theg pa thams cad kyis 'dul ba de dag la snang ba'i sku kun @18a * //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dran pa la sogs pa theg pa gang gis gdul bar 'gyur ba'i sku dang thabs kun du ston par mdzad pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' ba ste / de ni theg pa thams cad kyis 'dul ba de dag la snang ba'i sku kun @18a * //
translated: the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, and so on.

original: du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: du ston pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: That is the special quality of the body that appears to those to be trained by all vehicles.

original: de'i 'og tu shin tu rnam par mkhyen nas ci rigs par gdams ngag stsol pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu shin tu rnam par mkhyen nas ci rigs par gdams ngag stsol pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ston pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the special quality of bestowing instructions according to what is appropriate through thorough knowledge,

original: chos shes pa la ne ma nur mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos shes pa la ne ma nur mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, He is not uncertain about the knowledge of phenomena.

original: de la chos shes pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rtogs par thugs su chud pa'i mkhyen pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos shes pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rtogs par thugs su chud pa'i mkhyen pa la bya'o //
translated: Therein, the knowledge of phenomena refers to the knowledge that the Blessed One himself has realized.

original: nem nur mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni the tshom mi mnga' zhing nges par gyur pa ste /🔽de yang chos rnams la nem nur can dag la ni gzhan la ci rigs par gdams ngag sbyin pa'i mthu med kyi gang gis chos gang rtogs pa'i shes pa de dag nyid the tshom med cing shin tu nges par gyur na des gzhan dag la yang phyin ci
analyzed: nem nur mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni the tshom mi mnga' zhing nges par gyur pa ste / de yang chos rnams la nem nur can dag la ni gzhan la ci rigs par gdams ngag sbyin pa'i mthu med kyi gang gis chos gang rtogs pa'i shes pa de dag nyid the tshom med cing shin tu nges par gyur na des gzhan dag la yang phyin ci
translated: He is free of doubt means he is free of uncertainty and is definite.🔽He has no doubt about the Dharma, but those who have doubt about the Dharma do not have the power to give advice to others as is appropriate.🔽But when one has no doubt and is very definite about the knowledge that one has realized the Dharma, then one can give advice to others without error.

original: ma log par gdams ngag sbyin nus pas na 'dir yang bcom ldan 'das ni bdag nyid chos mkhyen pa la the tshom mi mnga' zhing shin tu nges pa yin pas gzhan la yang ci rigs par phyin ci ma log pa'i gdams ngag stsol bar mdzad de /
analyzed: ma log par gdams ngag sbyin nus pas na 'dir yang bcom ldan 'das ni bdag nyid chos mkhyen pa la the tshom mi mnga' zhing shin tu nges pa yin pas gzhan la yang ci rigs par phyin ci ma log pa'i gdams ngag stsol bar mdzad de /
translated: Here, the Lord himself has no doubt and is very definite about the knowledge of the Dharma, so he gives advice to others without error as is appropriate.

original: de ni shin tu mdo kha cig las ni phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni shin tu mdo kha cig las ni phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes kyang 'byung ste /
translated: In some sutras, it is said that he is the ultimate limit of the future.

original: de ni yon tan mi zad pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni yon tan mi zad pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is a special quality of his inexhaustible qualities.

original: de zhes bya ba ni de ltar yon tan gyi khyad par nyi shu rtsa gcig dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das de ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni de ltar yon tan gyi khyad par nyi shu rtsa gcig dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das de ste /
translated: The Bhagavān is the one who possesses the above-mentioned twenty-one special qualities.

original: de 'khor phun sum tshogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba dag dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so zhes bya bar tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de 'khor phun sum tshogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba dag dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so zhes bya bar tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: He resides together with the excellent retinue that will be mentioned below.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi khyad par nyi shu rtsa gcig po de dag ni bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi khyad par nyi shu rtsa gcig po de dag ni bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: Again, in another enumeration, the Bhagavān’s twenty-one special qualities are the words of teaching and explanation.

original: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The words of teaching are “endowed with a mind that has fully understood.”

original: kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: The words of explanation are “free from the two kinds of error” and so forth.

original: de ltar na chos nyid legs par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos nyid legs par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the nature of reality is well explained.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi khyad par rnam pa nyi shus na legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi khyad par rnam pa nyi shus na legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The phrase endowed with a mind that has fully understood refers to the twenty different kinds of distinctive qualities that are possessed by a tathāgata’s mind that has fully understood.

original: shes bya la gcig tu sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug pa'i yon tan dang / mchog tu rnam par dag pa rtogs pa'i yon tan dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun mi gcod par gnas pa'i yon tan dang / chos kyi sku la sku dang /
analyzed: shes bya la gcig tu sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug pa'i yon tan dang / mchog tu rnam par dag pa rtogs pa'i yon tan dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun mi gcod par gnas pa'i yon tan dang / chos kyi sku la sku dang /
translated: They are the quality of engaging in a form of knowledge that is completely free of any obscurations regarding objects of knowledge; the quality of realizing the state of supreme purity; the quality of abiding in a way that the activities of a buddha are uninterrupted; the quality of the Dharma body being undifferentiated in terms of its essential nature, intention, and activity;

original: dgongs pa @18b dang ; phrin las tha dad pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan dang / sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan dang / mu stegs can thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i yon tan dang / 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan dang /
analyzed: dgongs pa @18b dang ; phrin las tha dad pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan dang / sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan dang / mu stegs can thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i yon tan dang / 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan dang /
translated: the quality of having cultivated the antidotes to all the mental afflictions and the actions of the mental afflictions; the quality of being incapable of being defeated by any of the tīrthikas; the quality of not being affected by any of the mundane entities even though one is born into the mundane world;

original: chos rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan dang / lung ston pa'i yon tan dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku kun du ston pa'i yon tan dang / the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan dang / spyad pa sna tshogs kyis 'dzud pa'i yon tan dang /
analyzed: chos rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan dang / lung ston pa'i yon tan dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku kun du ston pa'i yon tan dang / the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan dang / spyad pa sna tshogs kyis 'dzud pa'i yon tan dang /
translated: the qualities of presenting the Dharma, the qualities of giving predictions, the qualities of displaying the enjoyment and emanation bodies in all worldly realms, the qualities of resolving doubts, the qualities of guiding through various activities,🔽the qualities of knowing the future arising of the Dharma, the qualities of displaying the Dharma according to interest, the qualities of training sentient beings through immeasurable bodies, the qualities of accomplishing the perfections in the equality of the dharmakaya,

original: phyis chos 'byung ba mkhyen pa'i yon tan dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin kun du ston pa'i yon tan dang / lus tshad med pas sems can 'dul bar sbyor ba'i yon tan dang / chos kyi sku mnyam pa la pha rol tu phyin pa grub pa'i yon tan dang /
analyzed: phyis chos 'byung ba mkhyen pa'i yon tan dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin kun du ston pa'i yon tan dang / lus tshad med pas sems can 'dul bar sbyor ba'i yon tan dang / chos kyi sku mnyam pa la pha rol tu phyin pa grub pa'i yon tan dang /
translated: and the qualities of the inconceivable Dharma.

original: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma 'dres pa kun du ston pa'i yon tan dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su ma chad pa'i yon tan dang / 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i mdzad par nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan dang /
analyzed: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma 'dres pa kun du ston pa'i yon tan dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su ma chad pa'i yon tan dang / 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i mdzad par nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan dang /
translated: The qualities of displaying the unmixed buddha realm in accordance with the interest of each sentient being, the quality of the domain of the three buddha bodies being uninterrupted, the quality of remaining to benefit and bring happiness to all sentient beings until the end of samsara,

original: mi zad pa'i yon tan gyis so //🔽yon tan rnam pa nyi shu po de dag na mdo las /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i yon tan gyis so // yon tan rnam pa nyi shu po de dag na mdo las /
translated: and the quality of inexhaustibility.

original: kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba nas nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa de zhes bya ba'i bar gyi tshig nyi shu dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba nas nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa de zhes bya ba'i bar gyi tshig nyi shu dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: These twenty qualities are applied in order to the twenty phrases in the sutra from “not having two activities” up to “the end of space.”

original: de la dang por shes bya la gcig tu sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la dang por shes bya la gcig tu sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Here, first, in terms of the quality of engaging in unobstructed wisdom with regard to the object of knowledge, he is said to possess a mind that fully comprehends.

original: kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The second verse shows that the buddhas are free from the two kinds of nonapprehension.

original: ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyi shes pa /
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyi shes pa /
translated: The knowledge of the listeners🔽is not engaged in the infinite divisions of the vehicles and the Buddha’s teachings with regard to some times and places.

original: yul dang dus kyis bskal pa'i dus rnams las kha cig la theg pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa dag la shes pa mi 'jug pa ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mkhyen pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: yul dang dus kyis bskal pa'i dus rnams las kha cig la theg pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa dag la shes pa mi 'jug pa ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mkhyen pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But the knowledge of the tathagatas is not like that.🔽For their knowledge, free of attachment and unobstructed, is engaged with all times and places and with the different aspects of things.

original: yul dang dus thams cad du dngos po rnam pa tha dad pa la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i mkhyen pa 'jug pas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su mi shes pa'i kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba'i phyir shes bya la gcig tu sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /🔽des @19a * //
analyzed: yul dang dus thams cad du dngos po rnam pa tha dad pa la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i mkhyen pa 'jug pas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su mi shes pa'i kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba'i phyir shes bya la gcig tu sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te / des @19a * //
translated: Thus, they are endowed with the quality of the single, unobstructed engagement of gnosis in all that is to be known.

original: na legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: na legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, they are endowed with the mind that fully understands.

original: de'i 'og tu mchog tu rnam par dag pa rtogs par mdzad pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mchog tu rnam par dag pa rtogs par mdzad pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Then, in order to demonstrate the mind endowed with the realization of the quality of the supreme purity,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he declares, “the one who is intent on the Dharma devoid of characteristics.”

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dri ma ma lus par bsal ba'i de bzhin nyid dam pa chos bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dri ma ma lus par bsal ba'i de bzhin nyid dam pa chos bdag med pa ste /
translated: The Dharma devoid of characteristics is the supreme reality free from all stains of the characteristics of entity and non-entity, the selflessness of phenomena.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: It is the nature free from all conceptual thought.

original: mchog tu gzhol par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid rang bzhin gyis rtogs par thugs su chud nas gzhan dag la yang go bar mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: mchog tu gzhol par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid rang bzhin gyis rtogs par thugs su chud nas gzhan dag la yang go bar mdzad pa ste /
translated: “Intent” means that, having realized its nature by way of the natural intuition, he causes others to understand it.

original: da ltar mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa'i phyir mchog tu rnam par dag pa rtogs par mdzad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: da ltar mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa'i phyir mchog tu rnam par dag pa rtogs par mdzad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Because he now causes the highest engagement in the Dharma that is devoid of characteristics, he possesses the quality of realizing the highest purity.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: And because of that, he possesses the mind that is well-understood.

original: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun mi gcod par gnas pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun mi gcod par gnas pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the quality of abiding in the Buddha's activities without interruption, he said:

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas gnas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Abiding in the Buddha's abode.

original: lhun gyis grub par sems can gyi don mdzad pa rgyun mi gcod pas 'phags pa dang / lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa bla na med pas rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun mi gcod par gnas pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par sems can gyi don mdzad pa rgyun mi gcod pas 'phags pa dang / lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa bla na med pas rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun mi gcod par gnas pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Because he always abides in the unsurpassed abode of the noble ones, gods, and Brahma, without interruption in the activities of the Buddha, he possesses the quality of abiding in the Buddha's activities without interruption.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is endowed with the mind that fully comprehends.

original: de'i 'og tu chos kyi sku la sku dang dgongs pa dang phrin las tha dad pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos kyi sku la sku dang dgongs pa dang phrin las tha dad pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate that he is endowed with the mind that fully comprehends the quality of the Dharma Body, which is the absence of difference in body, mind, and deeds,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it says, “he has attained the state of equality with all Buddhas.”

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku la sku dang / dgongs pa dang phrin las tha dad pa mi mnga' bas sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku la sku dang / dgongs pa dang phrin las tha dad pa mi mnga' bas sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes par sbyar ro //
translated: Since there is no difference in body, mind, and deeds in the Dharma Body of all Buddhas, he is said to have attained the state of equality with all Buddhas.

original: de yang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi sku tha mi dad pa dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bar dgongs pa tha mi dad pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i skus gzhan gyi @19b don mdzad pa'i phyir phrin las tha mi dad pa'i phyir chos kyi sku la sku dang dgongs pa dang phrin las tha dad pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi sku tha mi dad pa dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bar dgongs pa tha mi dad pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i skus gzhan gyi @19b don mdzad pa'i phyir phrin las tha mi dad pa'i phyir chos kyi sku la sku dang dgongs pa dang phrin las tha dad pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the dharmakāya possesses the quality of being endowed with the undifferentiated body of gnosis that is the suchness of all buddhas, the undifferentiated intention to benefit and bring happiness to all sentient beings, and the undifferentiated activity of accomplishing the welfare of others through the enjoyment body and the emanation body.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is endowed with the mind that fully comprehends.

original: de'i 'og tu sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the mind that fully comprehends through the quality of cultivating the antidotes to all obscurations,

original: sgrib pa med pa'i rtogs pa thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i rtogs pa thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it says, “the realization of the absence of obscurations.”

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po 'phags pa'i lam goms par mdzad pas sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i rtogs pa thugs su chud do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po 'phags pa'i lam goms par mdzad pas sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i rtogs pa thugs su chud do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: and by cultivating the noble path, the antidote to all afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience, he has realized the knowledge free from all obstructions.

original: de la sgrib pa med pa'i rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa las dben pa'i gnas sam rten par byed pa de mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de la sgrib pa med pa'i rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa las dben pa'i gnas sam rten par byed pa de mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Here, “realization free from obstructions” means that nirvana is the basis or support for the separation from obstructions.

original: thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i don yod pa'i phyir sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i don yod pa'i phyir sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: “Realization” means that because the meaning of attainment exists, he has the good qualities of cultivating the antidote to all obstructions.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He also has the knowledge of good realization.

original: de'i 'og tu mu stegs can thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mu stegs can thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the knowledge of good realization by the quality of being unassailable by any tīrthikas,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He is called “endowed with the Dharma of irreversibility.”

original: bshad pa dang thugs su chud pa'i chos rnams dang ldan pas gzhan mu stegs can dag gis phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir mu stegs can thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa dang thugs su chud pa'i chos rnams dang ldan pas gzhan mu stegs can dag gis phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir mu stegs can thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Because he is endowed with the Dharma of explanation and realization, he is irreversible by others, by non-Buddhists. He is endowed with the quality of being unassailable by all non-Buddhists.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is also endowed with the mind of complete understanding.

original: de'i 'og tu 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, although born in the world, he is not carried away by worldly dharmas. In order to teach the quality of being endowed with the mind of complete understanding,

original: spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he is called “unassailable by the sphere of activity.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'jig rten du byung yang 'jig rten pa'i spyod yul gyi chos brgyad po rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bde ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'jig rten du byung yang 'jig rten pa'i spyod yul gyi chos brgyad po rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bde ba dang /
translated: The Tathāgata, although he has appeared in the world, is not carried away by the eight worldly concerns, which are the objects of worldly people’s experience: gain and loss, pleasure and pain, fame and disgrace, praise and blame.

original: sdug bsngal bdag gis 'phrogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bdag gis 'phrogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Because he is not carried away by the worldly concerns, he is endowed with the quality of not being carried away by worldly things, although he is born in the world.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //🔽de'i 'og tu chos rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud @20a * //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no // de'i 'og tu chos rnam par 'jog pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud @20a * //
translated: He is also endowed with the mind that has fully understood.

original: pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the mind that has fully understood through the quality of establishing phenomena,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he spoke of “the establishment of the inconceivable.”

original: gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po rtog ge'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa byis pa ma yin pa'i blos brtag par bya ba'i chos kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa'i phyir chos rnam par 'jog pa'i
analyzed: gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po rtog ge'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa byis pa ma yin pa'i blos brtag par bya ba'i chos kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa'i phyir chos rnam par 'jog pa'i
translated: It is the Dharma that is well-ascertained because it is the twelve branches of the scriptures that are the domain of reasoning and are the Dharma that is to be investigated by the mind of one who is not a fool, which is taught and presented as the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: It is endowed with good qualities

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: because it is endowed with the mind that fully understands.

original: de'i 'og tu lung ston pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lung ston pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par /
translated: After that, it is endowed with the mind that fully understands through the good qualities of prophecy.

original: bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas dus gsum du mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas dus gsum du mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In terms of the teaching, it is said to be the one who has completed the sameness of the three times.

original: dus gsum du gtogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyi byung ba dang 'byung bas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa lung ston par mdzad pa'i phyir lung ston pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: dus gsum du gtogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyi byung ba dang 'byung bas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa lung ston par mdzad pa'i phyir lung ston pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He is endowed with the quality of prophecy because he prophesies the births of things that have occurred, are occurring, and will occur in the three times.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with the mind that fully comprehends them.

original: de'i 'og tu 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate that he is endowed with the mind that fully comprehends the quality of displaying the enjoyment and emanation bodies in all world systems,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du bzhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du bzhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “He is endowed with the body that exists in all world systems.”

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gzugs kyi sku rnam pa gnyis kyis 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du sku mdog bee d'urya lta bu la sogs pa kun du ston par mdzad pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gzugs kyi sku rnam pa gnyis kyis 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du sku mdog bee d'urya lta bu la sogs pa kun du ston par mdzad pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang /
translated: He has the quality of displaying the enjoyment body and emanation body in all world systems, because he displays the two kinds of form body in all world systems, such as the color of his body, which is like a sapphire.

original: sprul pa'i sku ston pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ston pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He has the quality of displaying the enjoyment body and emanation body in all world systems,

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: and he has the mind that understands them well.

original: de'i 'og tu the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Next, in order to demonstrate the quality of resolving doubts with the mind that understands them well,

original: chos thams cad la the tshom med pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la the tshom med pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he said, “He has the knowledge that is free from doubt about all phenomena.”

original: mkhyen pa de ni bdag la nges pa bzhin du gzhan la yang nges pa bskyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: mkhyen pa de ni bdag la nges pa bzhin du gzhan la yang nges pa bskyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: That knowledge is the quality of resolving doubts, because it is the cause for generating certainty in others just as he has certainty in himself.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with the mind that fully comprehends that.

original: @20b de'i 'og tu spyod pa sna tshogs kyis 'dzud pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: @20b de'i 'og tu spyod pa sna tshogs kyis 'dzud pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the mind that fully comprehends the quality of guiding through various practices,

original: spyod pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: spyod pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he said, “He has the mind that possesses all practices.”

original: gdul ba ji lta ba bzhin du lus 'dra ba kun du ston pas theg pa la 'dzud par mdzad pa'i phyir spyod pa sna tshogs kyis 'dzud pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gdul ba ji lta ba bzhin du lus 'dra ba kun du ston pas theg pa la 'dzud par mdzad pa'i phyir spyod pa sna tshogs kyis 'dzud pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He is endowed with the quality of guiding through various practices because he guides beings into the vehicles by displaying bodies that are similar to those to be guided.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with the mind that fully comprehends that.

original: de'i 'og tu phyis chos 'byung ba mkhyen pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phyis chos 'byung ba mkhyen pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the mind that fully comprehends the quality of knowing the arising of the Dharma in the future,

original: chos shes pa la nem nur mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos shes pa la nem nur mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he said, “He has no doubt about knowing the Dharma.”

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: It is beyond the scope of the sravakas and so on.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon phra mo rdo ba'i phag na gser phye yod pa lta bu rnams kyang phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa'i phyir phyis chos 'byung ba mkhyen pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon phra mo rdo ba'i phag na gser phye yod pa lta bu rnams kyang phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa'i phyir phyis chos 'byung ba mkhyen pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The Tathagata also possesses the quality of knowing future events, because he knows without error the subtle seeds of virtue that exist in beings, like gold under the earth.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
