analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus he possesses the mind that fully understands.

original: de'i 'og tu mos pa ji lta ba bzhin kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mos pa ji lta ba bzhin kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the mind that fully understands through the quality of teaching in accordance with inclinations,

original: rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: it says he possesses a body that is not examined.

original: rnam par mi rtog kyang yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa gser gyi kha dog la sogs pa'i gzugs su mthong yang /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog kyang yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa gser gyi kha dog la sogs pa'i gzugs su mthong yang /
translated: Even though he is nonconceptual, through the blessings of the Tathagata and the power of their own inclinations, beings see the Tathagata in the form of a golden color and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde nas ji skad gsungs pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du kun du ston pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde nas ji skad gsungs pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du kun du ston pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He possesses the quality of teaching in accordance with the aspirations of disciples, as stated in the sutras, “The Tathagata is non-conceptual and non-discriminating.”

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He also possesses the mind of perfect understanding.

original: de'i 'og tu lus tshad med pas sems can 'dul bar sbyor ba'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lus tshad med pas sems can 'dul bar sbyor ba'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the mind of perfect understanding through the quality of applying to train sentient beings with immeasurable bodies,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis ye shes yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis ye shes yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he spoke of “the bodhisattvas’ perfect adoption of wisdom.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' lus tshad med pa dag gis sems can gdul pa'i phyir sbyor pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems @21a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lus tshad med pa dag gis sems can gdul pa'i phyir sbyor pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems @21a * //
translated: The application of bodhisattvas with immeasurable bodies to train sentient beings is the listening to the holy Dharma through the Tathagata’s blessing, the contemplation of its meaning, and the practice of its meaning.

original: pa dang sgom pa'i rim gyis ye shes thob pa khyad par can gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan bdags pa dang / yongs su gtad bdag gis rgyun mi 'chad par gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'byung ba'i phyir lus tshad med pas sems can gdul bar sbyor ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: pa dang sgom pa'i rim gyis ye shes thob pa khyad par can gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan bdags pa dang / yongs su gtad bdag gis rgyun mi 'chad par gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'byung ba'i phyir lus tshad med pas sems can gdul bar sbyor ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: And they benefit and are committed to the bodhisattvas who have attained the extraordinary gnosis through the stages of listening and meditation, and they are endowed with the qualities of applying themselves to guiding sentient beings with immeasurable bodies, because they are uninterruptedly passed down from one to another.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: And they are endowed with the intelligence that fully comprehends that.

original: de'i 'og tu chos kyi sku mnyam pa la pha rol tu phyin pa grub pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos kyi sku mnyam pa la pha rol tu phyin pa grub pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate that they are endowed with the intelligence that fully comprehends the qualities of accomplishing the perfections in the sameness of the dharmakāya,

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa dam pa'i pha rol du byon pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa dam pa'i pha rol du byon pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “They have reached the ultimate nondual state of buddhahood.”

original: sangs rgyas kyis chos kyi sku //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis chos kyi sku //
translated: The dharmakāya of the buddhas

original: nyis su med pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu byin pa thams cad mtshungs par yongs su grub pa'i phyir chos kyi sku mnyam pa la pha rol tu phyin pa grub pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: nyis su med pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu byin pa thams cad mtshungs par yongs su grub pa'i phyir chos kyi sku mnyam pa la pha rol tu phyin pa grub pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: In the absence of duality, all perfections of generosity and so forth are the same in being fully accomplished, so the Dharma body is endowed with the qualities of the perfection of the perfections.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: This also shows that he is endowed with the mind of perfect understanding.

original: de'i 'og tu mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma 'dres pa kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma 'dres pa kun du ston pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate that he is endowed with the mind of perfect understanding through the quality of displaying buddha realms in accordance with the aspirations of beings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ma 'dres pa'i rnam par thar pa mdzad pa'i ye shes kyi mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ma 'dres pa'i rnam par thar pa mdzad pa'i ye shes kyi mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he said, “He has perfected the wisdom that performs the deeds of the thus-gone ones’ unique liberation.”

original: sems can gyi mos pa dang 'tsham par sangs rgyas kyi zhing gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las grub pa ma 'dres pa tha dad pa kun du ston pa'i phyir mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma 'dres pa kun du ston pa'i yon
analyzed: sems can gyi mos pa dang 'tsham par sangs rgyas kyi zhing gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las grub pa ma 'dres pa tha dad pa kun du ston pa'i phyir mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma 'dres pa kun du ston pa'i yon
translated: And in accordance with the aspirations of beings, they display buddha fields made of gold and other precious substances, distinct and different from each other.🔽

original: tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Because he displays to sentient beings buddha realms made of gold and so on, in accordance with their aspirations, in an unmixed and distinct way, he possesses the quality of displaying buddha realms in an unmixed way in accordance with the aspirations of sentient beings.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Because of that, he possesses the mind that fully comprehends.

original: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su ma chad pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su ma chad pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate that he possesses the mind that fully comprehends through the quality of the inexhaustible object of the three buddha bodies,

original: mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa mnyam pa nyid du thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa mnyam pa nyid du thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he declares, “He has realized the equality of the buddha stage that is without end or middle.”

original: mtha' dang dbus med pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: mtha' dang dbus med pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi khyad par te /
translated: “Without end or middle” is a particularity of buddhahood.

original: sku gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas thog ma dang / tha ma dang / bar dang / nyal ba rnams so //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas thog ma dang / tha ma dang / bar dang / nyal ba rnams so //
translated: The Buddha's body is the same in all Buddha-fields, because it is the same in all three bodies, in the beginning, middle, and end, in rising up and lying down.

original: de dag gis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing ste sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du sku @21b gsum gyi yul du tha dad pa med pa'i dngos pos mnyam pa nyid du bzhugs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su ma chad pa'i yon tan dang🔽ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing ste sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du sku @21b gsum gyi yul du tha dad pa med pa'i dngos pos mnyam pa nyid du bzhugs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su ma chad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: This shows the quality of the Buddha's body being undivided in the three bodies, because it is the same in all Buddha-fields, since it is the same in all three bodies, in the beginning, middle, and end, in rising up and lying down.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: And this shows the quality of his mind being well-purified, because he has well-purified knowledge.

original: de'i 'og tu 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba mdzad par nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba mdzad par nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Then, in order to show the quality of his mind being well-purified by his abiding in the service of all beings until the end of the world,🔽he says,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: as far as the realm of dharma extends.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa dang / de'i rgyu mthun pa mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams 'dul ba'i dus ji lta ba bzhin du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'i tshe dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na yang gnas pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i bar du sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba mdzad pa'i nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa dang / de'i rgyu mthun pa mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams 'dul ba'i dus ji lta ba bzhin du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'i tshe dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na yang gnas pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i bar du sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba mdzad pa'i nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is endowed with the quality of remaining to benefit and bring happiness to all sentient beings until the end of samsara.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: It is also endowed with the intelligence that fully comprehends that.

original: de'i 'og tu mi zad pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mi zad pa'i yon tan gyis legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan par bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the intelligence that fully comprehends inexhaustible qualities,

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he said, “The extent of the realm of space.”

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i chos kyi dbyings la rnam par bkod pa'i yon tan rnams kyi mtha' med pas na 'khor ba ji srid pa'i bar du chos kyi dbyings kyis 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don mdzad pa'i rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor bas yon tan mi zad pa'i
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i chos kyi dbyings la rnam par bkod pa'i yon tan rnams kyi mtha' med pas na 'khor ba ji srid pa'i bar du chos kyi dbyings kyis 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don mdzad pa'i rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor bas yon tan mi zad pa'i
translated: Since the qualities that are arrayed in the dharmadhatu, which is like space, are infinite, the dharmadhatu is applied to the uninterrupted performance of benefit for all beings for as long as samsara exists.

original: phyir mi zad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: phyir mi zad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore it possesses inexhaustible qualities.

original: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: des kyang legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is also applied to the statement, “He is endowed with a mind that has fully understood.”

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi khyad par rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig po de dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes dang spangs pa bla na med pa gnyis kyis rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi khyad par rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig po de dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes dang spangs pa bla na med pa gnyis kyis rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: Again, in another enumeration, the Bhagavat’s qualities are twenty-one. These qualities are the Bhagavat’s two unexcelled wisdoms and relinquishments, which are the perfection of his own purpose,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi sbyor ba gnyis kyis gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi sbyor ba gnyis kyis gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: and the perfection of his purpose for others, which is the two activities of self and other.

original: yan lag bzhis phun sum tshogs pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: yan lag bzhis phun sum tshogs pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: The first four branches show the two perfections of the Buddha, and the fifth shows the perfection of his disciples.

original: de la yan lag dang po ni ye shes bla na med pa ste mdo las /
analyzed: de la yan lag dang po ni ye shes bla na med pa ste mdo las /
translated: The first branch is the unexcelled knowledge, as a sūtra declares:

original: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /🔽blos thugs su chud @22a * //
analyzed: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te / blos thugs su chud @22a * //
translated: He is endowed with the mind that well understands.

original: par bya ba ji snyed pa yod pa de snyed du thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par bya ba ji snyed pa yod pa de snyed du thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He understands all that can be understood.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: That is fourfold:

original: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid dang / don zab mo thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid dang / legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid dri ma med pa dang / legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid dang / don zab mo thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid dang / legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid dri ma med pa dang / legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid bla na med pa'o //
translated: the mind that well understands, the mind that understands the profound meaning, the stainless mind that well understands, and the unexcelled mind that well understands.

original: de la legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid ni /
analyzed: de la legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid ni /
translated: The mind that well understands🔽is indicated by the statement:

original: kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: kun du spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: He is without the two kinds of conduct.

original: nang dang phyi'i skye mched kyi mtshan ma kun du mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i skye mched kyi mtshan ma kun du mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not conduct himself with the signs of the inner and outer sense bases.

original: don zab mo thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid ni /🔽mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: don zab mo thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid ni / mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The very understanding of the profound meaning is taught by🔽the phrase, “he is intent upon the teaching of signlessness.”

original: chos bdag med pa la mchog tu gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa la mchog tu gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is intent upon the teaching of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid dri ma med pa ni /
analyzed: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid dri ma med pa ni /
translated: The very understanding of the stainless is taught by

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas gnas pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas gnas pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: the phrase, “he abides in the abode of the buddhas.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has transcended the abode of the bodhisattvas.

original: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid bla na med pa ni /
analyzed: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid bla na med pa ni /
translated: The very understanding of the unsurpassed is taught by

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: the phrase, “he has attained the equality of all buddhas.”

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang khyad par med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang khyad par med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he is not different from all buddhas.

original: de ni ye shes bla na med pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni ye shes bla na med pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the perfection of his own aim through his unsurpassed intuition.

original: yan lag gnyis pa spangs pa bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag gnyis pa spangs pa bla na med pa ste /
translated: The second member is the unsurpassed abandonment.

original: mdo las sgrib pa med pa'i rtogs pa thugs su chud pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las sgrib pa med pa'i rtogs pa thugs su chud pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The sutra demonstrates this by saying, “he has realized the realization that is free of obscurations.”

original: rtogs par bya ba ji snyed yod pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba ji snyed yod pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he has realized all that is to be realized.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, this is threefold:

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa dang / de dag la rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa dang / de dag la rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa'o //
translated: realization that is free of the obscurations of the mental afflictions, realization that is free of the obscurations to the states of spiritual composure, and realization that is free of the obscurations to the objects of knowledge.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa ni /
translated: Realization that is free of the obscurations of the mental afflictions is

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes gsungs pa'i tshig gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes gsungs pa'i tshig gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: demonstrated by the two phrases “he possesses the Dharma of irreversibility” and “he is not carried away by his sphere of activity.”

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang spangs pa de yongs su nyams pa dang / da ltar nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang spangs pa de yongs su nyams pa dang / da ltar nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
translated: This is because he will not relinquish that relinquishment in the future and because his mental afflictions do not manifest in the present.🔽Realization that is free of the obscurations to the states of spiritual composure is

original: de dag la rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: de dag la rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa ni /
translated: demonstrated by the phrase “he is not separated from the states of spiritual🔽composure.”

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par 'jog pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par 'jog pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: It is taught by the statement:🔽The inconceivable is posited.

original: sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is taught by the statement:🔽The three times are equally traversed.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs @22b pa'i dus gsum la mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs @22b pa'i dus gsum la mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: It is taught by the statement:

original: dus gsum la chags pa med cing thogs pa med par ye shes mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus gsum la chags pa med cing thogs pa med par ye shes mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The three times are equally traversed.

original: de ni spangs pa bla na med pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni spangs pa bla na med pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: That is the teaching of the perfection of one’s own aim through the unsurpassed abandonment.🔽The third branch is one’s own application, taught by the statement in the sutra:

original: yan lag gsum pa ni bdag gis sbyor ba ste mdo las 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /🔽sems can dpag tu med pa'i don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag gsum pa ni bdag gis sbyor ba ste mdo las 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te / sems can dpag tu med pa'i don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has a body that enters all worldly realms.

original: zhugs pa'i sku de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i sku de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: That body that enters is of four kinds.

original: dgos pa dang / thabs dang / kun nas nyon mongs ba med pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: dgos pa dang / thabs dang / kun nas nyon mongs ba med pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: The purpose, the means, the absence of defilement, and the essence are taught.

original: de la dgos pa ni chos thams cad la the tshom med pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' bas zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de la dgos pa ni chos thams cad la the tshom med pa'i mkhyen pa mnga' bas zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The purpose is taught by the statement: “He has the knowledge that is free from doubt about all things.”

original: the tshom thams cad bcad pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom thams cad bcad pa'o //
translated: It is the elimination of all doubt.

original: thabs ni / spyod pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: thabs ni / spyod pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The means is taught by the statement: “He has the mind that possesses all practices.”

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas su skye ba la sogs pa kun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas su skye ba la sogs pa kun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the display of all practices, such as being born in the Tusita heaven.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni chos shes pa la nem nur mi mnga' ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni chos shes pa la nem nur mi mnga' ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The absence of defilement is taught by the statement: “He has no uncertainty about the knowledge of the Dharma.”

original: 'jig rten gyi chos rnams thog ma nyid du so sor rig pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos rnams thog ma nyid du so sor rig pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the absence of defilement because he first discerns the worldly dharmas.

original: ngo bo nyid ni rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The essence is taught by the statement: “He has the body that is not discriminated.”

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad las ma byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad las ma byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not arise from any afflicted discriminations.

original: de ni de'i bdag gi sbyor bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i bdag gi sbyor bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the perfection of benefit for others through the application of its reality.

original: yan lag bzhi pa ni gzhan gyi sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi pa ni gzhan gyi sbyor ba ste /
translated: The fourth branch is the application for others,

original: mdo las / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ye shes yang dag par blangs pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te byang chub sems dpas ye shes rnams rang gi ye shes su yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ye shes yang dag par blangs pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te byang chub sems dpas ye shes rnams rang gi ye shes su yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: as stated in a sūtra: “The bodhisattvas’ perfect adoption of wisdom.”

original: ye shes yang dag par blangs pa de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ye shes yang dag par blangs pa de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This adoption of wisdom is threefold:

original: khas len pa dang / 'grub pa dang / rtogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: khas len pa dang / 'grub pa dang / rtogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of adoption, accomplishment, and realization.

original: de la khas len pa ni /
analyzed: de la khas len pa ni /
translated: The teaching of adoption is

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa dam pa'i pha rol tu byon pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa dam pa'i pha rol tu byon pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: as stated in the sūtra: “The bodhisattvas’ perfect adoption of wisdom.”🔽The teaching of accomplishment is🔽as stated in the sūtra: “The bodhisattvas’ perfect adoption of wisdom.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i chos kyi sku dang gcig pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i chos kyi sku dang gcig pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that the bodhisattva is identical with the Dharma Body of the Buddha.

original: 'grub pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa'i rnam par thar pa mdzad pa'i ye shes kyi mthar byon pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /🔽de bzhin gshegs @23a * //
analyzed: 'grub pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa'i rnam par thar pa mdzad pa'i ye shes kyi mthar byon pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te / de bzhin gshegs @23a * //
translated: Attainment is indicated by the statement: “He has arrived at the culmination of the knowledge that performs the deeds of a Tathagata, which are not shared by others.”

original: pa'i ye shes dang spangs pa tha dad pa med pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i ye shes dang spangs pa tha dad pa med pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the attainment of the non-differentiation of the knowledge and abandonment of the Tathagata.

original: rtogs pa mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: rtogs pa mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: Realization is indicated by the statement: “He has realized the equality of the Buddhas, which is free from extremes and middle.”

original: de gnyi ga'i gnas de bzhin nyid chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i gnas de bzhin nyid chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has realized the reality that is the basis of both of those, the Dharma-element.

original: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa de yang chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes gsungs pas nyan thos rnams las khyad du 'phags pa bstan te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa de yang chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes gsungs pas nyan thos rnams las khyad du 'phags pa bstan te /
translated: That realization of the Dharma-element is indicated as being superior to that of the Sravakas by the statement: “It is infinite like the Dharma-element.”

original: nyan thos ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da'i /
analyzed: nyan thos ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da'i /
translated: The Sravakas are completely liberated from the afflictive obstructions,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa de ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa yin te /🔽dper na nam mkha' ni 'jig pa'i dus sam chags pa'i dus na yang zad pa med pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mngon bar rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus sam /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa de ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa yin te / dper na nam mkha' ni 'jig pa'i dus sam chags pa'i dus na yang zad pa med pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mngon bar rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus sam /
translated: The realm of phenomena is the extent of the realm of space.🔽For example, space is not exhausted at the time of destruction or at the time of formation.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na yang /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na yang /
translated: Similarly, the Bhagavan Buddhas are superior to the sravakas because they do not abide in samsara or nirvana at the time of manifest complete enlightenment or at the time of complete nirvana.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir nyan thos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa yin te de ni de'i gzhan gyi sbyor bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir nyan thos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa yin te de ni de'i gzhan gyi sbyor bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching on the perfection of the benefit of others through the practice of others.

original: dngos po bsdu ba'i sgo nas yang rnam grangs gzhan te /
analyzed: dngos po bsdu ba'i sgo nas yang rnam grangs gzhan te /
translated: There is another enumeration of the perfections in terms of the collection of things.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni 'dir rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig tu bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni 'dir rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig tu bstan te /
translated: The perfection of the Tathagata is taught here in twenty one aspects.

original: thugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / gsung phun sum tshogs pa dang / sku phun sum tshogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa mtshan nyid med pa dang / bzhugs pa phun sum tshogs pa stong pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pas bzhugs pa dang /🔽yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / dris pa lung ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / rab tu rgol ba zil gyis gnon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / zhing yongs su dag pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: thugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / gsung phun sum tshogs pa dang / sku phun sum tshogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa mtshan nyid med pa dang / bzhugs pa phun sum tshogs pa stong pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pas bzhugs pa dang / yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / dris pa lung ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / rab tu rgol ba zil gyis gnon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / zhing yongs su dag pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: the perfect mind, the perfect speech, the perfect body, the perfect nirvāṇa without characteristics, the perfect abiding in emptiness, the perfect abiding through discernment,🔽the perfect retention of qualities, the perfect answers to questions, the perfect overcoming of adversaries, the perfect pure realm, the perfect abode,

original: spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dang / sprul pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bstan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sems can gyi spyod pa rjes su 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam gyi gdams ngag phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dang / sprul pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bstan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sems can gyi spyod pa rjes su 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam gyi gdams ngag phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: the perfect deportment, the perfect emanations, the perfect teaching, the perfect engagement in the conduct of sentient beings, and the perfect instructions on the path that leads everywhere.

original: phan pa gnod pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhi phun sum tshogs pa dang / mi mthun pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / cho 'phrul gyi rnam par rol ba phun sum @23b tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: phan pa gnod pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhi phun sum tshogs pa dang / mi mthun pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / cho 'phrul gyi rnam par rol ba phun sum @23b tshogs pa dang /
translated: The perfection of the absence of defilement in regard to benefit and harm, the perfection of the basis, the perfection of the absence of discord, the perfection of the display of miracles,

original: yon tan mi zad pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag gi dngos po phun sum tshogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan mi zad pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag gi dngos po phun sum tshogs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of the inexhaustibility of qualities, the perfection of the essential nature, and the perfection of nirvana.

original: phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig po de dag kyang mdo las /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig po de dag kyang mdo las /
translated: These twenty-one perfections are referred to in a Sutra:

original: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Endowed with the intelligence that is well-penetrated . . .

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i bar gyi tshig nyi shu rtsa gcig dang go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i bar gyi tshig nyi shu rtsa gcig dang go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: . . . to the end of space.”

original: tshig gi don la sogs pa ni rnam grangs dag gis lugs bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshig gi don la sogs pa ni rnam grangs dag gis lugs bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of these terms should be understood according to the system of the Abhidharmakośa.

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the perfection of good qualities and so forth has already been explained.

original: // / ji lta bu dag dang bzhugs she na /
analyzed: // / ji lta bu dag dang bzhugs she na /
translated: With what kind of retinue did he dwell?

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dag ste /
translated: With a perfect retinue.

original: de la 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The perfect retinue is twofold:

original: nyan thos kyi 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfect retinue of śrāvakas and the perfect retinue of bodhisattvas.

original: de la dang por nyan thos kyi 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la dang por nyan thos kyi 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: First, with regard to the perfect retinue of śrāvakas,

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun tshad med pa thams cad kyang cang shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun tshad med pa thams cad kyang cang shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Buddha said, “The immeasurable saṅgha of śrāvakas, all of whom are knowledgeable,” and so forth.

original: de la ci'i phyir nyan thos kyi 'khor thog mar smos she na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir nyan thos kyi 'khor thog mar smos she na /
translated: Why is the śrāvaka retinue mentioned first?

original: de ni theg pa chen po la the tshom za ba rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams kyi rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa dang / nyan thos rnam par dag pa rnams kyi nga rgyal spang ba dang /
analyzed: de ni theg pa chen po la the tshom za ba rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams kyi rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa dang / nyan thos rnam par dag pa rnams kyi nga rgyal spang ba dang /
translated: It is in order to eliminate the doubts of those who doubt the Great Vehicle, to establish the conditions for the bodhisattvas of unfixed potential, to eliminate the pride of the pure śrāvakas,

original: 'khor dang rgyu ba rnams kyi 'khor de dag gdul ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos dag la gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'khor dang rgyu ba rnams kyi 'khor de dag gdul ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos dag la gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: to tame the retinue and those who wander about, and to generate respect for the śrāvakas in the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang nyan thos rnams la mi gus par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas na de'i phyir gzhan dag de la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir de dag gi yon tan thog mar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang nyan thos rnams la mi gus par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas na de'i phyir gzhan dag de la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir de dag gi yon tan thog mar brjod pa'o //
translated: Because it is said that the bodhisattva should not be disrespectful to the śrāvakas, therefore, in order to generate respect for them in others, their qualities are mentioned first.

original: 'o na gnas de ni shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: 'o na gnas de ni shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes gsungs na /
translated: Well then, if it is said that that realm is characterized by the pure, sovereign, and fully transformed consciousness,

original: de ni nyan thos rnams ji srid par gyur te 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ni nyan thos rnams ji srid par gyur te 'gal lo //
translated: This contradicts the fact that they last as long as the Sravakas.

original: ji ltar 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gal zhe na /
translated: How does it contradict?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang lta ba mthun pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang lta ba mthun pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The Bodhisattvas are in agreement with them in their view.

original: gal te nyan thos rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' dag bzhin du gnas te mthong ngo zhes smra na ni 'gal bar yang 'gyur grang na /🔽de dag de na gnas su zin kyang de mthong bar 'gyur ba'i 'du byed dang bral ba'i phyir dmus long @24a * //
analyzed: gal te nyan thos rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' dag bzhin du gnas te mthong ngo zhes smra na ni 'gal bar yang 'gyur grang na / de dag de na gnas su zin kyang de mthong bar 'gyur ba'i 'du byed dang bral ba'i phyir dmus long @24a * //
translated: If the Sravakas say that they see the Bodhisattvas as they are, then there is a contradiction.🔽Even though they are there, they do not see them, like the blind do not see the colors.

original: dang 'dra bar 'byor pa de lta bu de mi mthong bas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: dang 'dra bar 'byor pa de lta bu de mi mthong bas 'gal ba med do //
translated: They do not see that wealth because they lack the formative influence that would enable them to see it.

original: dper na gser la sogs pa la sol ba la sogs par mthong ba dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na gser la sogs pa la sol ba la sogs par mthong ba dang 'dra ste /
translated: For example, it is like seeing gold as coal, etc.

original: rang gi 'du byed kyi dbang gis gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi 'du byed kyi dbang gis gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One sees something else because of the power of one’s own formative influence.

original: yang na cung zad cig mthong na yang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis mthong bar zad kyi rang gi 'du byed kyi dbang gis mthong ba ma yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: yang na cung zad cig mthong na yang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis mthong bar zad kyi rang gi 'du byed kyi dbang gis mthong ba ma yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Or else, even if they see a little, they see by the power of the Buddha's blessing, not by the power of their own karma.

original: yang na de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po sha stag ste /
analyzed: yang na de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po sha stag ste /
translated: Or else, they are all great bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos kyi cha byad dang ming gis 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir de na gnas pa yin pas 'gal ba med do //🔽de la nyan thos kyi dge 'dun zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi cha byad dang ming gis 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir de na gnas pa yin pas 'gal ba med do // de la nyan thos kyi dge 'dun zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are there in the guise of sravakas, in order to convert those who are to be trained by sravakas.🔽As for the term sravaka-sangha,

original: nyan thos zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni nyan cing sgrogs pas na nyan thos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni nyan cing sgrogs pas na nyan thos zhes bya'o //
translated: the meaning of the term sravaka is one who hears and proclaims.

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni mang po 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni mang po 'dus pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the term sangha is a collection of many.

original: de yang tshul khrims mthun pa dang / lta ba mthun pa dang / 'tsho ba mthun pa dang / spyod pa mthun pa'i phyir bdud la sogs pas mi phyed pas na dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang tshul khrims mthun pa dang / lta ba mthun pa dang / 'tsho ba mthun pa dang / spyod pa mthun pa'i phyir bdud la sogs pas mi phyed pas na dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
translated: And that is called a sangha because it is not divided by Mara and so forth, due to its concordance in morality, concordance in view, concordance in livelihood, and concordance in practice.

original: tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni grangs tshad med pa dang / yon tan tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni grangs tshad med pa dang / yon tan tshad med pa'o //
translated: The phrase “immeasurable” refers to immeasurable number and immeasurable quality.

original: de la grangs tshad med pa ni bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la grangs tshad med pa ni bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, immeasurable number is because it transcends enumeration.

original: yon tan tshad med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan tshad med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is immeasurable quality like?

original: de'i phyir thams cad kyang cang shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad kyang cang shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that “all of them are well-bred, etc.”

original: de la cang shes pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa rnams dang 'gal bar mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la cang shes pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa rnams dang 'gal bar mi byed pa ste /
translated: Among them, the phrase “well-bred” means that they do not violate the precepts.

original: dmu rgod ma yin pa'i phyir rta cang shes lta bu'o //
analyzed: dmu rgod ma yin pa'i phyir rta cang shes lta bu'o //
translated: Because they are not wild, they are like well-bred horses.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na cang shes pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na cang shes pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, in another sense, the phrase “well-bred” means fearlessness.

original: 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir mdo las cang shes pa rnam pa lngar gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir mdo las cang shes pa rnam pa lngar gsungs te /
translated: Because they are fearless, the Sūtra teaches five kinds of well-bred horses.

original: lce 'bab pa la sogs pa bag tsha ba 'byung bar dogs pa med pas khyu mchog cang shes dang / 'thab mo'i 'jigs pa med pas glang po che dang / rta cang shes dang / gzhan gyis gnod par byed pa'i 'jigs pa med pas seng ge cang shes dang /
analyzed: lce 'bab pa la sogs pa bag tsha ba 'byung bar dogs pa med pas khyu mchog cang shes dang / 'thab mo'i 'jigs pa med pas glang po che dang / rta cang shes dang / gzhan gyis gnod par byed pa'i 'jigs pa med pas seng ge cang shes dang /
translated: They are like the best of lions, because they are not afraid of being harmed by others.

original: 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med pas dgra bcom pa cang shes so //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med pas dgra bcom pa cang shes so //
translated: They are like the best of arhats, because they are not afraid of death.

original: mdor na bag tsha ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdor na bag tsha ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, fear is of four types:

original: sdug bsngal gyi bag tsha ba dang / 'jigs pa'i bag tsha ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyi bag tsha ba dang / mi shes pas bag tsha ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bag tsha ba dang / 'jigs pa'i bag tsha ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyi bag tsha ba dang / mi shes pas bag tsha ba'o //
translated: fear of suffering, fear of danger, fear of worldly things, and fear of the unknown.

original: dgra bcom pa la ni bag tsha ba de dag med pas bde ba thob pa dang / mi skrag pa thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob pa dang / dbyugs dbyung @24b ba thob pa zhes bya ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la ni bag tsha ba de dag med pas bde ba thob pa dang / mi skrag pa thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob pa dang / dbyugs dbyung @24b ba thob pa zhes bya ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: Since arhats are free of these fears, they are said to have attained happiness, attained fearlessness, attained freedom from fear, and attained freedom from anxiety, respectively.

original: de la mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba rnams mya ngan med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bag tsha ba med do //
analyzed: de la mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba rnams mya ngan med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bag tsha ba med do //
translated: anxiety, or despair.

original: bdag gis smad pa dang / gzhan gyis smad pa dang / ngan 'gro dang / 'tsho ba med pa dang / chad pas bcad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang / 'tshe bas 'jigs pa rnams med pas 'jigs pa'i bag tsha ba med do //
analyzed: bdag gis smad pa dang / gzhan gyis smad pa dang / ngan 'gro dang / 'tsho ba med pa dang / chad pas bcad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang / 'tshe bas 'jigs pa rnams med pas 'jigs pa'i bag tsha ba med do //
translated: There is no anxiety about fear, because there is no fear of being blamed by oneself, by others, or by the gods, of going to a bad rebirth, of dying, of being punished, of being cut off from the opportunity to practice, or of being harmed.

original: rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis gos pa med pas 'jig rten gyi chos kyi bag tsha ba med do //🔽mi shes pa dang / the tshom gyi shes pa dang / log par shes pa'i bar du gcod pa rnams med pas /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis gos pa med pas 'jig rten gyi chos kyi bag tsha ba med do // mi shes pa dang / the tshom gyi shes pa dang / log par shes pa'i bar du gcod pa rnams med pas /
translated: There is no anxiety about the worldly concerns, because one is not affected by gain or loss, fame or obscurity, praise or blame, pleasure or pain.

original: mi shes pa'i bag tsha ba med nga /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i bag tsha ba med nga /
translated: There is no anxiety about ignorance, because there is no ignorance, no knowledge that is doubtful or mistaken, and no obstacles.🔽There is no anxiety about the next life, because one has no doubt about the ripening of karma.

original: de ltar bag tsha ba med pa'i phyir cang shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bag tsha ba med pa'i phyir cang shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because he is free from anxiety, he is called “one who is completely tractable.

original: cang shes pa de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bcu gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: cang shes pa de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bcu gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: ” The perfection of being completely tractable should be understood as being of thirteen kinds:

original: gnyis su med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / shin tu dul ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsngags pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / dkyel phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / mthun pa'i lam du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / shin tu dul ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsngags pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / dkyel phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / mthun pa'i lam du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: the perfection of non-duality, the perfection of complete self-control, the perfection of praise, the perfection of generosity, the perfection of cause, the perfection of traveling on a suitable path,

original: myur ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / ring du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'gro ba mang po phun sum tshogs pa dang / yongs su spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshogs pa dang nye bar zhi ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: myur ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / ring du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'gro ba mang po phun sum tshogs pa dang / yongs su spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshogs pa dang nye bar zhi ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: the perfection of speed, the perfection of going far, the perfection of a great retinue, the perfection of enjoyment, the perfection of assembly and complete peace,

original: 'grogs na bde ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbang du gyur pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'grogs na bde ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbang du gyur pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of being pleasant to be with, and the perfection of mastery.

original: phun sum tshogs pa bcu gsum po de dag kyang mdo las sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la shin tu zhugs pa sha stag ces gsungs pa'i bar gyi tshig nyi shu rtsa bdun las /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa bcu gsum po de dag kyang mdo las sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la shin tu zhugs pa sha stag ces gsungs pa'i bar gyi tshig nyi shu rtsa bdun las /
translated: These thirteen perfections are indicated by the twenty seven words of the sutra from “the sons of the Buddha” up to “who have entered the teaching of the Tathagata.”

original: gcig dang / gnyis dang / gcig dang / gcig dang / gsum dang / gsum dang / bcu dang / gcig dang / gcig dang / gcig dang / gcig dang / gcig dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: gcig dang / gnyis dang / gcig dang / gcig dang / gsum dang / gsum dang / bcu dang / gcig dang / gcig dang / gcig dang / gcig dang / gcig dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: They are applied in order to the first two, the first, the first, the first, the first, the first, the first, the first, the first, the first, the first, and the first perfections.

original: de la dang por gnyis su med pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la dang por gnyis su med pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In the first place, in order to demonstrate the perfection of nonduality,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the sutra says “the sons of the Buddha.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung gi stobs kyis 'phags pa'i lam las skyes pa'i phyir yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi gdung @25a * //🔽yang dag par 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung gi stobs kyis 'phags pa'i lam las skyes pa'i phyir yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi gdung @25a * //🔽yang dag par 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The sons of the Buddha are so called because they are born from the path of the aryas through the power of the Tathagata’s teaching, but not because they are the lineage of the Buddha.🔽They are the holders of the lineage of the Buddha.

original: nyan thos rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sras zhal las skyes pa chos las skyes pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sras zhal las skyes pa chos las skyes pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the śrāvakas are the Bhagavat’s sons, born from his mouth, born from the Dharma.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi gdung yang dag par 'dzin pa ma yin du zin kyang zhal nas skyes pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang khyad par med par sangs rgyas kyi sras su 'dra bas na de'i phyir gnyis su med pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi gdung yang dag par 'dzin pa ma yin du zin kyang zhal nas skyes pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang khyad par med par sangs rgyas kyi sras su 'dra bas na de'i phyir gnyis su med pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes
translated: Even though they are not holders of the lineage of the Buddha, they are not different from the bodhisattvas in being born from the mouth. Therefore, they are similar to the bodhisattvas in being sons of the Buddha. Therefore, it is called the perfection of non-duality.🔽After that, with regard to the teaching on the perfection of complete self-control,

original: bya'o // de'i 'og tu shin tu dul ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: bya'o // de'i 'og tu shin tu dul ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: it is said:

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: “With a mind completely liberated,

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: with wisdom completely liberated.”

original: de la sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i sred pa'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: de la sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i sred pa'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Here, “with a mind completely liberated” means liberated from all phenomena that are afflicted by the aspect of craving in the three realms.

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The expression his mind is liberated by perfect knowledge means that

original: khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad las rnam par grol ba ste ;
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad las rnam par grol ba ste ;
translated: he is liberated from all the defiled things that are the side of nescience in the three realms.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang rnam par bral ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol bas sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang rnam par bral ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol bas sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he is free from passion, he is called one whose mind is liberated by perfect knowledge.

original: ma rig pa dang rnam par bral ba'i phyir shes rab rnam par grol bas shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang rnam par bral ba'i phyir shes rab rnam par grol bas shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he is free from nescience, he is called one whose mind is liberated by perfect knowledge.🔽 The expression he has attained the perfection of the abandonment of all the defilements means that

original: de la sred pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas /🔽ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa ni sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sred pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa ni sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: he has attained the perfection of the abandonment of the defilements that are the side of passion and the secondary passions.🔽The expression he has attained the perfection of the abandonment of all the defilements means that

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas thob par bya ba dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi shes pa ni shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas thob par bya ba dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi shes pa ni shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: he has attained the perfection of the abandonment of all the defilements.

original: de la sems rnam par grol ba thob pas ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: de la sems rnam par grol ba thob pas ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol lo //
translated: By attaining the liberation of mind, one is liberated from the obscurations to meditative concentration.

original: shes rab rnam par grol ba thob pa sa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: shes rab rnam par grol ba thob pa sa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol lo //
translated: By attaining the liberation of wisdom, one is liberated from the obscurations of the afflictions.

original: gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba dag ni sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba dag ni sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are liberated from both aspects are called “those whose minds are completely liberated” and “those whose wisdom is completely liberated.”

original: de ltar khams gsum pa'i sred pa'i phyogs dang / ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa shin tu ma dul ba'i mtshan nyid dag las sems dang shes rab shin tu rnam par grol bas na de'i phyir shin tu dul ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khams gsum pa'i sred pa'i phyogs dang / ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa shin tu ma dul ba'i mtshan nyid dag las sems dang shes rab shin tu rnam par grol bas na de'i phyir shin tu dul ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because their minds and wisdom are completely liberated from the afflictions of craving and ignorance in the three realms, which are characterized by being completely undisciplined, they are called “those who are completely disciplined and perfect.”

original: de'i 'og tu bsngags pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsngags pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Next, in order to demonstrate the perfection of praise,

original: tshul khrims shin tu rnam @25b par dag pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tshul khrims shin tu rnam @25b par dag pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he said, “They have completely pure moral discipline.”

original: tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Pure morality is the morality endowed with six factors.

original: yan lag drug ni tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
analyzed: yan lag drug ni tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
translated: The six factors are: to maintain morality, to be restrained by the pratimoksa vow, to have perfect ritual, to have perfect behavior, to view even the slightest fault as dangerous, and

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te slob bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te slob bar byed pa yin no //
translated: to train in the precepts that one has taken up.

original: de la ji ltar na tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one maintain morality?

original: bslab pa'i gzhi ji ltar yang dag par blangs pa dag la lus kyi las kyi mtha' ma log pa dang / ngag gi las kyi mtha' ma log par gyur cing ma nyams par byed pa dang / skyon med par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi ji ltar yang dag par blangs pa dag la lus kyi las kyi mtha' ma log pa dang / ngag gi las kyi mtha' ma log par gyur cing ma nyams par byed pa dang / skyon med par byed pa yin no //
translated: One maintains morality by not distorting the limits of physical action and not distorting the limits of verbal action with regard to the precepts that one has taken up, by not violating them, and by not letting them deteriorate.

original: ji ltar na so sor thar ba'i sdom pas bsdams pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na so sor thar ba'i sdom pas bsdams pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he restrained by the pratimoksa vow?

original: sde tshan bdun po dag gi tshul khrims ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ste /🔽skabs 'dir ni dge slong gi sdom pa las brten nas /
analyzed: sde tshan bdun po dag gi tshul khrims ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ste / skabs 'dir ni dge slong gi sdom pa las brten nas /
translated: The morality of the seven groups is called the pratimoksa vow.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this context, he is called restrained by the pratimoksa vow because he relies on the vow of a fully ordained monk.

original: ji ltar na cho ga phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na /🔽spyod lam mam /🔽'phral gyi bya ba 'am /🔽dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba la brten nas 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun zhing 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang / rjes su mthun zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar na cho ga phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na / spyod lam mam / 'phral gyi bya ba 'am / dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba la brten nas 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun zhing 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang / rjes su mthun zhing /
translated: How is he endowed with perfect ritual?🔽He is endowed with a ritual that is in accordance with the world and not in conflict with the world,

original: 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba'i cho ga dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba'i cho ga dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: and in accordance with the Vinaya and not in conflict with the Vinaya, in terms of his deportment,🔽his immediate actions,🔽or his application to virtue.

original: ji ltar na spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he endowed with a perfect domain?

original: dge slong gi spyod yul ma yin pa de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa lnga'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi spyod yul ma yin pa de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa lnga'o //
translated: There are five domains that the Tathagata has condemned as not being the domain of a fully ordained monk.

original: shan ba'i gnas dang / smad 'tshong ma'i gnas dang / chang 'tshong gi gnas dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang ; gdol pa'i khyim rnams spangs nas spyod yul kha na ma tho ba med pa gzhan dag tu spyod par byed cing der yang dus su spyod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: shan ba'i gnas dang / smad 'tshong ma'i gnas dang / chang 'tshong gi gnas dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang ; gdol pa'i khyim rnams spangs nas spyod yul kha na ma tho ba med pa gzhan dag tu spyod par byed cing der yang dus su spyod par byed pa yin no //
translated: He avoids the places of butchers, prostitutes, bars, the king’s palace, and outcastes, and he goes to other places that are not offensive. He also goes there at the right time.

original: ji ltar khan ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar khan ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does he see danger in the slightest faults?

original: bslab pa'i gzhi phra ba gang dag la ltung ba 'byung ba dang / ltung ba 'byung ba de la ches chung ngus ltung bar 'gyur ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra mo de dag la yang bdag ltung ba byung bar gyur na gzhi des bdag la ma legs par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi phra ba gang dag la ltung ba 'byung ba dang / ltung ba 'byung ba de la ches chung ngus ltung bar 'gyur ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra mo de dag la yang bdag ltung ba byung bar gyur na gzhi des bdag la ma legs par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: He thinks, “If I were to commit a downfall in regard to the minor points of training, even in regard to the most minor downfalls, it would not be good for me.”

original: des 'jigs par lta zhing srog gi phyir yang bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra mo de dag la bsams bzhin du ltung ba 'byin par mi byed @26a * //🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: des 'jigs par lta zhing srog gi phyir yang bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshegs phra mo de dag la bsams bzhin du ltung ba 'byin par mi byed @26a * // pa yin no //
translated: They fear even the slightest downfall and do not intentionally commit even a minor infraction out of concern for their life.

original: ji ltar na bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te slob par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te slob par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How do they train in the precepts they have taken?

original: sngon so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sngon so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i tshe /
translated: When they first take the pratimok˝ha vows,🔽they receive full ordination through the rite of proposal and four requests.

original: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa na bslab pa'i gzhi che long rnams kyi rang bzhin thos shing de las gzhan pa bslab pa'i lhag ma so sor thar pa'i mdo las gsungs pa nyis brgya lnga bcu po las 'phral du ma thos pa
analyzed: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa na bslab pa'i gzhi che long rnams kyi rang bzhin thos shing de las gzhan pa bslab pa'i lhag ma so sor thar pa'i mdo las gsungs pa nyis brgya lnga bcu po las 'phral du ma thos pa
translated: When they hear the nature of the major precepts, they also understand that they have other precepts, the remaining precepts, the two hundred and fifty rules of the pratimok˝ha, that they have not heard at that time.🔽They learn these precepts when they recite the pratimok˝ha

original: dag kyang zla ba phyed phyed bzhin so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i tshe'am /🔽gnas skabs gzhan dag tu mkhan po'am /
analyzed: dag kyang zla ba phyed phyed bzhin so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i tshe'am / gnas skabs gzhan dag tu mkhan po'am /
translated: every half month or when they study them at other times with their preceptor,

original: slob dpon nam /
analyzed: slob dpon nam /
translated: teacher,

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gtam 'dres pa'am /🔽phebs par smra ba'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gtam 'dres pa'am / phebs par smra ba'am /
translated: Having heard it from companions in the celibate life,

original: smos 'drin nam /
analyzed: smos 'drin nam /
translated: from those who are friendly,🔽from those who are intimate,

original: 'grogs bshes dag las thos nas thams cad la bslab bar bya'o zhes dam bca' bas yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: 'grogs bshes dag las thos nas thams cad la bslab bar bya'o zhes dam bca' bas yang dag par blangs te /
translated: or from those who are acquaintances, one should train in all of them.

original: de phyin chad bslab pa'i gzhi de dag la lhag chad med par slob cing /
analyzed: de phyin chad bslab pa'i gzhi de dag la lhag chad med par slob cing /
translated: After that, one trains in the bases of training without addition or omission,

original: don dang tshig 'bru phyin ci ma log par yongs su 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: don dang tshig 'bru phyin ci ma log par yongs su 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
translated: and one holds the meaning and the words without error.

original: de ltar yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yan lag drug dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who possesses morality endowed with these six aspects is said to have completely pure morality.

original: yang na zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, it is because one has attained uncontaminated morality.

original: de yang mthong ba'i lam la tshul khrims mngon par rtogs nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de yang mthong ba'i lam la tshul khrims mngon par rtogs nas bzung ste /
translated: Moreover, having realized morality on the path of seeing,

original: mi slob pa'i lam thob pa'i bar gyi gnas skabs na 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa la sogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam thob pa'i bar gyi gnas skabs na 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa la sogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: one possesses the morality pleasing to the noble ones and so on during the period up to attaining the path of no more learning.

original: de ltar yan lag drug dang ldan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa ni yon tan thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa yin pas na de'i phyir bsngags pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yan lag drug dang ldan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa ni yon tan thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa yin pas na de'i phyir bsngags pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, having the six limbs and uncontaminated morality that is extremely pure is the basis of all good qualities. Therefore, it is called the perfection of praise.

original: de'i 'og tu dkyel phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dkyel phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, with the intention of teaching the perfection of generosity,🔽he said:

original: chos 'dod pa rnams dang bde bar phrad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos 'dod pa rnams dang bde bar phrad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “Meeting with those who desire the Dharma and happiness.”

original: chos 'dod pa rnams dang bde bar phrad pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor chos 'dod pa rnams bdag gi drung du nye bar 'ongs nas bdag nyid tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i longs spyod las yongs su nyams pa la tshegs mi lta zhing 'dzum pa sngar gtong
analyzed: chos 'dod pa rnams dang bde bar phrad pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor chos 'dod pa rnams bdag gi drung du nye bar 'ongs nas bdag nyid tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i longs spyod las yongs su nyams pa la tshegs mi lta zhing 'dzum pa sngar gtong
translated: “Meeting with those who desire the Dharma and happiness” means that when those in the retinue who desire the Dharma come into my presence, I do not look at the difficulty of giving up my own happiness in this life and I first give a smile.

original: ba dang / tshur shog 'ongs pa legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsong por smra zhing de dag bdag nyid dang bde bar spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ba dang / tshur shog 'ongs pa legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsong por smra zhing de dag bdag nyid dang bde bar spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: and with a friendly face, he or she welcomes them with such words as “Come here! Welcome!” and makes them feel at ease.

original: yang na bdag nyid chos 'dod pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa na kun shes pa'i @26b sems nye bar 'jog pa klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pa med pa dang / spyod lam ngan pa yongs su spangs pas bdag nyid dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bde bar phrad par byed pa'o //🔽de ltar 'khor chos 'dod pa rnams bdag nyid dang bde bar spros pa 'am /
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid chos 'dod pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa na kun shes pa'i @26b sems nye bar 'jog pa klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pa med pa dang / spyod lam ngan pa yongs su spangs pas bdag nyid dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bde bar phrad par byed pa'o // de ltar 'khor chos 'dod pa rnams bdag nyid dang bde bar spros pa 'am /
translated: Or else, when a person who is desirous of the Dharma meets a spiritual teacher, he or she should establish his or her mind in full knowledge, free of any thoughts of finding fault and with a demeanor that is free of any pretense.🔽In this way, a person who is desirous of the Dharma meets a spiritual teacher and makes him or herself feel at ease.

original: bdag nyid chos 'dod pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad par byed pa ni yon tan gyi dkyel che ba yin pas na de'i phyir dkyel phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid chos 'dod pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad par byed pa ni yon tan gyi dkyel che ba yin pas na de'i phyir dkyel phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since this is a great quality, it is called “perfection of generosity.”

original: de'i 'og tu rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the perfection of the cause, he says:

original: mang du thos pa /
analyzed: mang du thos pa /
translated: “Having heard much, he or she retains what has been learned.”

original: thos pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: thos pa 'dzin pa /
translated: 2. he is a holder of what he has heard,

original: thos pa bsags pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thos pa bsags pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: 3. he is one who has accumulated what he has heard.

original: de la mang du thos pa zhes bya ba ni sde snod gsum las brtsams pa ste gzhung du ma dag mgo mjug chub par nyan cing gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mang du thos pa zhes bya ba ni sde snod gsum las brtsams pa ste gzhung du ma dag mgo mjug chub par nyan cing gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, he is one who has heard much, because he has heard and retained many texts, beginning with the Three Baskets.

original: thos pa 'dzin pa zhes bya bas ni de dag gi don 'dzin pa ste /🔽thos pa'i don kun 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa 'dzin pa zhes bya bas ni de dag gi don 'dzin pa ste / thos pa'i don kun 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is a holder of what he has heard, because he holds their meaning.

original: thos pa bsags pa zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i don ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar sde snod gsum las brtsams te /
analyzed: thos pa bsags pa zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i don ston par byed pa'i phyir ro // de ltar sde snod gsum las brtsams te /
translated: He is one who has accumulated what he has heard, because he teaches the meaning of both of them.🔽Thus, he is one who has heard much, who holds what he has heard, and who has accumulated what he has heard, beginning with the Three Baskets.

original: mang du thos pa dang / thos pa 'dzin pa dang / thos pa bsags pa'i blo rgya che ba yin pas na de'i phyir rgyu phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mang du thos pa dang / thos pa 'dzin pa dang / thos pa bsags pa'i blo rgya che ba yin pas na de'i phyir rgyu phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called one who is endowed with the cause, because his mind is vast.

original: de'i 'og tu mthun pa'i lam du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mthun pa'i lam du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the perfection of the path that is suitable, he says:
