original: legs par bsam pa sems pa /
analyzed: legs par bsam pa sems pa /
translated: 1. He is one who reflects well on what is well thought out,

original: legs par smra ba brjod pa /
analyzed: legs par smra ba brjod pa /
translated: 2. he is one who speaks well about what is well spoken,🔽3. he is one who is well established in the practice of what is well taught.

original: legs par bya ba'i las byed pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: legs par bya ba'i las byed pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: They are those who do what is right.

original: byis pa rnams ni yid kyi nyes par spyod pa gsum dang / ngag gi nyes par spyod pa bzhi dang / lus kyi nyes bar dgag pa gsum spyod pas /
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni yid kyi nyes par spyod pa gsum dang / ngag gi nyes par spyod pa bzhi dang / lus kyi nyes bar dgag pa gsum spyod pas /
translated: Fools engage in the three mental misdeeds, the four verbal misdeeds, and the three physical misdeeds.

original: nyes par bsam pa sems pa /
analyzed: nyes par bsam pa sems pa /
translated: They think bad thoughts,

original: nyes par smra ba brjod pa /
analyzed: nyes par smra ba brjod pa /
translated: speak bad words,🔽and do bad deeds.

original: nyes par byed pa'i las byed pa yin pa'i phyir ngan 'gro dang 'khor ba'i rgyud du 'gro ba yin gyi /
analyzed: nyes par byed pa'i las byed pa yin pa'i phyir ngan 'gro dang 'khor ba'i rgyud du 'gro ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, they go to the miserable realms and to cyclic existence.🔽Aryas, on the other hand, are the opposite of that.

translated: Therefore, they are said to be “those who go well on the path” because they are in accord with the paths of definite goodness and high status.

analyzed: de'i 'og tu myur ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /

original: shes rab myur ba /🔽shes rab mgyogs pa /

original: shes rab rno ba /🔽nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab can /

analyzed: nges par rtogs pa'i shes rab can / shes rab che ba /
translated: 10. He has the wisdom of certain understanding.🔽11. He has great wisdom.

analyzed: shes rab yangs pa / shes rab zab pa / shes rab mnyam pa med pa /

translated: Here, “swift wisdom” means that he quickly penetrates the meaning of the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathagata.

original: shes rab mgyogs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid kyi don mang po la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab mgyogs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid kyi don mang po la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: “Quick wisdom” means that he penetrates many meanings of those very things.

analyzed: mang po la 'gro ba ni mgyogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Going to many” is called “quick.”

original: shes rab rno ba zhes bya ba ni don cha phra ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab rno ba zhes bya ba ni don cha phra ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Sharp wisdom” means that he penetrates subtle meanings.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab can zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab zag pa med pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab can zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab zag pa med pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Wisdom of certain deliverance” means that he has attained the uncontaminated wisdom that is certain to deliver from cyclic existence.

original: nges par rtogs pa'i shes rab can zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa'i shes rab can zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: One who has the wisdom of definite realization is so called because he has the purpose of nirvana.

original: nges par rtogs pa ni gtan la bab par rtogs pa de mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa ni gtan la bab par rtogs pa de mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Realization is definite realization, and that is nirvana.

original: de'i dgos pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab ni nges par rtogs pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: de'i dgos pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab ni nges par rtogs pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: The wisdom that has that purpose is the wisdom of definite realization.

original: de gang la yod pa'i gang zag ni nges par rtogs pa'i shes rab can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa'i gang zag ni nges par rtogs pa'i shes rab can zhes bya'o //
translated: The person who has that is called one who has the wisdom of definite realization.

original: shes rab che ba zhes bya ba ni dris pa lan gdab ba la mtha' thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab che ba zhes bya ba ni dris pa lan gdab ba la mtha' thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who has great wisdom is so called because his answers to questions are inexhaustible.

original: shes rab yangs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa rgya chen po yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab yangs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa rgya chen po yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who has vast wisdom is so called because he has fully completed the vast superknowledges.

original: shes rab zab pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab zab pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One who has profound wisdom is so called because others find it difficult to fathom his depth.

original: shes rab mnyam pa med pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dbang po rtul po dag las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab mnyam pa med pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dbang po rtul po dag las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom without equal means that it is superior to the wisdom of the dull-facultied sravakas.

original: shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi mchog thob par byed pas rin po che dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab rin po che dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi mchog thob par byed pas rin po che dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom endowed with jewels means that it is like a jewel because it obtains the supreme meaning.

original: de ltar shes rab myur ba la sogs pa 'phags pa nyan thos kyi shes rab rnam pa bcu po de dag dang ldan pa ni mngon par shes pa myur ba yin pas na de'i phyir myur ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab myur ba la sogs pa 'phags pa nyan thos kyi shes rab rnam pa bcu po de dag dang ldan pa ni mngon par shes pa myur ba yin pas na de'i phyir myur ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the noble sravaka who possesses these ten kinds of wisdom, such as swift wisdom, has swift higher knowledge. Therefore, it is called the perfection of swiftness.

original: de'i 'og tu ring du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ring du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, with regard to the teaching on the perfection of going far,

analyzed: rig pa gsum dang ldan pa ni mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: Endowed with the three knowledges means that he obtains the three knowledges of the non-learner.

analyzed: mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i rig pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i rig pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i rig pa'o //
translated: The three knowledges of the nonlearner are: the knowledge of the superknowledge that manifests the knowledge of recollecting former abodes, the knowledge of the superknowledge that manifests the knowledge of death and rebirth, and the knowledge of the superknowledge that manifests the knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: de ltar mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum gyis sngon @27b dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi gting slebs par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir ring du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //

translated: Thus, because the three knowledges of the nonlearner reach the depths of all phenomena of the past, future, and present, whether contaminated or uncontaminated, therefore it is called the perfection of going far.

original: de'i 'og tu 'gro ba bzang po phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'gro ba bzang po phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /

translated: Thus, attaining the actual basis of meditative stabilization and meditative attainment of cessation is the path of abiding in happiness in this life. Therefore, it is called “the excellent path that is perfect.”

translated: The one who practices with vigilance in all behaviors, such as walking, standing, sitting, and lying down, is the one who has the complete pacification of behavior.

analyzed: bya'o ; / de'i 'og tu 'grogs na bde ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the perfection of being easy to live with,

analyzed: bzod pa dang nges pa chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: de ltar bzod pa dang des pa chen po dang ldan pa ni bsten par bya ba'i 'os yin pas na /
translated: Thus, because he is endowed with great patience and gentleness, he is worthy of being attended upon.

analyzed: de'i phyir 'grogs na bde ba phun sum tshogs ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is said to be endowed with the perfection of being easy to live with.

original: de'i 'og tu dbang du gyur pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dbang du gyur pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the perfection of being in control,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la shin tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la shin tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, he is one who has thoroughly entered into the Tathagata's teaching.

original: bslab pa dag la yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' mi 'gal bar spyod pas na bka' la shin tu zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa dag la yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' mi 'gal bar spyod pas na bka' la shin tu zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He is one who has thoroughly entered into the teaching, because he practices without contradicting the Tathagata's teaching, by perfecting the trainings.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la shin tu zhugs pa ni nyon mongs pa gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bslab pa dag la bag yangs su spyod pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la shin tu zhugs pa ni nyon mongs pa gzhan gyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bslab pa dag la bag yangs su spyod pa yin pas na /
translated: Thus, one who is thoroughly engaged in the word of the Tathāgata is one who practices the trainings with ease, because he is not controlled by other afflictions.

original: de'i phyir dbang du gyur pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang du gyur pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of control.

original: sha stag dang zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi 'khor phun sum tshogs pa yon tan tshad med pa de lta bu dang ldan pa grangs tshad med pa sha stag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang yang thabs cig go zhes tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ro //

translated: The word “only” is connected with the following sentence: “with an immeasurable assembly of śrāvakas, who were all of such immeasurable good qualities, and with an assembly of bodhisattvas.”

original: nyan thos kyi 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the perfection of the śrāvaka assembly has already been explained.

original: // / de ltar nyan thos kyi 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar nyan thos kyi 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of the śrāvaka assembly,

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Then, in order to demonstrate the excellent retinue of bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa thams cad kyang gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

translated: it says that the bodhisattvas gathered from different buddhafields are all immeasurable and have entered the great stage.

translated: and to generate faith in some who think, “If even bodhisattvas have such qualities,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lta smos kyang ci @28b dgos snyam du dad pa bskyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: what need is there to mention the Tathāgata?”

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni chen po rnam pa gsum gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chen po brjod de /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni chen po rnam pa gsum gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chen po brjod de /
translated: The greatness of the bodhisattvas is described in terms of three greatnesses:

original: grangs chen po dang / yon tan chen po dang / las chen pos so //
analyzed: grangs chen po dang / yon tan chen po dang / las chen pos so //
translated: great number, great virtue, and great activity.

original: de la grangs chen po ni /
analyzed: de la grangs chen po ni /
translated: Great number is

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa zhes gsungs pas bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa zhes gsungs pas bstan to //
translated: indicated by the statement that the bodhisattvas assembled from different buddha-fields were innumerable.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa nas 'dus ba zhes bya ba gsungs pa ni don du mi gnyer bas chos nyan du mi 'gro ba dang / le los chos nyan du mi 'gro ba dang / nga rgyal gyi dbang gis chos nyan du mi 'gro ba de dag gi gnyen por bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa nas 'dus ba zhes bya ba gsungs pa ni don du mi gnyer bas chos nyan du mi 'gro ba dang / le los chos nyan du mi 'gro ba dang / nga rgyal gyi dbang gis chos nyan du mi 'gro ba de dag gi gnyen por bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The statement that they assembled from different buddha-fields indicates the antidotes to the three kinds of non-application: non-application due to lack of interest, non-application due to laziness, and non-application due to pride.

original: de la don du mi gnyer bas chos nyan du mi 'gro ba dag gi gnyen por ni de dag kyang bdag nyid chos mnyan pa don du gnyer bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pha gzhan dang gzhan nas 'ongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la don du mi gnyer bas chos nyan du mi 'gro ba dag gi gnyen por ni de dag kyang bdag nyid chos mnyan pa don du gnyer bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pha gzhan dang gzhan nas 'ongs pa yin gyi /
translated: The remedy for those who do not go to listen to the Dharma because they are not interested in its meaning is taught by the fact that they have come from other different buddha fields because they are interested in listening to the Dharma.

original: gzhan gyi dring 'jog pas ni ma yin pas gzhan dag gis kyang ci'i phyir chos mnyan pa don du gnyer bar mi bya zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring 'jog pas ni ma yin pas gzhan dag gis kyang ci'i phyir chos mnyan pa don du gnyer bar mi bya zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they are not dependent on others, why should others not be interested in listening to the Dharma?

original: le los chos nyan du mi 'gro ba dag gi gnyen por ni de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa thag ring po dag nas brtson 'grus kyi stobs bskyed pa chen pos chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dir 'ongs pa yin na /
analyzed: le los chos nyan du mi 'gro ba dag gi gnyen por ni de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa thag ring po dag nas brtson 'grus kyi stobs bskyed pa chen pos chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dir 'ongs pa yin na /
translated: The remedy for those who do not go to listen to the Dharma because of laziness is taught by the fact that they have come here from other distant buddha fields with great strength of effort in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: gzhan dag le los nyan du mi 'gro ba de dag ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag le los nyan du mi 'gro ba de dag ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they are not dependent on others, it is not right for others to not go to listen to the Dharma out of laziness.

original: nga rgyal gyi dbang gis chos nyan du mi 'gro ba dag gi gnyen por ni 'byor pa chen po dang ldan pa de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa gzhan dag nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'ongs na gzhan dag ci'i phyir 'dod par mi bya snyam
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi dbang gis chos nyan du mi 'gro ba dag gi gnyen por ni 'byor pa chen po dang ldan pa de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa gzhan dag nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'ongs na gzhan dag ci'i phyir 'dod par mi bya snyam
translated: As an antidote to those who do not go to listen to the teachings out of pride, the Buddha said, “Even those who possess great wealth come from other different buddhafields to listen to the teachings, so why would others not want to listen?”🔽

original: du sems par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du sems par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The antidote to those who do not go to hear the Dharma out of pride is the thought: “Even those who are endowed with great wealth come from other different buddha-fields to hear the Dharma. Why should others not desire it?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni bla na med pa'i byang chub dang sems can thams cad la dmigs te sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni bla na med pa'i byang chub dang sems can thams cad la dmigs te sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the word “bodhisattva” is the generation of the mind that aims at unsurpassed enlightenment and all sentient beings.

original: yang gcig tu na byang chub ces bya ba ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na byang chub ces bya ba ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, “enlightenment” is the possession of realization,

original: sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni snying stobs dang ldan pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni snying stobs dang ldan pa la bya'o //
translated: and “heroic mind” is the possession of courage.

original: dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
translated: “Immeasurable” means beyond counting.

original: de nyid kyi grangs chen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi grangs chen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: That itself is the teaching of a great number.

original: yon tan chen po ni chen po rnam pa dgus rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yon tan chen po ni chen po rnam pa dgus rig par bya ste /
translated: The great qualities should be understood as ninefold:

original: brtson 'grus chen po dang / rgyu chen po dang / dmigs pa chen po dang / dus chen po dang / @29a * //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po dang / rgyu chen po dang / dmigs pa chen po dang / dus chen po dang / @29a * //
translated: great effort, great cause, great object, great time,

original: 'dod pa med pa chen po dang / yid la byed pa chen po dang / rtogs pa chen po dang / yongs su dag pa chen po dang / rtogs pa chen pos so //
analyzed: 'dod pa med pa chen po dang / yid la byed pa chen po dang / rtogs pa chen po dang / yongs su dag pa chen po dang / rtogs pa chen pos so //
translated: great lack of desire, great mental attention, great realization, great purification, and great realization.

original: de la brtson 'grus chen po ni thams cad kyang gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus chen po ni thams cad kyang gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: Great effort is indicated by the statement that all bodhisattvas are engaged in the great enterprise.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir gnas thams cad chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir gnas thams cad chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: They are engaged in the great enterprise because they are engaged in the great enterprise of protecting all sentient beings.

original: de la gnas chen po zhes bya ba ni chen po rnams kyi gnas gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas chen po zhes bya ba ni chen po rnams kyi gnas gang yin pa ste /
translated: The great enterprise is the basis of the great ones.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi gnas de theg pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi gnas de theg pa chen po yin no //
translated: The great vehicle is the basis of the great bodhisattvas.

original: de'i don gyi phyir yang dag par zhugs pa rnams ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pas na des ni brtson 'grus chen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i don gyi phyir yang dag par zhugs pa rnams ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pas na des ni brtson 'grus chen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: For that purpose, those who are correctly engaged are endowed with effort, and that indicates great effort.

original: rgyu chen po ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyis nges par 'byung ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: rgyu chen po ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyis nges par 'byung ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The great cause is indicated by the statement: “one is liberated by the Dharma of the Great Vehicle.”

original: theg pa chen po dang pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa lam gyi rang bzhin gyi chos la sogs pas thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa lam gyi rang bzhin gyi chos la sogs pas thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One is liberated by the Dharma of the Great Vehicle, which is included in the perfections, by the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation, and so on, which have the nature of the path.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos dang pha rol tu phyin pa ni lam gyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos dang pha rol tu phyin pa ni lam gyi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The Dharma of the Great Vehicle and the perfections have the nature of the path.

original: lam ni nges par 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pas na des ni rgyu chen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lam ni nges par 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pas na des ni rgyu chen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: The path is the cause of liberation, and that indicates the great cause.

original: dmigs pa chen po ni sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: dmigs pa chen po ni sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The great object is indicated by the statement: “one has equanimity toward all sentient beings.”

original: sems can thams cad la bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa'i sems thob pas byams pa chen po la sogs pas mnyam pa nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa'i sems thob pas byams pa chen po la sogs pas mnyam pa nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they have attained the attitude of sameness with regard to all sentient beings, they apply themselves to sameness through great love and so on.

original: sems can thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa'i yul yin la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa'i yul yin la /
translated: All sentient beings are the objective field of the bodhisattva.🔽They are the object of the attitude of sameness through immeasurable thoughts.

original: de dag la tshad med pa'i sems kyis mnyam pa nyid du dmigs par byed pas na des ni dmigs pa chen po bstan pa yin no //🔽dus chen po ni /
analyzed: de dag la tshad med pa'i sems kyis mnyam pa nyid du dmigs par byed pas na des ni dmigs pa chen po bstan pa yin no // dus chen po ni /
translated: This shows their great objective.

original: bskal pa dang bskal pa ma yin pa'i yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: bskal pa dang bskal pa ma yin pa'i yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: Great time is shown by the phrase free from all conceptions of eons and non-eons.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub dang sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i dus thams cad la skad cig gcig dang 'dra bar 'jug go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub dang sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i dus thams cad la skad cig gcig dang 'dra bar 'jug go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: For the sake of unexcelled enlightenment and the welfare of all sentient beings, they engage in all times until the end of time as if it were a single instant.

original: 'di ni bskal pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bskal pa yin te /
translated: This is an eon.

original: bskal pa gcig gi yud tsam zhig tu spyad par bya'o zhes snyam pa'am 'di ni bskal pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bskal pa gcig gi yud tsam zhig tu spyad par bya'o zhes snyam pa'am 'di ni bskal pa ma yin te /
translated: One should practice for a moment of an eon. Or, This is not an eon,

original: bskal pa bas thung ba'am /🔽bskal pa las lhag pa yin @29b pas de dag gi yud tsam zhig tu spyad par bya'o snyam du dus las yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir grub pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin bar byed
analyzed: bskal pa bas thung ba'am / bskal pa las lhag pa yin @29b pas de dag gi yud tsam zhig tu spyad par bya'o snyam du dus las yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir grub pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin bar byed
translated: it is shorter than an eon,🔽or it is longer than an eon, so one should practice for a moment of those.🔽 Because of being free from all such conceptions of time, one ripens one's own qualities of buddhahood up to the culmination of attainment and one ripens external sentient beings up to the culmination of time.

original: pa dang / dus kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par byed pas na des ni dus chen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa dang / dus kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par byed pas na des ni dus chen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it teaches great time.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du tshig gi don ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya bar yang 'dren te /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du tshig gi don ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya bar yang 'dren te /
translated: Again, in another enumeration, the meaning of the words is also interpreted as being free from all thought, conception and imagination.

original: de'i tshig gi don du na rtog pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshig gi don du na rtog pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid du rtog pa ste /
translated: In terms of the meaning of the words, “conception” means conceiving things as real.

original: 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: This is form.

original: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
translated: This is feeling.

original: 'di ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags so //
translated: This is attachment.🔽This is faith.

original: 'di ni dad pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur ngo bo nyid du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dad pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur ngo bo nyid du rtog pa'o //
translated: This is conceiving things as real.

original: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: “Discrimination” means discriminating things as distinct.

original: gzugs 'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: This form is contaminated.

original: 'di ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: This is uncontaminated.

original: tshor ba 'di ni sred pas brlan pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba 'di ni sred pas brlan pa'o //
translated: This feeling is moistened by craving.

original: 'di ni sred pas ma brlan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sred pas ma brlan pa'o //
translated: This is not moistened by craving.

original: 'dod chags 'di ni mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags 'di ni mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
translated: This attachment is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'di ni bsgom pas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgom pas spang bar bya'o //
translated: This is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: dad ba 'di ni las dang 'bras bu la yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: dad ba 'di ni las dang 'bras bu la yid ches pa'o //
translated: This faith is confidence in karma and its effects.🔽This is the initial aspiration for the Three Jewels and the four truths.

original: 'di ni dkon mchog dang bden pa la sems dang pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dkon mchog dang bden pa la sems dang pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is discriminating things as distinct.

original: yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu yongs su rtog pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu yongs su rtog pa ste /
translated: Thorough investigation is the investigation of the nature and the distinctions of things.

original: 'di ni gzugs te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs te /
translated: This is form.

original: gzugs 'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: This form is contaminated.

original: 'di ni zag pa med pa'o /
analyzed: 'di ni zag pa med pa'o /
translated: This is uncontaminated.

original: 'di ni tshor ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba ste /
translated: This is feeling.

original: tshor ba 'di ni sred pas brlan pa'o //🔽'di ni sred bsam brlan pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba 'di ni sred pas brlan pa'o // 'di ni sred bsam brlan pa'o //
translated: This feeling is moistened by craving.🔽This is moistened by the craving for existence.

original: 'di ni 'dod chags te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags te /
translated: This is attachment.

original: 'dod chags 'di ni mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags 'di ni mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
translated: This attachment is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'di ni bsgom pas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgom pas spang bar bya'o //
translated: This is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: 'di ni dad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dad pa ste /
translated: This is faith.

original: dad pa 'di ni las dang 'bras bu la yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa 'di ni las dang 'bras bu la yid ches pa'o //
translated: This faith is confidence in karma and its results.

original: 'di ni dkon mchog bden pa la sems dang ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dkon mchog bden pa la sems dang ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the clarity of mind with regard to the truths of the jewels.

original: de dag thams cad bral ba ni spyod pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad bral ba ni spyod pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: All of these are free from thorough investigation and full analysis because the four types of thorough investigation and full analysis are completely perfected.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / 'dzin pa med par sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang /🔽chags pa med par sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs @30a * //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / 'dzin pa med par sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / chags pa med par sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs @30a * //
translated: The practice of bringing beings to maturity without attachment is fulfilled by the perfection of compassion.

original: su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The practice of bringing about the maturity of the Buddha-qualities is fulfilled by the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la thabs mkhas pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: de la thabs mkhas pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa 'grub bo //
translated: Therein, the practice of the perfections is accomplished by skill in means.

original: yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa 'grub bo //
translated: The practice of the factors of enlightenment is accomplished by thorough acquaintance.

original: snying rjes ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa 'grub bo ;
analyzed: snying rjes ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa 'grub bo ;
translated: The practice of bringing beings to maturity is accomplished by compassion.

original: / shes rab kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa 'grub ste /
analyzed: / shes rab kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa 'grub ste /
translated: The practice of bringing about the maturity of the Buddha-qualities is accomplished by wisdom.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni thabs la mkhas pa dang / yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa dang / snying rje dang / shes rab dang ldan pas rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i nyan thos ltar 'gog pa'i stobs kyis bkag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni thabs la mkhas pa dang / yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa dang / snying rje dang / shes rab dang ldan pas rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i nyan thos ltar 'gog pa'i stobs kyis bkag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, endowed with skill in means, with the knowledge of thorough familiarity, with compassion, and with wisdom, is said to be free from all conceptualization. He is not like the śrāvaka who is blocked by the power of cessation.

original: tshig gi don de dag gis skabs gzhan du ni yon tan gzhan yang ston to //
analyzed: tshig gi don de dag gis skabs gzhan du ni yon tan gzhan yang ston to //
translated: By these topics, other qualities are also taught in other contexts.

original: skabs 'dir ni de dag gis kyang dus chen po nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni de dag gis kyang dus chen po nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: In this context, by these topics, the greatness of the time is also taught.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: de ltar thabs la mkhas pa la sogs pas spyod pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba ni 'khor ba yang mi spong /
analyzed: de ltar thabs la mkhas pa la sogs pas spyod pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba ni 'khor ba yang mi spong /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has completed the four practices by means of skill in means and so forth, free from all conceptualization, discrimination, and imagination, does not abandon saṃsāra,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi len par phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bar du bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par byed pas na des kyang dus chen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi len par phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bar du bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par byed pas na des kyang dus chen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: And since they accomplish the perfect benefit of self and other until the end of time without ever attaining nirvana, they also teach the great time.

original: 'dod pa med pa chen po ni bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad nges par bcom pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'dod pa med pa chen po ni bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad nges par bcom pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: Great non-desire is taught by the line “they definitely defeat all demons and opponents.”

original: 'dod pa med pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin pas de nyid kyis bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad nges par bcom pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa med pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin pas de nyid kyis bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad nges par bcom pa yin te /
translated: Non-desire is the complete abandonment of all grasping, and by that alone they definitely defeat all demons and opponents.

original: ji skad du blo gros rgya mtsho gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad mi 'dod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad nges par bcom pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du blo gros rgya mtsho gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad mi 'dod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad nges par bcom pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As it is said in the Sagaramatiparipriccha-sutra, “When bodhisattvas have no desire for anything at all, at that time they have definitely defeated all demons and opponents.”

original: de ltar yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad spangs te /
translated: Thus, having abandoned all grasping,

original: bdud phyir rgol ba nges par bcom pa nyid 'dod ba med pa yin pas na des ni 'dod pa med pa chen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud phyir rgol ba nges par bcom pa nyid 'dod ba med pa yin pas na des ni 'dod pa med pa chen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since he is not desirous of the destruction of the demons and opponents, he demonstrates great non-desire.

original: yid la byed pa chen po ni /
analyzed: yid la byed pa chen po ni /
translated: Great mental attention is

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa thams cad la sa ring du gyur ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa thams cad la sa ring du gyur ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: taught by the statement, “Far removed from the mental attention of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dang po sems bskyed pa nas theg pa dman pa'i yid la byed ba thag ring du spangs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dang po sems bskyed pa nas theg pa dman pa'i yid la byed ba thag ring du spangs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: From the first production of the thought of enlightenment, the Bodhisattvas are far removed from the mental attention of the Individual Vehicle,

original: 'di @30b ltar theg pa dman pa'i yid la byed pa thag ring du spangs pa nyid theg pa chen po'i bsam pa yid la byed pa yin pas na des ni yid la byed pa chen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di @30b ltar theg pa dman pa'i yid la byed pa thag ring du spangs pa nyid theg pa chen po'i bsam pa yid la byed pa yin pas na des ni yid la byed pa chen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: because the far removal of the mental attention of the Individual Vehicle is the mental attention of the thought of the Great Vehicle. Therefore, it demonstrates great mental attention.

original: rtogs pa chen po ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa chen po ni /
translated: Great realization is

original: chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang / bde ba chen pos bstan pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang / bde ba chen pos bstan pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: taught by the statement, “The great joy and bliss of the taste of Dharma.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Bodhisattvas are taught by the great joy and bliss of the taste of the Mahayana Dharma.

original: de ltar theg pa chen po'i chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa la gnas par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas na des ni rtogs pa chen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar theg pa chen po'i chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa la gnas par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas na des ni rtogs pa chen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since the very teaching by the great joy and bliss of the taste of the Mahayana Dharma is the cause for abiding in the bodhisattva's abode and abiding in the abode of the buddhas, it demonstrates the great realization.

original: yongs su dag pa chen po ni /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa chen po ni /
translated: Great purity

original: 'jigs pa chen po lnga las shin tu 'das pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa chen po lnga las shin tu 'das pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: is taught by the statement, They have completely transcended the five great fears.

original: las rnam pa gsum dang lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pas 'jigs pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa ste /
analyzed: las rnam pa gsum dang lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pas 'jigs pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa ste /
translated: They have completely transcended all fears by means of the three kinds of actions and the purity of superior intention.

original: ngan 'gros 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu tshul khrims 'chal ba la sogs pa'i dri ma yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan 'gros 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu tshul khrims 'chal ba la sogs pa'i dri ma yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are completely pure of the stains of immorality and so on, which are the causes of fear of the miserable realms and so on.

original: 'jigs pa lnga ni 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs pa dang / mi bsngags pas 'jigs pa dang / 'chi bas 'jigs pa dang / ngan 'gros 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha bas 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa lnga ni 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs pa dang / mi bsngags pas 'jigs pa dang / 'chi bas 'jigs pa dang / ngan 'gros 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha bas 'jigs pa ste /
translated: The five fears are fear of not gaining a livelihood, fear of disrepute, fear of death, fear of miserable states of existence, and fear of being timid in the midst of the assembly.

original: de dag ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa thob nas med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa thob nas med par 'gyur ro //
translated: These are eliminated upon attaining the stage of pure universal responsibility.

original: de ltar 'jigs pa lnga las shin tu 'das pa ni las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa yin pas na des ni yongs su dag pa chen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'jigs pa lnga las shin tu 'das pa ni las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa yin pas na des ni yongs su dag pa chen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the great purity is taught by the total purification of the three actions and the total purification of universal responsibility, since he has passed completely beyond the five fears.

original: rtogs pa chen po ni /🔽phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: rtogs pa chen po ni / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: Great realization is taught by🔽the statement, “he has attained the stage of the single path.”

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du lung bstan pa'i sa thob pas bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du lung bstan pa'i sa thob pas bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The single path is to be supplied, since he has attained the stage of the prediction of omniscience.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun po dag la ni mngon par 'du byed pas 'jug pa'i phyir bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun po dag la ni mngon par 'du byed pas 'jug pa'i phyir bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: On the seven bodhisattva stages, they do not have the single mode of progress because they proceed by the application of effort.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ni sa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ni sa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The stage of nonregression is the eighth stage.

original: bgrod pa ni lam stes brgyad pa de thob pa de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa thob pa gzhan dag dang bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: bgrod pa ni lam stes brgyad pa de thob pa de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa thob pa gzhan dag dang bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa yin te /
translated: The single mode of progress is the eighth stage. The bodhisattvas who have attained that stage have the single mode of progress with other bodhisattvas who have attained the eighth stage but not with those who have not attained it.

original: sa brgyad bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o zhes bya bar @31a * //
analyzed: sa brgyad bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o zhes bya bar @31a * //
translated: Those who have the single mode of progress on the eighth stage are called those who have the single mode of progress on the eight stages.

original: sbyar ro // de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob cing de thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag dang bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa nyid mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa yin pas na /
analyzed: sbyar ro // de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob cing de thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag dang bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa nyid mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa yin pas na /
translated: Thus, having attained the stage of nonregression and having the single mode of progress with other bodhisattvas who have attained that stage, they attain the acquiescence in the nonarising of things.

original: des ni rtogs pa chen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni rtogs pa chen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the great realization.

original: de la las chen po ni /
analyzed: de la las chen po ni /
translated: The great action is

original: sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sa mngon du gyur pa sha stag ces gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sa mngon du gyur pa sha stag ces gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: They are the stages that actually manifest as the pacification of all the harm of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nang gi mtshan ma la sogs pa'i gnod pa gang dag yin pa de dag sa gang gis rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sa de mngon du gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag la 'di skad ces bya ste ;
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nang gi mtshan ma la sogs pa'i gnod pa gang dag yin pa de dag sa gang gis rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sa de mngon du gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag la 'di skad ces bya ste ;
translated: The harm of all sentient beings is internal signs and so on. The stages that actually manifest as the pacification of those are called

original: sa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those stages?

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po ste /
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po ste /
translated: They are great love and great compassion.

original: de gnyis kyis blo myur du byung ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis blo myur du byung ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two completely pacify all the harm of quick arising thoughts and so on and completely pacify all the suffering of poverty and so on.

original: de ltar byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po de gnyis kyis sems can bde ba la bkod pa dang / sdug bsngal las bskyab pa la sogs pa'i don bya ba phal cher byed la de'i sa mngon du gyur pas na des ni las chen po bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po de gnyis kyis sems can bde ba la bkod pa dang / sdug bsngal las bskyab pa la sogs pa'i don bya ba phal cher byed la de'i sa mngon du gyur pas na des ni las chen po bstan pa yin te /
translated: Since they manifest on this level, they are taught to be great actions.

original: de ni re zhig rnam grangs gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig rnam grangs gzhan yin no //
translated: This is another enumeration.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni mdo las /
translated: Again, in another enumeration, the perfection of the bodhisattva's retinue is taught in the sūtras:

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa thams cad kyang gnas chen po la yang dag par bzhugs pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa thams cad kyang gnas chen po la yang dag par bzhugs pa zhes bstan to //
translated: The bodhisattvas who gather from different buddha realms are immeasurable and all of them abide in the great stages.

original: gnas chen po la yang dag par bzhugs pa zhes bya ba 'di skabs 'dir ni gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes mi bya'i /
analyzed: gnas chen po la yang dag par bzhugs pa zhes bya ba 'di skabs 'dir ni gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes mi bya'i /
translated: In this context, abiding in the great stages does not mean abiding in the great stages.

original: 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya bar bshad de /
analyzed: 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya bar bshad de /
translated: He is called “one who has entered the great vehicle” because he has entered the great vehicle.

original: 'jug pa chen po zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i lam gyi rang bzhin la bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa chen po zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i lam gyi rang bzhin la bya'o //
translated: The great vehicle is the nature of the path of the Great Vehicle.

original: de la 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa de ni lam gyi skyon rnam pa dgu yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa de ni lam gyi skyon rnam pa dgu yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called “one who has entered the great vehicle” because he has entered the great vehicle and has abandoned the nine faults of the path.

original: de nyid de'i phun sum tshogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de'i phun sum tshogs pa yang yin no //
translated: This is his perfection.

original: de la lam gyi skyon rnam pa dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lam gyi skyon rnam pa dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine faults of the path?

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: They are explained in the following verse:

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub mi mthun lam //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub mi mthun lam //
translated: The path is incompatible with complete enlightenment,

original: rdul bcas pa dang tsher mar bcas //
analyzed: rdul bcas pa dang tsher mar bcas //
translated: is dusty, thorny,🔽subject to loss, fearful, not peaceful,

original: chud za 'jigs dang bde med dang // 'jigs bcas ris @31b min phyogs min 'gro / zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: chud za 'jigs dang bde med dang // 'jigs bcas ris @31b min phyogs min 'gro / zhes gsungs te /
translated: not a vehicle, and not a direction.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon rnam pa dgu ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang mi mthun pa'i lam dang / rdul dang bcas pa'i lam dang / tsher ma dang bcas pa'i lam dang / chud za ba'i lam dang / 'jigs pa'i lam dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon rnam pa dgu ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang mi mthun pa'i lam dang / rdul dang bcas pa'i lam dang / tsher ma dang bcas pa'i lam dang / chud za ba'i lam dang / 'jigs pa'i lam dang /
translated: The nine faults of the path of bodhisattvas are: the path that is not conducive to perfect enlightenment, the path that is dusty, the path that has thorns, the path that is wasted, the path that is fearful,

original: bde ba med pa'i lam dang / 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i lam dang / ris ma yin pa'i lam dang / phyogs ma yin pa'i lam du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba med pa'i lam dang / 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i lam dang / ris ma yin pa'i lam dang / phyogs ma yin pa'i lam du 'gro ba'o //
translated: the path that is not blissful, the path that is dangerous, the path that is not of the same kind, and the path that is not of the same direction.

original: las kyi skyon rnam pa dgu po de dag yongs su spang bar yang dag par zhugs pas ni mdo las /
analyzed: las kyi skyon rnam pa dgu po de dag yongs su spang bar yang dag par zhugs pas ni mdo las /
translated: One who is correctly engaged in abandoning those nine faults of action is said in the sutra to be:

original: theg pa chen po'i chos kyi nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba nas sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sa mngon du gyur pa sha stag ces gsungs pa'i bar gyi tshig dgu dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos kyi nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba nas sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sa mngon du gyur pa sha stag ces gsungs pa'i bar gyi tshig dgu dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: one who has the definite emergence of the Mahayana Dharma, up to one who actualizes the stage that completely pacifies all the harm of all sentient beings.

original: de la rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang mi mthun pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyi nges par 'byung ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de la rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang mi mthun pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyi nges par 'byung ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The correct practice of avoiding the path that is incompatible with perfect enlightenment is taught by the statement: the renunciation of the Mahayana teachings.

original: de la rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang mi mthun pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs ba'i byang chub ces bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: de la rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang mi mthun pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs ba'i byang chub ces bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: The path that is incompatible with perfect enlightenment and so on refers to perfect enlightenment, which is unexcelled perfect enlightenment.🔽The path that is incompatible with that is the individual nature of the phenomena that are the path subsumed by the levels and perfections of the Mahayana.

original: de dang mi mthun ba'i lam ni theg pa chen po sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa lam gyi rang bzhin gyi chos rnams kyi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang dag yin pa de sa dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so so'i skye bo nyid ces🔽bya ba nas /
analyzed: de dang mi mthun ba'i lam ni theg pa chen po sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa lam gyi rang bzhin gyi chos rnams kyi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang dag yin pa de sa dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so so'i skye bo nyid ces🔽bya ba nas /
translated: The phenomena that are compatible with that are the phenomena that are the antidotes to the individual nature of the first level.

original: sa bcu pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos la dbang ma thob pa zhes bya ba'i bar dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna zhes bya ba nas ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs shes bya mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos la dbang ma thob pa zhes bya ba'i bar dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna zhes bya ba nas ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs shes bya mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi chos rnams so //
translated: The factors that are incompatible with the path of the bodhisattva are the ten factors that range from the lack of faith in the Dharma up to the lack of attainment of mastery over the Dharma, as well as the factors that range from stinginess, which is incompatible with the perfection of generosity, up to the lack of knowledge of the knowable, which is incompatible with the perfection of knowledge.

original: lam der 'gro ba la mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos de dag la spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: lam der 'gro ba la mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos de dag la spyod pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas engage in those factors that are incompatible with the path.

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang mi mthun pa'i lam du 'gro ba yin pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon yin no //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang mi mthun pa'i lam du 'gro ba yin pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon yin no //
translated: Since they are traveling on a path that is incompatible with complete enlightenment, they have not set out on the Great Vehicle. Therefore, these factors are faults on the path of the bodhisattvas.

original: de yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni theg pa chen po sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa lam gyi rang bzhin gyi chos kyi nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni theg pa chen po sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa lam gyi rang bzhin gyi chos kyi nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas who have set out to abandon these factors have the Dharma that is the nature of the path that is included within the levels and perfections of the Great Vehicle as their means of deliverance.

original: de'i phyir 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs @32a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs @32a * //
translated: Therefore, one who has entered the great vehicle is a bodhisattva.🔽

original: pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the bodhisattva is one who has set out on the great path.

original: rdul dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: rdul dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattva is one who has set out to abandon going on a path that is dusty.

original: sems can thams cad la sems pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: This is indicated by the words “he is impartial toward all beings.”

original: de la rdul dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rdul dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, “going on a path that is dusty” means

original: rdul dang bcas pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i sems te /
analyzed: rdul dang bcas pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i sems te /
translated: that the path is dusty with the defilements.

original: zhe sdang dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / 'dod pa dang / the tshom dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / 'dod pa dang / the tshom dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a mind that is accompanied by hatred, violence, displeasure, desire, doubt, and signs.

original: lam der 'gro ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rdul dang bcas pa'i sems de dag la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: lam der 'gro ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rdul dang bcas pa'i sems de dag la 'jug pa ste /

analyzed: de yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni sems can thams cad las 'byung bar 'os pa'i khams drug po gnod sems las 'byin pa byams pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba las 'byin pa snying rje dang / mi dga' ba las 'byin pa dga' ba dang / 'dod pa las 'byin pa btang snyoms dang / the tshom las 'byin pa nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang dag par 'joms pa dang / mtshan ma las 'byin pa mtshan ma med pa dag gis sems mnyam par sbyor ba ste /
translated: He is engaged in the mental application that is in keeping with the Dharma in order to abandon the six constituent elements that are to be abandoned in relation to all sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He is engaged in the mental application that is in keeping

original: tsher ma dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: tsher ma dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattvas are fully engaged in avoiding the path with thorns.

original: bskal pa dang bskal pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa thams cad bral ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: bskal pa dang bskal pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa thams cad bral ba zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: They are free from all thoughts of eons and non-eons.

original: de la tsher ma dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la tsher ma dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The path with thorns is explained in the following.

original: tsher ma dang bcas pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems te /
analyzed: tsher ma dang bcas pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems te /
translated: The path with thorns is the conceptual mind.

original: bskal pa dang bskal ba ma yin par yongs su rtog pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu yongs su rtog pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa dang bskal ba ma yin par yongs su rtog pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu yongs su rtog pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the mind that thinks in terms of eons and non-eons, in terms of entities and attributes.

original: lam der 'gro ba ni rtog pa'i tsher ma dang bcas pa'i sems de dag la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: lam der 'gro ba ni rtog pa'i tsher ma dang bcas pa'i sems de dag la gnas pa ste /
translated: Those who go on that path are those who abide in those conceptual minds with their thorns of concepts.

original: de ni rtog pa'i tsher ma dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba yin pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon yin no //
analyzed: de ni rtog pa'i tsher ma dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba yin pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon yin no //
translated: Since they are on the path with its thorns of concepts, they are not fully engaged in the great vehicle, and so it is a fault on the bodhisattvas’ path.

original: de yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni bskal pa dang @32b bskal pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa dang / ngo bo nyid bye brag tu yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral bas bdud kyi tsher ma dkrugs pa ste /
analyzed: de yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni bskal pa dang @32b bskal pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa dang / ngo bo nyid bye brag tu yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral bas bdud kyi tsher ma dkrugs pa ste /
translated: He is engaged in abandoning that, because he is free from all discriminations of eons and non-eons and of intrinsic reality and particularity.

original: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is also engaged in the great entrance.

original: chud za ba'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: chud za ba'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
translated: He is engaged in abandoning the path of loss.

original: bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad nges par bcom pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad nges par bcom pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: This is indicated by the statement, “he has definitely conquered all the māras and adversaries.”

original: de la chud mi za ba'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la chud mi za ba'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the phrase “he is engaged in the path of no loss,”

original: chud za ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i sems te /
analyzed: chud za ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i sems te /
translated: the path of loss is the mind of complete degeneration.

original: lus kyi yo byad dang yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po la sogs pa dag la yongs su 'dzin pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi yo byad dang yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po la sogs pa dag la yongs su 'dzin pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the mind of grasping to the things that are the requisites and possessions of the body.

original: lam der 'gro ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i chud za ba dang bcas pa'i sems de dag dang ma bral ba de ni rab tu nyams par chud za ba'i lam du 'gro ba yin pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: lam der 'gro ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i chud za ba dang bcas pa'i sems de dag dang ma bral ba de ni rab tu nyams par chud za ba'i lam du 'gro ba yin pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir
translated: To go on that path is to go on a path of complete loss through not being free from those thoughts that are associated with the loss of complete acceptance.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a fault of the bodhisattvas' path because it is not to correctly enter the great entrance.

original: de yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: de yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
translated: Correctly entering the abandonment of that

original: yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad spangs pas bdud phyir rgol ba la nges par bcom pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad spangs pas bdud phyir rgol ba la nges par bcom pa ste /
translated: is to have completely abandoned all complete acceptance, to have definitely defeated the māras and opponents.

original: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also to correctly enter the great entrance.🔽Correctly entering the abandonment of going on a path of fear

original: 'jigs pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa thams cad las ring du gyur pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa thams cad las ring du gyur pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: is taught by the statement, “It is to have gone far beyond all the attentions of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.”

original: de la 'jigs pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la 'jigs pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po bsam ba ma thob par yongs su nyams pa'i sems te /
analyzed: de la 'jigs pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la 'jigs pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po bsam ba ma thob par yongs su nyams pa'i sems te /
translated: The path of fear is the thought of falling away from the Great Vehicle,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: and the thought of the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: lam der 'gro ba ni dang po nyid nas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs gnas shing de dag gi theg par sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: lam der 'gro ba ni dang po nyid nas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs gnas shing de dag gi theg par sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: Those who go on that path are those who from the very beginning are of the disciples’ or hermit buddhas’ lineage, and who have generated the thought of their respective vehicles.

original: de ni theg pa dman pa'i yid la byed pas 'jigs pa'i lam du 'gro ba yin pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon yin no //
analyzed: de ni theg pa dman pa'i yid la byed pas 'jigs pa'i lam du 'gro ba yin pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon yin no //
translated: Since they go on the path of fear with the attention of the Lesser Vehicle, they have not set out on the Great Vehicle, and so it is a fault on the path of the bodhisattvas.

original: de yongs su spong bar yang dag par yongs su zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: de yongs su spong bar yang dag par yongs su zhugs pa ni /
translated: They set out on the path of avoiding that.

original: dang po nyid nas bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rigs dang / sems bskyed pa dang mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs @33a * //
analyzed: dang po nyid nas bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rigs dang / sems bskyed pa dang mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs @33a * //
translated: From the very beginning, they have the potential for unsurpassed enlightenment,

original: rgyas kyi yid la byed pa thams cad las ring du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rgyas kyi yid la byed pa thams cad las ring du gyur pa ste /
translated: they have the attitude of bodhichitta, and they have the realization of the bodhichitta. They are therefore far removed from the attitude of the Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: And for this reason, they are also engaged in the great entry.

original: bde ba med pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba med pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
translated: They are engaged in the avoidance of the path that is devoid of happiness.

original: chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: This is indicated by the words “the teaching that is the great joy and bliss of the taste of the Dharma.”

original: de la bde ba med pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la bde ba med pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the phrase “the path that is devoid of happiness,”

original: bde ba med pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba nyams su ma myong ba'i sems te /
analyzed: bde ba med pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba nyams su ma myong ba'i sems te /
translated: the path that is devoid of happiness is the mind that has not experienced the joy and bliss of the taste of the Dharma of the Great Vehicle.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i lam ma thob pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i lam ma thob pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the mind that has not attained the path of realization.

original: lam der 'gro ba ni mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag las gzhan pa 'jig rten pa'i lam la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: lam der 'gro ba ni mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag las gzhan pa 'jig rten pa'i lam la spyod pa ste /
translated: Proceeding on that path is engaging in the mundane path that is other than the factors conducive to penetrative insight that obtain the path of realization.

original: de ni mngon par rtogs par bde ba med pa'i lam du 'gro ba yin pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon yin no //
analyzed: de ni mngon par rtogs par bde ba med pa'i lam du 'gro ba yin pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon yin no //
translated: Since that is a path that does not lead to the bliss of realization, it is a fault of the bodhisattva path because it does not correctly engage the great entrance.

original: de yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i lam la mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa drug po bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / dad pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: de yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i lam la mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa drug po bsam pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / dad pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / tshul khrims mngon par rtogs pa dang /
translated: Correct engagement in abandoning that is the path of realization, which has six aspects of realization: realization of intention, realization of faith, realization of ethics, realization of generosity, realization of wisdom and realization of patience.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden par rtogs pa dang / mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / bdag mngon par rtogs pa yan chad theg pa chen po'i chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba'i shes pa bden par rtogs pa dang / mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / bdag mngon par rtogs pa yan chad theg pa chen po'i chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos bstan pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of realization is the realization of the truth. The knowledge that arises from the end of realization is the realization of the truth. The ultimate realization is the realization of the self. The teaching with the great joy and bliss of the taste of the Mahayana Dharma from the realization of the self onward.

original: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is also one who has perfectly entered the great vehicle.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong ba yang dag par zhugs pa ni 'jigs pa lnga las shin tu 'das pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong ba yang dag par zhugs pa ni 'jigs pa lnga las shin tu 'das pa zhes gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The one who has perfectly entered the abandonment of going on a path with fear is taught by the statement “he has completely transcended the five fears.”

original: de la 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /🔽'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la / 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni /

original: 'jigs pa lnga las ma 'das pa'i sems te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa lnga las ma 'das pa'i sems te /
translated: The path with fear is the mind that has not transcended the five fears.

original: so so'i skye bo'i 'jig rten pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i 'jig rten pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the mundane mind of an ordinary being.

analyzed: lam der 'gro ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas 'jug pa'i lam la spyod pa ste /
translated: Going on that path means engaging in the path of conscious effort.

original: de ni mtshan ma med ba lhun gyis grub pa'i rigs ma yin ba'i lam du 'gro ba yin bas snang ba med pa'i sa lhun gyis grub ba nyid la ltos na 'jigs pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /

translated: Since it is a path that is not the natural outcome of the signless, it is not a perfect engagement in the great fear.
