analyzed: de yangs gong ma la ltos nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon yin no //
translated: Compared to the natural outcome of the level of nonappearance, it is a fault on the bodhisattva path.

original: de yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni phyir mi ldog ba'i sa thob cing bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni phyir mi ldog ba'i sa thob cing bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas who are perfectly engaged in eliminating that are those who have attained the level of nonregression and have become those who have one thing left to do.

original: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore they are also perfectly engaged in the great engagement.

original: phyogs ma yin pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs ma yin pa'i lam du 'gro ba yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattvas who are perfectly engaged in eliminating the path that is not the right direction

original: sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sa mngon du gyur pa sha stag ces gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sa mngon du gyur pa sha stag ces gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: are those who have attained the level of the pacification of all harm to all sentient beings.

original: de la phyogs ma yin pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la phyogs ma yin pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i lam gyi phyogs ma yin pa'i sems te /
analyzed: de la phyogs ma yin pa'i lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la phyogs ma yin pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i lam gyi phyogs ma yin pa'i sems te /
translated: “Going on a path that is not the right direction” means that the mind does not go on the path that does not abide in samsara or nirvana.

original: sems can gyi don yal bar 'dor zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don yal bar 'dor zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the mind that abandons the welfare of sentient beings and is directed toward nirvana.

original: lam du 'gro ba ni @34a * //
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba ni @34a * //
translated: “Going on a path”

original: zhi bar bgrod pa gcig pa nyid la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: zhi bar bgrod pa gcig pa nyid la zhugs pa ste /
translated: means engaging in the single progress to peace.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid dang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyogs ma yin pa'i lam du 'gro ba yin pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon yin
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid dang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyogs ma yin pa'i lam du 'gro ba yin pas 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi skyon yin
translated: That is a fault on the bodhisattva path because it is not the right direction for the reality of the bodhisattva and for nonabiding nirvana.

original: no // de yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad kyi phyi nang gi gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sa mngon du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: no // de yongs su spong bar yang dag par zhugs pa ni byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad kyi phyi nang gi gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sa mngon du gyur pa ste /
translated: He is engaged in the great process of entering, because he is engaged in the great process of abandoning, by means of great love and great compassion, all the internal and external harm of all sentient beings, through the realization of the stage of the pacification of all harm.

original: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'jug pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, he is engaged in the great process of entering.

original: thabs cig go zhes bya ba ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa de na yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: thabs cig go zhes bya ba ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa de na yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: Together with them means that, in that place of excellence, there is the excellence of qualities.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa de dag dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa de dag dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: Together with those excellences of retinue, he resides. This is the meaning of the phrase.🔽The meaning of the words of the excellence of the retinue of bodhisattvas has been explained.

original: // / thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin te /
analyzed: // / thun mong ma yin pa'i gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin te /
translated: The meaning of the words of the special introduction that is not shared has been explained.

original: gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pas bsdus pa'i don bstan pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pas bsdus pa'i don bstan pa bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the introduction has been completed.

original: // / de ltar gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pas bsdus pa'i don bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar gleng gzhi'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pas bsdus pa'i don bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the meaning of the introduction,

original: da ni mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pas bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pas bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the meaning of the words of the explanation of the meaning of the body of the sūtra will be explained.

original: de la mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa ni 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo 'di'i mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa mtha' dag gis bden pa gnyis bo don dam pa'i bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa ni 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo 'di'i mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa mtha' dag gis bden pa gnyis bo don dam pa'i bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The body of the sūtra is the complete body of the noble Sūtra Unraveling the Intention. It teaches the complete understanding of the characteristics of the two truths, ultimate truth and conventional truth.

original: de la don dam pa'i bden pa ni mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i bden pa ni mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
translated: Ultimate truth should be understood to have five characteristics.

original: brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang / tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang / tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The characteristic of the ultimate is inexpressibility, non-duality, transcendence of the domain of sophistry, transcendence of difference and non-difference,

original: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: and being of one taste in all things.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid drug dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid drug dang ldan par shes par bya ste /
translated: The characteristic of the conventional should be understood as being endowed with six aspects:

original: sems kyi mtshan nyid dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chos gdags pa @34b rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: sems kyi mtshan nyid dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chos gdags pa @34b rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas /
translated: the characteristic of mind, the characteristic of phenomena, the characteristic of the unreality of phenomena, the characteristic of the designation of phenomena,

original: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rab tu dbye ba dang / theg pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dbye ba bstan pa dang / theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa kho na las brtsams nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba sgrub pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rab tu dbye ba dang / theg pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dbye ba bstan pa dang / theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa kho na las brtsams nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba sgrub pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa ste /
translated: the teaching of the classification of the Tathagata's deeds in terms of the presentation of the designation of the vehicles.

original: mtshan nyid bcu gcig po de dag ni mdo las /
analyzed: mtshan nyid bcu gcig po de dag ni mdo las /
translated: These eleven characteristics are mentioned in the sutra:

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin kun 'dris kyis brjod du med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin kun 'dris kyis brjod du med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa las brtsams te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva ProperPractice asked the bodhisattva DefinitiveExplanationOfTheProfoundMeaning about the ultimate, which is inexpressible and nondual.

original: byang chub sems dpa' don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la dri ba dris pa zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa la sogs pa'i le'u bcu 'byung ba las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la dri ba dris pa zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pa la sogs pa'i le'u bcu 'byung ba las /
translated: The bodhisattva DefinitiveExplanationOfTheProfoundMeaning then asked the bodhisattva ProperPractice about the body of the sutra, which has ten chapters, such as the chapter on the presentation of the body of the sutra and so on.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid dang po gnyis ni le'u dang po dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid dang po gnyis ni le'u dang po dang sbyar ro //
translated: The first two characteristics of the ultimate are to be connected with the first chapter.

original: mtshan nyid lhag ma dgu ni le'u lhag ma dgu dang go rims bzhin du 'og nas rgya cher ston te ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid lhag ma dgu ni le'u lhag ma dgu dang go rims bzhin du 'og nas rgya cher ston te ;
translated: The remaining nine characteristics are taught extensively below in the remaining nine chapters, in order.

original: de ni mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pas bsdus pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mdo sde'i lus rnam par gzhag pas bsdus pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the summarized meaning by way of the arrangement of the body of the sūtras.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga bstan pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u las bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i don rnam pa lnga gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga bstan pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u las bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i don rnam pa lnga gsungs pa dang /
translated: The teaching of the five aspects of the characteristic of the ultimate is to be connected with the five meanings of the inconceivable, the incomparable, the immeasurable, the innumerable, and the equal to the unequaled, which are taught in the Perfection of Wisdom chapter.

original: go rims bzhin du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they are to be connected in order.

original: de la dang bor brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tshig gi don la sogs pa je bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang bor brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tshig gi don la sogs pa je bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, first, the meaning of the words and so on will be explained by way of the characteristic of the inexpressible and the characteristic of nonduality.

original: de yang lung rtog pa sgro btags pa med pa dang / skur pa med pa la rmongs pa'i gnyen por bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang lung rtog pa sgro btags pa med pa dang / skur pa med pa la rmongs pa'i gnyen por bstan pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, this is taught as the antidote to the confusion of superimposition and denial regarding scripture and reasoning.

original: de'i phyir de rmongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rmongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, with regard to that confusion,

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin kun 'dris brjod du med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin kun 'dris brjod du med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa las brtsams te /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba dri ba dris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel gyi le'u dang po 'di gsungs so //
translated: taught this first chapter of the noble Unraveling the Intent, which is called “The Questions of the Bodhisattva Gambhīrārthasamdhinirmocana,” and so on, in order to unravel the profound meaning of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: de la le'u dang po 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: the teaching of the inexpressible characteristic and the teaching of the nondual characteristic.

original: de yang rnam par dbye na rnam pa bzhi @35a * //
analyzed: de yang rnam par dbye na rnam pa bzhi @35a * //
translated: If that is analyzed, there are four topics:

analyzed: ste ; mtshan nyid gnyis kyis lus rnam par gzhag pa dang / de gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad nas ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa dang / de rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dag gi dngos po bsdu na rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The body of the two realities is shown🔽by the statement, “The bodhisattva, the great being, who is skilled in the two realities, quickly and completely fulfills all the transcendences and quickly and completely awakens to highest genuine full Awakening.”

analyzed: de la mtshan nyid gnyis kyis lus rnam par gzhag pa ni / rgyal ba'i sras chos thams cad gnyis su med pa /

analyzed: chos thams cad gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba nas / 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin /

analyzed: 'dus byas kyang ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: The body of their inclusion is shown🔽by the statement, “The bodhisattva, the great being, who is skilled in the three natures, quickly and completely fulfills all the transcendences and quickly and completely awakens to highest genuine full Awakening.”🔽The body of the two realities is shown🔽by the statement, “The bodhisattva, the great being, who is skilled in the two realities, quickly and completely fulfills all the transcendences and quickly and completely awakens to highest genuine full Awakening.”

original: de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa ni /🔽kye rgyal ba'i sras ji ltar na 'dus byas ni /🔽'dus byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa ni / kye rgyal ba'i sras ji ltar na 'dus byas ni / 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
translated: The body of the three natures in terms of those two is shown

analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: by the statement, “The bodhisattva, the great being, who is skilled in the three natures, quickly and completely fulfills all the transcendences and quickly and completely awakens to highest genuine full Awakening.”

original: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas zhes ming du btags so zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas zhes ming du btags so zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //

analyzed: de rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The presentation of the categories of those is taught from

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras ji ltar na 'phags pa rnams kyi dngos po de zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes ming du btags pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i par gyis bstan to //

original: de dag gi dngos po bsdu na rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po bsdu na rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The summary of those things is presented in

analyzed: de la dang por mtshan nyid gnyis kyis lus rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Therein, first, the meaning of the words of the body established by the two characteristics should be explained.

analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pas brjod pa la mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in the context of teaching that,

original: 'dir 'phags pa tshul bzhin yid la kun 'dris kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa tshul bzhin yid la kun 'dris kyis /
translated: here the noble one, having thoroughly familiarized the mind with reality,

original: 'phags pa don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel la /
analyzed: 'phags pa don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel la /
translated: asks the noble one, the one who elucidates the profound meaning,

original: rgyal ba'i sras chos thams cad gnyis su med pa chos thams cad gnyis su med pa zhes bya na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dris te /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras chos thams cad gnyis su med pa chos thams cad gnyis su med pa zhes bya na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dris te /
translated: the Victor's son, When all phenomena are non-dual, all phenomena are non-dual, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mdo sde de dang de dag tu chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i grub pa bstan pa de 'dir 'phags pa tshul bzhin kun 'dris rang gi blo la gzhag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mdo sde de dang de dag tu chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i grub pa bstan pa de 'dir 'phags pa tshul bzhin kun 'dris rang gi blo la gzhag ste /
translated: The Tathagata has taught in this and that sutra the non-duality of all phenomena. Here, the noble one, having placed his mind in proper familiarity with that,

original: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dri pa'i gleng ba slang ba'i phyir chos thams cad gnyis su med pa chos thams cad gnyis su med pa zhes bya na zhes lan gnyis su bzlas te dris so //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dri pa'i gleng ba slang ba'i phyir chos thams cad gnyis su med pa chos thams cad gnyis su med pa zhes bya na zhes lan gnyis su bzlas te dris so //
translated: in order to raise the topic of the question on the characteristic of non-duality, asks twice, If all phenomena are non-dual, if all phenomena are non-dual, what is this called 'non-duality'?🔽If so, by what reasoning is the non-duality of all phenomena established, which the Tathagata has taught in this and that sutra?

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pas mdo sde de dang de dag tu chos thams cad gnyis su med par grub pa bstan pa de yang rigs pa gang gis grub ce na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pas mdo sde de dang de dag tu chos thams cad gnyis su med par grub pa bstan pa de yang rigs pa gang gis grub ce na /
translated: Therefore, it is taught:

original: de'i phyir / ming gi snga rol blo med phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ming gi snga rol blo med phyir //
translated: Because there is no cognition prior to the name,

original: mang ba'i phyir dang ma nges phyir //
analyzed: mang ba'i phyir dang ma nges phyir //
translated: Because of multiplicity and uncertainty,

original: chos rnams dngos po gang brjod pa //
analyzed: chos rnams dngos po gang brjod pa //
translated: Whatever entity of phenomena is expressed,

original: de ni gnyis su med par grub //🔽ces bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: de ni gnyis su med par grub //🔽ces bya ba bstan te /
translated: That is established as non-dual.

original: byis pa'i blo can dag gis chos rnams kyi dngos po gang dag brjod pa de dag ni ming gi snga rol blo med pa'i phyir dang / ming mang ba'i phyir dang / ming ma nges pa'i phyir ming gis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi thog tu mi phebs pas na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur gnyis su med par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: byis pa'i blo can dag gis chos rnams kyi dngos po gang dag brjod pa de dag ni ming gi snga rol blo med pa'i phyir dang / ming mang ba'i phyir dang / ming ma nges pa'i phyir ming gis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi thog tu mi phebs pas na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur gnyis su med par grub pa yin te /
translated: The entities of phenomena that are expressed by childish beings are not established as dual, because prior to the name there is no cognition, because there are many names, and because the name is not fixed.

original: de ltar gnyis su med par grub pa'i phyir brjod du med pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis su med par grub pa'i phyir brjod du med pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, they are inexpressible because they are established as nondual.

original: de la ji ltar na ming gi snga rol na blo med pa'i phyir gnyis su med par grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na ming gi snga rol na blo med pa'i phyir gnyis su med par grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: In that regard, how are they established as nondual because prior to the name there is no cognition?

original: chos rnams la 'du byas she'am /🔽'dus ma byas zhes ming du btags pa'i snga rol te /
analyzed: chos rnams la 'du byas she'am / 'dus ma byas zhes ming du btags pa'i snga rol te /
translated: Phenomena are designated by the name “conditioned” or “unconditioned.”🔽Prior to the designation of the name,

original: ming du btags pa'i tshe na 'di ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: ming du btags pa'i tshe na 'di ni 'dus byas so //
translated: at the time of the designation of the name, this is conditioned.

original: 'di ni 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'i blo mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'i blo mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the mind does not arise thinking, “This is unconditioned.”

original: de'i gnas skabs na chos rnams kyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni 'dus byas she'am /🔽'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs ba lta bu gang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin pas na gnyis su med pa grub pa yin @36a * //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs na chos rnams kyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni 'dus byas she'am / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs ba lta bu gang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin pas na gnyis su med pa grub pa yin @36a * //
translated: At that time, the reality of phenomena is not anything at all, such as conditioned or🔽unconditioned.🔽Therefore, nonduality is established. Because of nonduality in that way, it is

original: te ; de ltar gnyis su med pa'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur brjod du med pa yin no //
analyzed: te ; de ltar gnyis su med pa'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur brjod du med pa yin no //
translated: inexpressible, like “conditioned” and “unconditioned.”

original: ji ltar na ming mang ba'i phyir gnyis su med par 'grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ming mang ba'i phyir gnyis su med par 'grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is nonduality established because of many names?

original: chos rnams kyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gcig la yang tha snyad kyis ming mang po du mar btags pa yod de /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gcig la yang tha snyad kyis ming mang po du mar btags pa yod de /
translated: Many names are imputed conventionally to the one reality of phenomena.

original: dper na rgyal po'i dngos po gcig la yang rgyal po dang / sa bdag dang / mi'i bdag po dang / sa skyong dang / dbang phyug dam pa'i mnga' bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ming mang por brjod pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i dngos po gcig la yang rgyal po dang / sa bdag dang / mi'i bdag po dang / sa skyong dang / dbang phyug dam pa'i mnga' bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ming mang por brjod pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, a single thing of a king is expressed by many names, such as king, lord of the land, lord of men, protector of the land, and supreme lord.

original: de la gal te rgyal po de'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ming gi ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: de la gal te rgyal po de'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ming gi ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: If the essence of the entity of that king were the essence of the name,

original: ming la rnam pa mang po tha dad pa du ma yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ming la rnam pa mang po tha dad pa du ma yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: then just as the name has many different aspects,

original: rgyal po de'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyang du mar gyur pa'i rigs na de lta ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyal po de'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyang du mar gyur pa'i rigs na de lta ma yin la /
translated: the essence of the entity of that king would also be multiple, but that is not the case.

original: chos thams cad kyang de dang 'dra bas de'i phyir ming ni mang la dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni gcig tu zad pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang de dang 'dra bas de'i phyir ming ni mang la dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni gcig tu zad pas /
translated: Since all phenomena are similar to that, therefore names are many, but the essence of entities is exhausted in being one.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni ming gis ji skad brjod pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas na gnyis su med par 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni ming gis ji skad brjod pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas na gnyis su med par 'grub pa yin te /
translated: Since the essence of an entity is not the essence of what is expressed by a name, it is established as nondual.

original: de ltar gnyis su med pa'i phyir brjod du med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis su med pa'i phyir brjod du med pa yin no //
translated: Because of being nondual in that way, it is inexpressible.

original: ji ltar na ming ma nges pa'i phyir gnyis su med par 'grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ming ma nges pa'i phyir gnyis su med par 'grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is nonduality established because of the name being indefinite?

original: dngos po rnams kyi ming ni ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ming ni ma nges pa yin te /
translated: The name of things is indefinite.

original: dper na gang zag gcig la yang sngar lha sbyin zhes bya bar ming btags pa las bar du mes byin zhes bya bar ming spos pa dang / de nyid dus gzhan na sangs rgyas byin zhes bya bar ming spos nas /
analyzed: dper na gang zag gcig la yang sngar lha sbyin zhes bya bar ming btags pa las bar du mes byin zhes bya bar ming spos pa dang / de nyid dus gzhan na sangs rgyas byin zhes bya bar ming spos nas /
translated: For example, in the case of a single person, the name is first given as Devadatta, then the name is changed to Agnidatta, and at another time, the name is changed to Buddhadatta.

original: yang dus gzhan na yon tan bshes gnyen zhes bya bar ming spos pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: yang dus gzhan na yon tan bshes gnyen zhes bya bar ming spos pa lta bu ste /
translated: Then at another time, the name is changed to Kalyāṇamitra.

original: de la gal te gang zag de'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ming gi ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na ming ma nges te /
analyzed: de la gal te gang zag de'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ming gi ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na ming ma nges te /
translated: If the nature of the entity of that person were the nature of the name, the name would be indefinite.

original: gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it changes from one to another,

original: gang zag de'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: gang zag de'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: it would be reasonable that the nature of the entity of that person would change from one to another.

original: de lta ma yin la chos thams cad dang de 'dra bas de'i phyir ming ni ma nges la dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni ming bzhin ma nges pa ma yin pas dngos po'i ngo bo nyid de ni ming gis ji skad brjod pa de lta bu'i ngo bo
analyzed: de lta ma yin la chos thams cad dang de 'dra bas de'i phyir ming ni ma nges la dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni ming bzhin ma nges pa ma yin pas dngos po'i ngo bo nyid de ni ming gis ji skad brjod pa de lta bu'i ngo bo
translated: Since it is not so, since all phenomena are like that, therefore the name is not definite, but the nature of things is not indefinite like the name.

original: nyid ma yin pas na gnyis su med par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: nyid ma yin pas na gnyis su med par grub pa yin te /
translated: Since that nature of things is not the nature of what is expressed by the name, it is established as nondual.

original: de ltar gnyis su med pa'i phyir brjod du med pa yin no zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis su med pa'i phyir brjod du med pa yin no zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Since it is nondual in that way, it is inexpressible.🔽Since all phenomena are nondual, how are they nondual?

original: chos thams cad ni gang ji ltar na gnyis su med pa yin zhes bya bas na ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba @36b bzhin du yod pa nyid kyi dri ba rnam pa gnyis dris pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gang ji ltar na gnyis su med pa yin zhes bya bas na ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba @36b bzhin du yod pa nyid kyi dri ba rnam pa gnyis dris pa yin te /
translated: The two questions are asked: the question of how much there is and the question of how it is.

original: 'og nas lan rnam pa gnyis 'byung bas go rims bzhin du ston to //
analyzed: 'og nas lan rnam pa gnyis 'byung bas go rims bzhin du ston to //
translated: The two answers that occur below are taught in order.

original: rigs kyi bu chos thams cad chos thams cad ces bya ba ni gnyis ji tsam pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos thams cad chos thams cad ces bya ba ni gnyis ji tsam pa ste /
translated: Son of noble family, all phenomena, all phenomena, are as much as duality.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so zhes bya bas ni sngar chos thams cad ni gang zhes dris pa'i lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so zhes bya bas ni sngar chos thams cad ni gang zhes dris pa'i lan btab pa yin no //
translated: The phrase conditioned and unconditioned responds to the question, What are all phenomena?

original: de la gnyis ji tsam pa ste zhes bya bas ni gnyis su thams cad 'dus par ston to //
analyzed: de la gnyis ji tsam pa ste zhes bya bas ni gnyis su thams cad 'dus par ston to //
translated: The phrase all are included in the two indicates that all phenomena are included in the two categories of conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those two?

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The phrase conditioned and unconditioned indicates them.

original: des ni ji snyad yod pa nyid bstan pa yin no //🔽de la 'dus byas ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: des ni ji snyad yod pa nyid bstan pa yin no // de la 'dus byas ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
translated: This indicates that they exist conventionally.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin no //🔽'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin no // 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin /
translated: The phrase conditioned phenomena are neither conditioned nor unconditioned🔽indicates that conditioned phenomena are neither conditioned nor unconditioned.🔽 The phrase unconditioned phenomena are neither unconditioned nor conditioned

original: 'dus byas kyang ma yin zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyang ma yin zhes bya bas ni /
translated: indicates that unconditioned phenomena are neither unconditioned nor conditioned.

original: sngar ji ltar gnyis su med pa yin zhes dris pa'i lan btab pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar ji ltar gnyis su med pa yin zhes dris pa'i lan btab pa yin te /
translated: This responds to the question, How are they nondual?

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin la /
translated: All phenomena are included in the two categories of conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de gnyis ni 'dogs pa'i tshig gis glo bur gyi ming du btags pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'dogs pa'i tshig gis glo bur gyi ming du btags pa yin te /
translated: Those two are names that are nominally designated by terms that designate.🔽Since they are not the nature of things, the things of phenomena that are expressed by the childish do not arrive at the nature of things through names because, prior to names, there is no cognition, because names are not things, and because names are not ascertained. Therefore, they are established as nondual, like “conditioned” and “unconditioned.”

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas byis pa'i blo can dag gis chos rnams kyi dngos po gang dag brjod pa de dag ni ming gi snga rol na blo med pa'i phyir dang / ming ma yin pa'i phyir dang / ming ma nges pa'i phyir ming gis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi thog tu mi phebs pas na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur gnyis su med par grub pa yin no zhes sngar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas byis pa'i blo can dag gis chos rnams kyi dngos po gang dag brjod pa de dag ni ming gi snga rol na blo med pa'i phyir dang / ming ma yin pa'i phyir dang / ming ma nges pa'i phyir ming gis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi thog tu mi phebs pas na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur gnyis su med par grub pa yin no zhes sngar bstan pa yin te /
translated: That was explained above.

original: des ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: That explains the mode of being as it is.

original: de ltar gnyis su med par grub pa bstan pa nyid kyis brjod du med pa yang zhar la grub par bstan pas na de ni mtshan nyid gnyis kyis lus rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis su med par grub pa bstan pa nyid kyis brjod du med pa yang zhar la grub par bstan pas na de ni mtshan nyid gnyis kyis lus rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since nonduality is established by that very explanation, inexpressibility is also established incidentally. Therefore, that is the explanation of the body of characteristics.

original: de'i 'og tu de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /🔽de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba ni de gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid grub par bstan pa nyid brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang zhar la grub par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis kyis lus rnam par🔽gzhag pa de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas 'dir kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad @37a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste / de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba ni de gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid grub par bstan pa nyid brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang zhar la grub par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis kyis lus rnam par gzhag pa de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas 'dir kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad @37a * //
translated: Then, in order to explain the meaning of the words of the three natures,🔽the three natures are explained in order to demonstrate that the two characteristics of non-duality and inexpressibility are established by implication.

original: gnyis su med pas brjod du med par bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pas brjod du med par bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The three natures are explained in order to demonstrate that all phenomena are inexpressible due to non-duality.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa gleng bslang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas 'dir 'phags pa tshul bzhin kun 'dris /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa gleng bslang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas 'dir 'phags pa tshul bzhin kun 'dris /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that, the noble one is questioned properly.

original: 'phags pa don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel la kye rgyal ba'i sras ji ltar na 'dus byas ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'phags pa don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel la kye rgyal ba'i sras ji ltar na 'dus byas ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin la /
translated: The noble Definitive Explanation of the Profound Intent says, “O children of the Victorious Ones! How is it that conditioned phenomena are neither conditioned nor unconditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas ni 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin 'dus byas kyang ma yin zhes bya ba dris te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin 'dus byas kyang ma yin zhes bya ba dris te /
translated: and how is it that unconditioned phenomena are neither unconditioned nor conditioned?”

original: sngar chos thams cad ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar chos thams cad ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin la /
translated: The text then explains that all phenomena are included within the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: de gnyis ni 'dogs pa'i tshig gis glo bur gyi ming du btags pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'dogs pa'i tshig gis glo bur gyi ming du btags pa yin te /
translated: The two are merely names that are imputed by designating terms.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas byis pa'i blo can dag gis chos rnams kyi dngos po gang dag brjod pa de dag ni ming gi snga rol na blo med pa'i phyir dang / blo mang ba'i phyir dang / blo ma nges pa'i phyir ming gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi thog tu mi phebs pas na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur gnyis su med par grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa de nyid gtan la dbab pa'i phyir
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas byis pa'i blo can dag gis chos rnams kyi dngos po gang dag brjod pa de dag ni ming gi snga rol na blo med pa'i phyir dang / blo mang ba'i phyir dang / blo ma nges pa'i phyir ming gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi thog tu mi phebs pas na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur gnyis su med par grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa de nyid gtan la dbab pa'i phyir
translated: In order to ascertain that very point,

original: de skad ces dris so //
analyzed: de skad ces dris so //
translated: he asked that question.

original: de nas 'phags pa don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel gyis kyang /
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel gyis kyang /
translated: Then, the noble one who explains the profound meaning, the one who is definite in his intention,

original: de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad gnyis su med pas brjod du med par bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad gnyis su med pas brjod du med par bstan te /
translated: taught that all phenomena are inexpressible because they are nondual from the perspective of the presentation of the three natures.

original: de la rigs kyi bu 'dus byas zhes bya ba de ni ston pas btags pa'i tshig yin te zhes bya bas ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la rigs kyi bu 'dus byas zhes bya ba de ni ston pas btags pa'i tshig yin te zhes bya bas ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase Son of good family, that which is called 'conditioned' is a term designated by the Teacher indicates the presentation of the imagined nature.

original: brjod pa ni dngos po med pa can yang ma yin te zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: brjod pa ni dngos po med pa can yang ma yin te zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase it is not nonexistent indicates the presentation of the dependent nature.

original: brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase it is inexpressible indicates the presentation of the perfected nature.

original: zhes bya bas ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa de rnam pa gsum gyis ni mtshan nyid gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad pa las brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid gtso bor bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa de rnam pa gsum gyis ni mtshan nyid gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad pa las brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid gtso bor bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase it is fully accomplished as inexpressible indicates that the perfected nature is the principal characteristic of the three natures, which are presented from the perspective of the two natures.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the perfected nature like?

original: ston pas btags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de ni mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gtan med pa yin no //
analyzed: ston pas btags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de ni mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gtan med pa yin no //
translated: Since it is the nature designated by the Teacher, it is not nonexistent because it is the nature of characteristics.

original: kun du rtog pa sna tshogs las byung ba'i tha snyad du brjod pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub kyang brjod par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa dang
analyzed: kun du rtog pa sna tshogs las byung ba'i tha snyad du brjod pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub kyang brjod par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa dang
translated: The imagined nature, which is the expression of conventions arising from various conceptualizations, is not established at all. However, the dependent nature, which is the other entity that is the basis of expression, is not nonexistent because of the nonexistence of an essential nature that is produced.

original: / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i rten cing @37b 'brel bar 'byung ba ni yod do //
analyzed: / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i rten cing @37b 'brel bar 'byung ba ni yod do //
translated: The dependent origination that is the basis of the ultimate naturelessness is existent.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po de 'phags pa rnams kyis don dam pa'i shes pa dang mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid🔽kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po de 'phags pa rnams kyis don dam pa'i shes pa dang mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid🔽kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: The dependent nature, which is the entity that is the basis of expression, is the fully present nature, which is the ultimate naturelessness that is the nonexistence of an essential nature because it is the perfect realization of the nonexpressible by the wisdom and seeing of the āryas.

original: de ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: de ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin te /
translated: Since that is the reality of phenomena, the ultimate, the nonduality of objective selflessness, it is also the characteristic of the inexpressible.

original: de nyid don dam pa brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid don dam pa brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus it is endowed with the characteristic of the ultimate, the characteristic of the inexpressible, and the characteristic of nonduality.

original: de ltar spyi'i don bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar spyi'i don bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the general meaning,

original: da ni de dag gi tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni de dag gi tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the meaning of the words will be explained.

original: de la ston pas btags pa'i tshig yin te zhes bya ba ni ston pas sems can rnams la tha snyad gdags pa dang go bar bya ba'i phyir bka' stsal pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de la ston pas btags pa'i tshig yin te zhes bya ba ni ston pas sems can rnams la tha snyad gdags pa dang go bar bya ba'i phyir bka' stsal pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: Here, “the words designated by the Teacher” are the words spoken by the Teacher for the sake of designating conventions and being understood by sentient beings.

original: btags pa'i tshig de ni dang po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin gyi 'dogs pa'i tshig gis glo bur du sgro btags pa yin pas dngos su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: btags pa'i tshig de ni dang po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin gyi 'dogs pa'i tshig gis glo bur du sgro btags pa yin pas dngos su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Those designated words are not the first nature, but since they are superimposed adventitiously by the words of designation, they are not actually existent, and thus they are the imagined nature.

original: de ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir gtan med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir gtan med par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is not totally nonexistent, because it is the realitylessness of the imagined reality.

original: ston pas btags pa'i tshig gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni ston pas mdo sde de dang de dag tu 'dus byas zhes ming du btags pa la glengs te ;
analyzed: ston pas btags pa'i tshig gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni ston pas mdo sde de dang de dag tu 'dus byas zhes ming du btags pa la glengs te ;
translated: The words “that which is designated by the Teacher” refer to the designation of the name “conditioned” by the Teacher in this and that sūtra.

original: 'di bshad pas ston pa gtso cher smos par zad kyi 'dir ston pa 'ba' zhig gzung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di bshad pas ston pa gtso cher smos par zad kyi 'dir ston pa 'ba' zhig gzung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: This is explained because the Teacher is the principal one, but it is not that only the Teacher is referred to here.

original: ji tsam du tha snyad gdags pa dang go bar bya ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa dag gis smras pa'i tshig kyang de bzhin du gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du tha snyad gdags pa dang go bar bya ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa dag gis smras pa'i tshig kyang de bzhin du gzung bar bya'o //
translated: To the extent that there is designation and understanding, the words spoken by others should be understood in the same way.

original: kun du rtog pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rtog pas ngag kun nas slong zhing ngag gi tha snyad du rjod par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rtog pas ngag kun nas slong zhing ngag gi tha snyad du rjod par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: “Arisen from imagination” means that speech is motivated by imagination and is expressed as verbal convention.

original: de yang shes bya la brjod par bya ba'i rnam pa dang / sgra la brjod par bya ba'i rnam pa gzhan nas de go bar byed pa'i tshig brjod pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang shes bya la brjod par bya ba'i rnam pa dang / sgra la brjod par bya ba'i rnam pa gzhan nas de go bar byed pa'i tshig brjod pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the aspect of the object of expression and the aspect of the expression are due to the expression of words that cause understanding of the other.

original: brjod par bya ba dang / rjod pa'i rnam pa dag dngos po la gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dang / rjod pa'i rnam pa dag dngos po la gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the aspect of the object of expression and the aspect of the expression do not exist in reality.

original: tha snyad du brjod pa yin la zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir brjod pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad du brjod pa yin la zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir brjod pa ste /
translated: The expression is due to the conventional expression, which is called “conventional expression.”

original: tha snyad ni rang gi bsam pa go bar byed pa yin no //🔽kun du rtog pa sna tshogs kyi tha snyad du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha snyad ni rang gi bsam pa go bar byed pa yin no // kun du rtog pa sna tshogs kyi tha snyad du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The conventional expression is the understanding of one’s own thought.🔽The expression of the conventional expression of various imaginations is

original: kun du rtog pa sna tshogs las byung ba'i tha snyad du brjod pa'o //🔽gtan yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brjod pas yongs su @38a * //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa sna tshogs las byung ba'i tha snyad du brjod pa'o // gtan yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brjod pas yongs su @38a * //
translated: the expression of the conventional expression that arises from various imaginations.🔽Because it is not ultimately established,

original: ma grub pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is not established by the expression, and because its nature is not established.

original: de'i phyir des ni 'dus byas kyi sgras bskyed pa'i 'dus byas kyi rnam pa yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i 'dogs pa'i tshig gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas na 'dus byas ma yin no
analyzed: de'i phyir des ni 'dus byas kyi sgras bskyed pa'i 'dus byas kyi rnam pa yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i 'dogs pa'i tshig gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas na 'dus byas ma yin no
translated: Therefore, since the aspect of the conditioned that is generated by the word conditioned is not fully established, the term “conditioned” is not the reality of the entity that is conditioned.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, it is not conditioned.

original: 'o na de de ltar 'dus byas ma yin na 'dus byas ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de de ltar 'dus byas ma yin na 'dus byas ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is not conditioned in that way, then it is unconditioned.

original: ma yin te de'i phyir rigs kyi bu 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de yang tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ma yin te de'i phyir rigs kyi bu 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de yang tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: No, it is not. Therefore, the text says, “Son of noble family, that which is called unconditioned is also included within convention.”

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i rnam pa yang brjod pas bskyed pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir gtan yongs su ma grub pas de ni 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i rnam pa yang brjod pas bskyed pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir gtan yongs su ma grub pas de ni 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin no //
translated: Since the aspect called “unconditioned” is also an aspect generated by expression, it is not fully established. Therefore, it is not unconditioned.

original: de ltar na de de gnyis ka ma yin pa'i phyogs gzhan zhig yin par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de de gnyis ka ma yin pa'i phyogs gzhan zhig yin par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then it would be a different position that is neither of those two.🔽No, it is not.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas su ma gtogs pa gang ci brjod kyang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas su ma gtogs pa gang ci brjod kyang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “Whatever is expressed, apart from the conditioned and the unconditioned.”

original: de gnyis kyi sgra la ma gtogs pa'i ming ci brjod kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi sgra la ma gtogs pa'i ming ci brjod kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “whatever is expressed” means whatever names are not included in those two terms.

original: de yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa nyid du 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa nyid du 'gyur pa'o //
translated: And that is just like those two, means that it is just like those two in being included in conventions.🔽And that is just like those two, means that it is just like those two in being included in conventions.

original: de yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes lan gnyis su bzlas pa ni thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ba'i zhes brnan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de dang 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes lan gnyis su bzlas pa ni thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ba'i zhes brnan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The repetition of “that is just like those two” is for the purpose of emphasizing that everything is just like those two.

original: de ltar na brjod pa'i sgra ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir gtan med pas na 'dus byas zhes /
analyzed: de ltar na brjod pa'i sgra ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir gtan med pas na 'dus byas zhes /
translated: Thus, since the term “expressed” is an imagined nature, it is natureless in terms of the nature of characteristic.

original: ston pas btags pa'i tshig de ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ston pas btags pa'i tshig de ni 'dus byas kyang ma yin 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Teacher’s designation of that as “conditioned” is not conditioned and is not unconditioned.

original: de gnyis las ma gtogs pa gzhan yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis las ma gtogs pa gzhan yang ma yin no //
translated: There is nothing else apart from those two.

original: brjod pa'i sgra dang brjod par bya ba'i rnam pa gnyis kas stong pa gang yin pa de lta bu ni ci yang med de /
analyzed: brjod pa'i sgra dang brjod par bya ba'i rnam pa gnyis kas stong pa gang yin pa de lta bu ni ci yang med de /
translated: There is nothing whatsoever that is empty of both the sound that expresses it and the aspect that is expressed.

original: brjod pa'i sgra kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gtan yongs su ma grub kyang brjod par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni med pa ma yin pas de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas brjod pa ni dngos po med pa🔽can ma yin te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: brjod pa'i sgra kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gtan yongs su ma grub kyang brjod par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni med pa ma yin pas de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas brjod pa ni dngos po med pa can ma yin te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Although the sound that expresses it, which is the imagined nature, is completely unestablished, the entity that is expressed, which is the dependent nature, is not nonexistent. Therefore, in order to teach that, it is said, “It is not nonexistent.”

original: brjod pa zhes bya ba ni ston pas btags pa'i tshig ces sngar bstan pa ste kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa zhes bya ba ni ston pas btags pa'i tshig ces sngar bstan pa ste kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: “It is expressed” refers to the words that are designated by the teacher, as previously explained. It is the imagined nature.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: “Entity” refers to the entity that is expressed.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: It is the dependent nature.

original: med pa can yang ma yin te zhes bya @38b ba ni brjod pa'i sgra kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gtan yongs su ma grub kyang /
analyzed: med pa can yang ma yin te zhes bya @38b ba ni brjod pa'i sgra kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gtan yongs su ma grub kyang /
translated: Nor is it nonexistent, means that although the sound of expression, the imagined nature, is not at all established,

original: brjod par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: the thing expressed, the dependent nature, is not nonexistent.

original: de ltar na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the dependent nature, which is free from the apprehended and apprehender, the imagined nature, should be known as existent, as dependent origination that is realityless by the realitylessness of production, and as realityless by the realitylessness of the ultimate.

original: dngos po de yang gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i sgra kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gtan yongs su ma grub kyang brjod par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi
analyzed: dngos po de yang gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i sgra kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gtan yongs su ma grub kyang brjod par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi
translated: This means, “Although the sound of expression is not at all established as an imagined nature, it is not the case that there is no other dependent nature that is the entity that is expressed.”

original: ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po de gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po de gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: What is that entity that is the dependent nature?

original: dngos po de nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: dngos po de nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: That entity is the dependent nature.

original: de 'phags pa rnams kyis don dam pa'i shes pa dang / mthong bas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de 'phags pa rnams kyis don dam pa'i shes pa dang / mthong bas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The ultimate cognition and seeing of the āryas that fully awakens to that is the perfected nature.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis so //
translated: The āryas refers to the śrāvakas of the Buddha.

original: 'phags pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i don dam pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i don dam pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The āryas refers to the ultimate cognition and seeing of the āryas.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa ste /
translated: Knowledge is the wisdom of serenity and insight that focuses on mixed phenomena.

original: de ni rnam pa sna tshogs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa sna tshogs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not of various kinds.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa ste /
translated: Seeing is the wisdom of serenity and insight that focuses on unmixed phenomena.

original: de ni rnam pa sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is of various kinds.

original: brjod du med pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i shes pa dang / mthong bas rtogs par thugs su chud pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i shes pa dang / mthong bas rtogs par thugs su chud pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of the knowledge of the ultimate and the realization of the knowledge of seeing.

original: de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: It is realityless by way of the unreality of the perfected nature.

original: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin te /
translated: It is also realityless by way of the unreality of the ultimate, because the suchness of phenomena is the ultimate, the selflessness of phenomena, the characteristic of nonduality.

original: de nyid don dam pa brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid don dam pa brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is endowed with the characteristic of the inexpressible ultimate and the characteristic of non-duality.

original: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pas 'dus byas de ci'i phyir gdags pa mdzad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pas 'dus byas de ci'i phyir gdags pa mdzad ce na /
translated: Well then, why did the Tathāgata designate that which is conditioned?

original: de'i phyir brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i @39a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i @39a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “In order to realize that very inexpressible reality,

original: phyir 'dus byas zhes ming du btags so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: phyir 'dus byas zhes ming du btags so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the name ‘conditioned’ is designated.”

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du 'dogs pa tshig gis de skad ma brjod na chos nyid de rtogs par khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du 'dogs pa tshig gis de skad ma brjod na chos nyid de rtogs par khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir /
translated: If the conventional designation of the relative were not expressed in words, there would be no other means to realize that reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za ba la mkhas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad gdags pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thabs la 'jug pa chud mi za ba la mkhas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad gdags pa mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata, from the perspective of skill in the non-wastage of engagement in means, made such designations.

original: rigs kyi bu 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de yang ston pas btags pa'i tshig yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi tshar la yang snga ma'i tshul bzhin du sbyar zhing bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de yang ston pas btags pa'i tshig yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi tshar la yang snga ma'i tshul bzhin du sbyar zhing bshad par bya ste /
translated: In this way, the unconditioned should be explained in the same way as before.

original: de ni de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the context for the presentation of the three natures.

original: 'og tu rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'og tu rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Later, I will explain the meaning of the terms and so on in the presentation of the analogy in the final analysis.

original: de rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa bstan pa de rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i phyir byis pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid mi rtog pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mi mthong
analyzed: de rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa bstan pa de rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i phyir byis pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid mi rtog pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mi mthong
translated: The explanation of the topics of the treatise is the teaching of the ultimate, which has the character of being inexpressible and the character of being nondual. In order to ascertain that, the example of the fool who does not conceive the nature of the dependent because of manifest clinging to the imagined nature and therefore does not see the nature of the real is taught.

original: ba'i dpe dang / mkhas pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa med pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rtogs pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong zhing /
analyzed: ba'i dpe dang / mkhas pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa med pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rtogs pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong zhing /
translated: The example of the wise one who does not manifestly cling to the imagined nature, who therefore realizes the nature of the dependent and sees the nature of the real is taught.

original: gzhan gyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa gnyis kyis don de rgya cher ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa gnyis kyis don de rgya cher ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the extensive teaching of that meaning by means of the two kinds of examples that are posited as the bases for the conventional expressions that are used in order to make others understand the thoroughly established nature.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa gleng bslang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas ;🔽'dir 'phags pa tshul bzhin kun 'dris /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa gleng bslang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas ; 'dir 'phags pa tshul bzhin kun 'dris /
translated: Therefore, in the context of the introduction to the teaching of that,

original: 'phags pa don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel la /
analyzed: 'phags pa don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel la /
translated: in the noble Unraveling the Intent,

original: rgyal ba'i sras ji ltar na 'phags pa rnams kyi dngos po de 'phags pa'i shes pa dang / 'phags pa'i mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras ji ltar na 'phags pa rnams kyi dngos po de 'phags pa'i shes pa dang / 'phags pa'i mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
translated: the noble one asked the Bhagavat, “Bhagavat, how is it that the noble ones, with noble wisdom and noble seeing, fully awaken to the inexpressible reality of things,

original: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes ming du btags pa yin zhes bya ba dris te /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes ming du btags pa yin zhes bya ba dris te /
translated: and how is that inexpressible reality fully realized in order to designate it with the names ‘conditioned’ and ‘unconditioned’?”

original: de la dngos po de zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i tha snyad dang bral ba brjod par bya ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po de zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i tha snyad dang bral ba brjod par bya ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: The phrase that thing refers to the thing that is to be described, which is free from the imaginary convention.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po'o //
translated: It is the thing that is the relative nature.🔽The phrase awakened to the inexpressible through the wisdom of the noble ones and the seeing of the noble ones refers to the question, What is the nature of that thing for the noble ones?

original: 'phags pa'i @39b shes pa dang 'phags pa'i mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyi dngos po de ji lta bu 'phags pa'i rgyud la mnga' ba'i don dam pa'i shes pa dang / mngon par rtogs par thugs su chud ces 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i @39b shes pa dang 'phags pa'i mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyi dngos po de ji lta bu 'phags pa'i rgyud la mnga' ba'i don dam pa'i shes pa dang / mngon par rtogs par thugs su chud ces 'dri ba ste /
translated: It is the ultimate wisdom and realization that exists in the mindstream of the noble ones.

original: ji ltar yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong bar gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong bar gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase how is the perfected nature seen?

original: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes ming du btags pa yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'phags pa don dam pa'i shes pa dang / mthong bas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gzigs pa rnams yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de nyid gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba'i thabs su kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang mthong bas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes ming du 'dogs par mdzad pa ste
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes ming du btags pa yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'phags pa don dam pa'i shes pa dang / mthong bas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gzigs pa rnams yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de nyid gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba'i thabs su kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang mthong bas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes ming du 'dogs par mdzad pa ste
translated: Thus, in order for those who see the consummate nature with the noble ultimate cognition and seeing to realize that very consummate nature, the conventional cognition and seeing designate the terms conditioned and unconditioned as a means for others to understand.

original: / ji ltar 'dogs par mdzad ces 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: / ji ltar 'dogs par mdzad ces 'dri ba ste /
translated: How do they designate?

original: ji ltar kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang mthong bas rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par mdzad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang mthong bas rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par mdzad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means how do they impute conventions with conventional cognition and seeing?

original: de nas 'phags pa don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel gyis kyang don de nyid nges par gtan la dbab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel gyis kyang don de nyid nges par gtan la dbab pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to ascertain that very meaning, the noble one, the Definitive Explanation of the Profound Meaning, said:

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na sgyu ma mkhan nam sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste zhes bya pa la sogs pas dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na sgyu ma mkhan nam sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste zhes bya pa la sogs pas dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this: for example, a skilled magician or magician's apprentice sits at the crossroads of a major intersection, and so on. This teaches the presentation of the example.

original: de la dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the presentation of the example is twofold:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the presentation of the example that accords with the side of affliction, and the presentation of the example that accords with the side of purification.

original: dpes mtshon pa'i don kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dpes mtshon pa'i don kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The meaning illustrated by the example is also twofold:

original: byis pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la rnam par zhen pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa mi rtogs pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa mi mthong ba dang /🔽mkhas pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa med pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa rtogs pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa'i @40a * //
analyzed: byis pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la rnam par zhen pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa mi rtogs pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa mi mthong ba dang / mkhas pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa med pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa rtogs pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa'i @40a * //
translated: Because childish beings are attached to the imagined nature, they do not understand the nature of the dependent to be natureless in being natureless in terms of production and they do not see the nature of the real to be natureless in being natureless in terms of the ultimate.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa mthong zhing /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa mthong zhing /
translated: Because the wise are not attached to the imagined nature, they understand the nature of the dependent to be natureless in being natureless in terms of production and they see the nature of the real to be natureless in being natureless in terms of the ultimate.

original: gzhan gyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa de nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa de nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The other, the perfected nature, is the ultimate, and it is the object of the conventional, which is the realization of the ultimate naturelessness.

original: de la dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa gnyis ni mdo las /
analyzed: de la dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa gnyis ni mdo las /
translated: The two kinds of illustrations are presented in the sutra:

original: de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dag go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dag go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
