translated: Those sentient beings who are of childish nature and so on, and those sentient beings who are not of childish nature and so on.

original: dpes mtshon pa'i don rnam pa gnyis ni mdo las /
analyzed: dpes mtshon pa'i don rnam pa gnyis ni mdo las /
translated: The two kinds of illustrated objects are presented in the sutra:

original: de bzhin du sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can so so'i skye bor gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pas bden pa mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can so so'i skye bor gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pas bden pa mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Likewise, “those sentient beings who are of childish nature and are ordinary beings” and so on, and “those sentient beings who are not of childish nature and have seen the truth” and so on are stated in order.

original: skabs 'dir ni dpes mtshon pa'i don tha ma nyid gzung bar bya ste ;
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni dpes mtshon pa'i don tha ma nyid gzung bar bya ste ;
translated: Here, one should take the final meaning illustrated by the example.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po de shes pa dang / mthong bas rtogs pa nyid yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa yin pas de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi dngos po de 'phags pa'i shes pa dang 'phags pa'i mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po de shes pa dang / mthong bas rtogs pa nyid yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa yin pas de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi dngos po de 'phags pa'i shes pa dang 'phags pa'i mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya
translated: That very realization through knowing and seeing the dependent nature that is free from the imagined nature is the full realization of the consummate nature. Therefore, that is called “the noble ones’ inexpressible perfect buddhahood of that thing through noble knowledge and noble seeing.”

original: ste / de nyid chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ste / de nyid chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since thatness is the reality of phenomena, the ultimate, the non-duality of the selflessness of phenomena, it is also the characteristic of the inexpressible.

original: de ltar spyi'i don bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar spyi'i don bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the general meaning,

original: de nas de dag gi tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas de dag gi tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the meaning of the words should be explained.

original: de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: Among sentient beings, those who are of childish nature,

original: rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: those who are of deluded nature,

original: shes rab 'chal ba'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni lung dang rjes su dpag pa dang mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba'i blo med pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni lung dang rjes su dpag pa dang mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba'i blo med pa ste /
translated: those who are of perverted wisdom nature are those who lack the intelligence that follows the valid cognitions of scripture, inference, and direct perception.

original: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: They should be connected in order.

original: snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni yod do snyam du sems shing zhes bya ba ni de mi slu bar byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa mi shes shing /
analyzed: snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni yod do snyam du sems shing zhes bya ba ni de mi slu bar byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa mi shes shing /
translated: Thinking that what appears exists, they do not know the cause of non-deception,

original: glang po che la sogs pa dngos nyid yin par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa dngos nyid yin par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and they apprehend elephants, etc. as real.

original: nan gyis zhes bya ba ni rang gi blos bye brag pa med par gzu lums su zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nan gyis zhes bya ba ni rang gi blos bye brag pa med par gzu lums su zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Forcefully” means without any discrimination by one’s own mind, and “rashly” is synonymous with “haphazardly.”

original: mchog tu gzung zhing zhes bya ba ni rab kyis lta ba mchog tu gzung @40b nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu gzung zhing zhes bya ba ni rab kyis lta ba mchog tu gzung @40b nas gnas pa'o //
translated: “Holding to be supreme” means to hold a view to be supreme and to abide in it.

original: mngon par zhen nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis de las bzlog pa na de 'dzin cing mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis de las bzlog pa na de 'dzin cing mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: “Clinging” means to grasp that view and not let go of it when others try to dissuade one from it.

original: 'di ni bden gyi zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis de la chags nas de nyid bden par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bden gyi zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis de la chags nas de nyid bden par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: “This is the truth” means, through the power of clinging, to be attached to that view and to hold it to be true.🔽“The other is false” means to say that there is no truth other than this.

original: gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di las bden pa lhag pa logs shig na med do zhes zer ba ni de ni de dag gi phyir nye bar brtag par bya dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na log par rtog pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di las bden pa lhag pa logs shig na med do zhes zer ba ni de ni de dag gi phyir nye bar brtag par bya dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na log par rtog pa'i phyir ro
translated: “That must be investigated” means that at that time, it is necessary to investigate that view because it is a wrong conception.

original: // de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa /
analyzed: // de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa /
translated: Among those sentient beings, there are those who are not of a childish nature,

original: rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa /
analyzed: rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa /
translated: who are not of a deluded nature,

original: shes rab dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni snga ma las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni snga ma las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The one who is endowed with the nature of wisdom is the opposite of the former.

original: snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni med do zhes bya ba yang snga ma las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni med do zhes bya ba yang snga ma las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: This appearance does not exist is also the opposite of the former.

original: rnam grangs kyi 'du shes zhes bya ba ni de dag gi dngos po gcig la yang ming gi rnam grangs tha dad pa du mar 'dogs pa'i 'du shes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi 'du shes zhes bya ba ni de dag gi dngos po gcig la yang ming gi rnam grangs tha dad pa du mar 'dogs pa'i 'du shes 'byung ba'o //
translated: The notion of synonyms is the notion that arises from the designation of many different synonyms for a single thing.

original: sgyu ma byas pa 'di ni yod ces bya ba ni glang po che la sogs pa'i mtshan ma sems las byung ba snang ba tsam gyi mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma byas pa 'di ni yod ces bya ba ni glang po che la sogs pa'i mtshan ma sems las byung ba snang ba tsam gyi mtshan ma ste /
translated: This illusion exists is the mere appearance of the signs of elephants and so on that arise from the mind.

original: des ni sgyu ma la yang glang po che la sogs pa log par mi 'dzin pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sgyu ma la yang glang po che la sogs pa log par mi 'dzin pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that one should not apprehend elephants and so on as unreal in an illusion.

original: mi slu bar byed pa 'di ni yod do zhes bya bas ni sgyu ma'i sgyu rtsal la sogs pa de dag la yang phyi rol gyi dngos po log par mi 'dzin pa bstan to //
analyzed: mi slu bar byed pa 'di ni yod do zhes bya bas ni sgyu ma'i sgyu rtsal la sogs pa de dag la yang phyi rol gyi dngos po log par mi 'dzin pa bstan to //
translated: This nondeceptive exists shows that one should not apprehend external things as unreal in the illusion of the magician and so on.

original: rjes su tha snyad mi 'dogs kyi zhes bya bas ni dpes mtshon pa'i don gyi 'jug nas 'phags pa'i shes pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing zhes 'byung ba'i don de mtshon par byed do //🔽'di ltar don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed de zhes bya bas ni dpes mtshon pa'i don gyi 'jug nas brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma
analyzed: rjes su tha snyad mi 'dogs kyi zhes bya bas ni dpes mtshon pa'i don gyi 'jug nas 'phags pa'i shes pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing zhes 'byung ba'i don de mtshon par byed do // 'di ltar don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed de zhes bya bas ni dpes mtshon pa'i don gyi 'jug nas brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma
translated: The phrase but does not subsequently designate it indicates the meaning suggested by the example, namely, having attained manifestly perfect buddhahood with respect to the inexpressible reality that is described by the noble ones' transcendent wisdom and the noble ones' truths.🔽The phrase in order to make the meaning known, one subsequently designates it indicates the meaning suggested by the example, namely, in order to realize that very inexpressible reality that is suggested by the example, one designates it as conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: byas zhes ming du btags pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i don de mtshon par byed de /
analyzed: byas zhes ming du btags pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i don de mtshon par byed de /
translated: The phrase having attained manifestly perfect buddhahood with respect to the inexpressible reality that is described by the noble ones' transcendent wisdom and the noble ones' truths indicates the meaning suggested by the example, namely, having attained manifestly perfect buddhahood with respect to the inexpressible reality that is described by the noble ones' transcendent wisdom and the noble ones' truths.

original: 'di ltar don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don gang yin pa nyid la ming de skad btags pa'i don de rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir ming de skad ces rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro
analyzed: 'di ltar don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don gang yin pa nyid la ming de skad btags pa'i don de rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir ming de skad ces rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro
translated: Thus, in order to cognize the object means that the name is applied in order to cognize the object that is designated by that name.

original: // de ni de dag gis phyis nye bar brtag par bya mi dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na gtan la bab par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // de ni de dag gis phyis nye bar brtag par bya mi dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na gtan la bab par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not necessary to investigate it later by them means that at that time, it is understood as ascertained.

original: de dag ni dpe'i dngos po @41a * //
analyzed: de dag ni dpe'i dngos po @41a * //
translated: These are the two types of illustrative examples.

original: rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa gnyis kyis tshig gi don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa gnyis kyis tshig gi don bshad pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words has been explained by these two types of illustrations.

original: da ni dpes mtshon pa'i don rnam pa gnyis kyis tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dpes mtshon pa'i don rnam pa gnyis kyis tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the meaning of the words should be explained by the two types of illustrated meanings.

original: de la de bzhin du sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can so so'i skye bor gyur pa shes rab 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa ma thob pa ste /
analyzed: de la de bzhin du sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can so so'i skye bor gyur pa shes rab 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa ma thob pa ste /
translated: In this regard, those sentient beings who are of childish nature, who are ordinary beings, who have not attained the supramundane wisdom of the noble ones,

original: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: They should be connected in the same order.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas de mthong ngam /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas de mthong ngam /
translated: If one sees or hears the conditioned and the unconditioned,

original: thos na zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma dang 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma rnam par rig pa tsam de mthong ngam thos nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: thos na zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma dang 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma rnam par rig pa tsam de mthong ngam thos nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “If one sees or hears” should be connected with “the mere representation of the conditioned and unconditioned signs.”

original: snang ba gang yin pa de ni yod do snyam du sems shing zhes bya bas ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa bstan to //
analyzed: snang ba gang yin pa de ni yod do snyam du sems shing zhes bya bas ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa bstan to //
translated: “Whatever appears, one thinks, ‘That exists,’” shows the adherence to the imagined reality.

original: de dag ji ltar mthong ba dang ji ltar thos pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la log par mngon par zhen pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar mthong ba dang ji ltar thos pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la log par mngon par zhen pa bstan to //
translated: “Just as they see and hear,” etc., shows the adherence to the other-dependent reality.

original: de ni de dag gi phyis nye bar brtag par bya dgos pa yin no zhes bya bas ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ma mthong ba bstan to //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi phyis nye bar brtag par bya dgos pa yin no zhes bya bas ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ma mthong ba bstan to //
translated: “That must be investigated later on,” shows the non-seeing of the perfected reality.

original: de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa bden pa mthong ba shes rab 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa thob pa chos thams cad kyi brjod du med pa'i chos nyid mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma las bzlog🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa bden pa mthong ba shes rab 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa thob pa chos thams cad kyi brjod du med pa'i chos nyid mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: Those sentient beings who are not of childish nature, who have seen the truth, who have attained the supramundane wisdom of the noble ones, who have the superknowledges, are said to have the non-verbalized reality of all phenomena. This is the opposite of the previous.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni med kyi zhes bya ba ni phyi rol na rdzas su grub pa'i yul du gyur pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas snang ba gang yin pa 'di ni med kyi zhes bya ba ni phyi rol na rdzas su grub pa'i yul du gyur pa med pa'o //
translated: This appearance of the conditioned and unconditioned does not exist. This means that external objects that exist substantially do not exist.

original: 'dir gang la brjod pa 'jug par 'gyur ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa btags pa'i yod pa gang yin pa de dag med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir gang la brjod pa 'jug par 'gyur ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa btags pa'i yod pa gang yin pa de dag med par bstan to //
translated: Here, in order to engage with what is being expressed, the existence of the conditioned and unconditioned, etc., which are imputed, are taught to be non-existent.

original: rdzas su yod pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu yin yang rnam par rig pa tsam du yod par 'dod na gnod pa med de /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu yin yang rnam par rig pa tsam du yod par 'dod na gnod pa med de /
translated: However, if it is asserted that they exist as mere representations, like the substantial existence of suchness, etc., there is no fault.

original: de'i phyir gang la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi 'du shes dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi rnam grangs kyi 'du shes 'byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi 'du shes dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi rnam grangs kyi 'du shes 'byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “where there is the notion of the conditioned and the notion of the unconditioned, and the notion of the synonyms of the conditioned and the unconditioned.🔽”

original: de bzhin nyid la ni 'du shes 'byung bar 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la ni 'du shes 'byung bar 'gyur ba med de /
translated: In reality, there is no arising of the notion,

original: 'byung na yang de'i mtshan ma la 'byung bas de yang rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'byung na yang de'i mtshan ma la 'byung bas de yang rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yin te /
translated: but even if there were, it would arise from the sign of that.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa las byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa las byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “arising from conceptualization.🔽”

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni dngos po la gzugs dang / @41b sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni dngos po la gzugs dang / @41b sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang /
translated: The sign of the conditioned refers to the superimposition of things such as form, sound, smell, taste, touch, male, female, birth, aging, sickness,

original: 'chi ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu lhag par sgro btags pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu lhag par sgro btags pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: death, and so on.

original: de nyid rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma yin no //
translated: That itself is the sign of mere representation.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma gang yin pa de yang 'du shes kyi mtshan ma kho na ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma gang yin pa de yang 'du shes kyi mtshan ma kho na ste /
translated: The sign of reality is just the sign of discrimination,

original: 'dus byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is compounded.

original: sgyu ma lta bu 'di ni yod ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos por yod pa ma yin gyi rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu 'di ni yod ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos por yod pa ma yin gyi rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This illusion-like existence is said to exist as mere representation, not as an external thing.🔽This delusion of the mind is said to exist as the nature of unreal imagination,

original: blo rnam par rmongs par byed pa 'di ni yod do zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: blo rnam par rmongs par byed pa 'di ni yod do zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the nature of unreal imagination.

original: de dag gis ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa med par bstan to //
translated: These passages show the absence of adherence to the imagined reality.

original: de dag ji ltar mthong ba dang ji ltar thos pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la log par mngon par zhen pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar mthong ba dang ji ltar thos pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la log par mngon par zhen pa med par bstan to //
translated: The passage beginning “As they are seen and heard” shows the absence of adherence to the dependent reality.

original: 'di ltar don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed de zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang mthong ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed de zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang mthong ba ste /
translated: This is the conventional cognition and vision.

original: 'og nas brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes ming du btags pa yin no zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'og nas brjod du med pa'i chos nyid de nyid mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes ming du btags pa yin no zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Later, it is applied to the unconditioned reality that is inexpressible, and the name conditioned and unconditioned is applied to it.🔽This is because it is not necessary to investigate it later by means of those.

original: de ni de dag gis phyis nye bar brtag par bya mi dgos pa yin no zhes bya bas ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid grub par bstan to //
analyzed: de ni de dag gis phyis nye bar brtag par bya mi dgos pa yin no zhes bya bas ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid grub par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the established nature is taught.🔽Son of noble family, it is like this, and so on.

original: rigs kyi bu de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don gyi mjug bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don gyi mjug bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: This teaches the summary of the meaning.

original: de ltar kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyis dngos po de shes pa dang mthong bas rtogs pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong ba yin pas de ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid don dam
analyzed: de ltar kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyis dngos po de shes pa dang mthong bas rtogs pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong ba yin pas de ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid don dam
translated: The realization of that thing that is devoid of the imagined nature and is the dependent nature through knowing and seeing is the seeing of the perfect nature.

original: pa chos bdag med pa nyid gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: pa chos bdag med pa nyid gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yin te /
translated: Therefore it is the suchness of phenomena, the ultimate, the selflessness of phenomena, the characteristic of nonduality, and thus it is the characteristic of the inexpressible.

original: de ni rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i dpe'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the analogy for ascertaining that.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the words that present the summary of those topics should be explained.

original: de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa sngar bstan pa'i tshig gi don de dag gi @42a * //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa sngar bstan pa'i tshig gi don de dag gi @42a * //
translated: The definition of the collection of their entities is the definition of the collection of the entities of those previously explained words and meanings, which possess the characteristic of the ultimate inexpressible and the characteristic of non-duality.

original: dngos po tshigs su bcad pas mdor bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po tshigs su bcad pas mdor bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the definition that summarizes in verse the collection of those entities.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel gyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' don zab dgongs pa nges par 'grel gyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs te /
translated: then the bodhisattva Gambhirarthasamdhinirmocana spoke these verses at that time, and so forth. The two verses are spoken.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis las tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i rtsa ba gong ma gnyis kyis ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis las tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i rtsa ba gong ma gnyis kyis ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs bstan to //
translated: In the two verses, the first half of the first verse teaches the side of purification.

original: rtsa ba 'og ma gnyis kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs bstan to //
analyzed: rtsa ba 'og ma gnyis kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs bstan to //
translated: The second half teaches the side of affliction.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la gnas pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la gnas pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: The second verse teaches the faults of those who abide in the side of afflictive emotions.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i rtsa ba gong ma gnyis ni /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i rtsa ba gong ma gnyis ni /
translated: In the first verse, the first two lines teach:

original: zab mo'i byis pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa //
analyzed: zab mo'i byis pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa //
translated: The profound is not the domain of the childish.

original: brjod med gnyis med rgyal bas bstan mdzad kyang //
analyzed: brjod med gnyis med rgyal bas bstan mdzad kyang //
translated: The Victor taught the inexpressible and nondual,🔽but the childish, obscured by darkness,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: do not understand the profound.

original: de ni don dam pa'i zab mo'i spyod yul ma yin pa brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de ni don dam pa'i zab mo'i spyod yul ma yin pa brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa /
translated: The profound is not the domain of the childish, which is to say that it has the characteristic of being inexpressible and the characteristic of being nondual.

original: rgyal ba stobs bcu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rgyal ba stobs bcu dang ldan pa /
translated: The Victor, who possesses the ten powers

original: thugs rje dam pa mnga' bas bstan pa'i sgo nas mtshan nyid gnyis kyi dngos po bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: thugs rje dam pa mnga' bas bstan pa'i sgo nas mtshan nyid gnyis kyi dngos po bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: and sublime compassion, taught the inclusion of the two kinds of entities by way of teaching.

original: de gnyis kyi rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyang bstan pa yin no //
translated: He also taught the side of purification of those two.

original: rtsa ba gong ma gnyis ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba gong ma gnyis ni /
translated: The first two lines of the second verse teach:

original: byis pa gti mug rmongs pa 'di dag ni //
analyzed: byis pa gti mug rmongs pa 'di dag ni //
translated: These childish ones are obscured by the darkness of delusion.

original: smra ba'i spros la dga' zhing gnyis la gnas //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: smra ba'i spros la dga' zhing gnyis la gnas // zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: They delight in the proliferation of speech and abide in duality.

original: des ni byis pa gti mug gis rmongs pa 'di dag ni don dam pas brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa mi shes pas smra ba'i spros pa la dga' ba dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa mi shes pas gnyis la gnas pa'i sgo nas mtshan nyid gnyis kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: des ni byis pa gti mug gis rmongs pa 'di dag ni don dam pas brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa mi shes pas smra ba'i spros pa la dga' ba dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa mi shes pas gnyis la gnas pa'i sgo nas mtshan nyid gnyis kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: This teaches that these childish beings, confused by delusion, do not understand that the ultimate has the characteristic of being inexpressible, and therefore they delight in the proliferation of speech. They do not understand that it has the characteristic of nonduality, and therefore they abide in duality. This teaches that they include things that are discordant with the two characteristics.

original: de nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyang bstan pa yin no //
translated: This also teaches the side of affliction.🔽The two verses

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po ni /
translated: are:🔽Those who do not understand or misunderstand

original: ma rtogs pa'am log par rtogs pa dag / lug dang ba lang dag tu yang skye zhing //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'am log par rtogs pa dag / lug dang ba lang dag tu yang skye zhing //
translated: are born as sheep and cattle.

original: de dag shes pa'i smra ba der bor nas //
analyzed: de dag shes pa'i smra ba der bor nas //
translated: Having abandoned the speech that understands that,

original: shin tu yun ring 'khor ba 'dir 'khor 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu yun ring 'khor ba 'dir 'khor 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: they will circle in this world for a very long time.

original: des ni byis pa gti mug gis rmongs pa'i don dam pa brjod du med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma rtogs pa dang / @42b log par rtogs pa de dag ni lug dang ba lang la sogs pa ngan song gsum po dag tu yang dang yang du skye zhing chos thams cad rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba de bor nas yun ring por 'khor ba 'dir 'khor bar 'gyur ro🔽zhes bstan te /
analyzed: des ni byis pa gti mug gis rmongs pa'i don dam pa brjod du med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma rtogs pa dang / @42b log par rtogs pa de dag ni lug dang ba lang la sogs pa ngan song gsum po dag tu yang dang yang du skye zhing chos thams cad rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba de bor nas yun ring por 'khor ba 'dir 'khor bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan te /
translated: This teaches that those who do not understand or misunderstand the ultimate, which is inexpressible and has the characteristic of non-duality, due to being confused by the delusion of childish beings, will be born again and again in the three lower realms such as the realm of sheep, cows, and so forth, and will wander for a long time in this cyclic existence, having abandoned the teaching that all phenomena are mere consciousness.

original: de nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyags la gnas pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyags la gnas pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs bstan pa yin no //
translated: This also teaches the faults of those who abide in the afflictions.

original: le'u dang po'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: le'u dang po'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words and so forth of the first chapter have been explained.

original: // / de ltar brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the understanding of the characteristic of the ultimate truth by the characteristic of non-duality, which is inexpressible,

original: de ni rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Since it is the characteristic of ultimate truth, it is beyond the domain of logicians. The meaning of the words that teach the understanding of its characteristic should be explained.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,🔽the second chapter of the noble Dharma-­paryeka,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa chos 'phags kyi le'u gnyis pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa chos 'phags kyi le'u gnyis pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: beginning with “Then the bodhisattva Dharmodgata said to the Blessed One,” was spoken.

original: de la le'u gnyis pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni mdor bsdu na rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la le'u gnyis pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni mdor bsdu na rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The condensed meaning of this second chapter is, in brief, the teaching of the characteristic that is beyond the domain of logicians.

original: de yang rnam par dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste rtog ge ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa dang / dpe'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: de yang rnam par dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste rtog ge ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa dang / dpe'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa dang /
translated: Moreover, it is fourfold: the method of establishing the characteristics of logicians, the method of establishing the characteristics of the ultimate, the method of establishing the characteristics of examples,

original: de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: and the method of establishing the characteristics of the summary of their entities.

original: de la rtog ge ba'i mtshan nyid mngon bar bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa ni /🔽bcom ldan 'das sngon gyi gdugs rnams kyi shin tu snga ba zhig na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la rtog ge ba'i mtshan nyid mngon bar bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa ni / bcom ldan 'das sngon gyi gdugs rnams kyi shin tu snga ba zhig na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Among them, the method of establishing the characteristics of logicians is taught

original: ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba legs so snyam bgyid lags so zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba legs so snyam bgyid lags so zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: in the passage beginning with “Bhagavān, in the very distant past…” up to “I think it is wonderful and marvelous.”

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba nas /🔽chos 'phags de'i phyir rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis rtog ge'i spyod yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das @43a * //
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba nas / chos 'phags de'i phyir rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis rtog ge'i spyod yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das @43a * //
translated: The presentation of the method of establishing the definition of the ultimate is from “He made a request” up to “The Bhagavat said to the bodhisattva Sublime Wisdom.”

original: pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i tshar tha ma'i bar gyis bstan to //🔽dpe'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa ni /🔽chos 'phags 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i tshar tha ma'i bar gyis bstan to // dpe'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa ni / chos 'phags 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Sublime Wisdom, for that reason, by this explanation you should know that the definition of the ultimate is that which is beyond the sphere of all logicians.

original: chos 'phags de bzhin du rtog ge pa thams cad kyis kyang don dam pa rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid la brtag pa'am /
analyzed: chos 'phags de bzhin du rtog ge pa thams cad kyis kyang don dam pa rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid la brtag pa'am /
translated: The presentation of the method of establishing the example definition is from “Sublime Wisdom, it is like this” up to “Sublime Wisdom, in the same way, all logicians cannot conceive of or analyze the definition of the ultimate, which is beyond the sphere of all logicians.”

original: rjes su dpag pa'am mos par mi nus so zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'am mos par mi nus so zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: One cannot infer or believe it.🔽The method of establishing the characteristics of the collection of their entities is presented in the following verse: Then the Bhagavān uttered this verse.

original: de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa ni de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis don dam pa rtog
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa ni de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis don dam pa rtog
translated: This verse and the following verses up to “The Bhagavān said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, ‘Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha, knowing the meaning of this, has uttered this verse:

original: ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i tshig gi don de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i tshig gi don de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the words of those entities that are the collection of the characteristics that are the method of establishing the ultimate, which is completely beyond the domain of sophistry, is explained.

original: de la dang po rtog ge pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang po rtog ge pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: First, the meaning of the words of the method of establishing the characteristics of sophistry should be explained.

original: rtog ge pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong dang bram ze rtog ge pa dang ldan pa rtog ger gtogs pa'i sa rang gi spobs pa las byung ba /
analyzed: rtog ge pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong dang bram ze rtog ge pa dang ldan pa rtog ger gtogs pa'i sa rang gi spobs pa las byung ba /
translated: The so-called “method of establishing the characteristics of logicians” is the method of establishing the characteristics of those who are logicians, who are śramaṇas and brahmins endowed with logic, who are on the stage belonging to logic, who have arisen from their own eloquence,

original: so so'i skye bo sa spyod pa'i rjes su spyod pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo sa spyod pa'i rjes su spyod pa la gnas pa /
translated: who abide in the conduct of ordinary beings who experience the stages,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par thams cad mkhyen pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gang zag la sogs par mthong ba'i chos rnams kyi don dam pa yin par lta zhing don dam pa rtog ge'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa khong du ma chud pa de dag gi mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par thams cad mkhyen pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gang zag la sogs par mthong ba'i chos rnams kyi don dam pa yin par lta zhing don dam pa rtog ge'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa khong du ma chud pa de dag gi mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i
translated: who are not omniscient but have the pride of being omniscient, who see the ultimate of all phenomena as the self, sentient beings, life, persons, and so on, who have not understood the ultimate endowed with the characteristic of being utterly beyond the domain of logic.

original: tshul rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the method of establishing the characteristics of those who are like that.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: 'dir 'phags pa chos 'phags kyis bcom ldan 'das la bcom ldan 'das sngon gyi gdugs rnams kyi shin tu snga ba zhig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa chos 'phags kyis bcom ldan 'das la bcom ldan 'das sngon gyi gdugs rnams kyi shin tu snga ba zhig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: Here, the noble Dharmodgata said to the Lord, “Lord, in the very distant past of former times…” and so on.

original: rgyas par mdo nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par mdo nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail according to the sutra itself.

original: da ni de dag gi tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /🔽de la sngon gyi gdugs rnams zhes bya ba ni gang dag la bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs @43b rgyas pa'i dus dag ste /
analyzed: da ni de dag gi tshig gi don bshad par bya ste / de la sngon gyi gdugs rnams zhes bya ba ni gang dag la bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs @43b rgyas pa'i dus dag ste /
translated: Now the meaning of the words should be explained.🔽Therein, “former times” refers to the times when the Lord was fully enlightened.

original: de yang dang por byang chub la gzhol ba nas tha ma mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bar gyi dus rnams la phyir bsnyags pa'i phyir gdugs rnams zhes mang po'i tshig tu byas so //
analyzed: de yang dang por byang chub la gzhol ba nas tha ma mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bar gyi dus rnams la phyir bsnyags pa'i phyir gdugs rnams zhes mang po'i tshig tu byas so //
translated: Moreover, since he pursued the times from the first stage of devotion to enlightenment up to the final full enlightenment, the times are called “former times” in the plural.

original: shin tu snga ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni gang dag la bcom ldan 'das pas sngar sangs rgyas gzhan dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dus na'o //🔽'di na zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas phun sum tshogs pa sngar bstan pa de nas sam /
analyzed: shin tu snga ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni gang dag la bcom ldan 'das pas sngar sangs rgyas gzhan dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dus na'o // 'di na zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas phun sum tshogs pa sngar bstan pa de nas sam /
translated: Very early in the morning means at the time when the Blessed One had previously attained Buddhahood, at the time when other Buddhas had attained complete enlightenment.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di nas so //🔽de na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di nas so // de na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here means from the place where the Blessed One's excellence of abode was previously taught, or from this Sahā world system.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams grags pa can de na'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams grags pa can de na'o //
translated: There means in that world system called Famous.

original: mu stegs pa rang rang gi ston pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rtog ge ba grub pa'i mtha' dang gzhung lugs tha dad pa rang rang gi mkhan po dang dge 'dun gyi tshogs dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: mu stegs pa rang rang gi ston pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rtog ge ba grub pa'i mtha' dang gzhung lugs tha dad pa rang rang gi mkhan po dang dge 'dun gyi tshogs dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: The tīrthikas with their own teachers, etc. means the logicians with their own preceptors and assemblies of monks, with different tenets and scriptures.

original: chos rnams kyi don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bsam pa las brtsams nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi de kho na nyid gtan la dbab bar 'dod nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bsam pa las brtsams nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi de kho na nyid gtan la dbab bar 'dod nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Beginning with the consideration of the ultimate characteristics of phenomena means desiring to determine the thatness of things.

original: mchis shing zhes bya ba ni gang dag dngos po de ji lta ba bzhin gtan la dbab pa'i phyir sngar der 'khod pa dag go //
analyzed: mchis shing zhes bya ba ni gang dag dngos po de ji lta ba bzhin gtan la dbab pa'i phyir sngar der 'khod pa dag go //
translated: Those who are present are those who are already assembled there in order to determine the nature of the entity as it is.

original: 'dus nas zhes bya bas ni gang dag gis snga ma de dag mthong nas de'i 'og tu der lhags pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dus nas zhes bya bas ni gang dag gis snga ma de dag mthong nas de'i 'og tu der lhags pa rnams so //
translated: Having assembled are those who, having seen the previous ones, come there afterwards.

original: sems par bgyid ces bya ba ni bstan pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems par bgyid ces bya ba ni bstan pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: They think means they teach.

original: 'jal bar bgyid de nye bar rtog par bgyid ces bya ba ni bshad pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: 'jal bar bgyid de nye bar rtog par bgyid ces bya ba ni bshad pa'i tshig ste /
translated: They investigate means they explain.

original: de yang rang gi gzhung lugs kyi sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa dang bral bas sems par byed pa ni 'jal bar bgyid ces bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de yang rang gi gzhung lugs kyi sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa dang bral bas sems par byed pa ni 'jal bar bgyid ces bya bas bstan to //
translated: Moreover, thinking free from exaggeration and deprecation with regard to one's own system is indicated by they investigate.

original: rigs pa la brten nas sems par byed pa ni nye bar rtog par bgyid ces bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: rigs pa la brten nas sems par byed pa ni nye bar rtog par bgyid ces bya bas bstan te /
translated: Thinking based on reasoning is indicated by they investigate.

original: de ltar na de gnyis kyis ni ji ltar sems par byed pa dang / gang gis sems par byed pa bstan pa yin te go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de gnyis kyis ni ji ltar sems par byed pa dang / gang gis sems par byed pa bstan pa yin te go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, these two indicate how they think and by what means they think, respectively.

original: yongs su tshol bar bgyid kyang zhes bya ba ni de ltar bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshig de dag gnyis kyis gtan la 'bebs par byed kyang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yongs su tshol bar bgyid kyang zhes bya ba ni de ltar bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshig de dag gnyis kyis gtan la 'bebs par byed kyang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Even though they seek” should be connected with “even though they determine” in the above passage.

original: ma rtogs nas ni zhes bya ba ni gtan la ma phebs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽blo gros tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni blo gros so sor gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs nas ni zhes bya ba ni gtan la ma phebs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // blo gros tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni blo gros so sor gyur ba'o //
translated: “Not understanding” means not determining.🔽“Different opinions” means different understandings.

original: yid gnyis can zhes bya ba ni gang dag som nyi za ba dag go //
analyzed: yid gnyis can zhes bya ba ni gang dag som nyi za ba dag go //
translated: “Doubtful” means those who have doubts.

original: blo gros ngan pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽de dag las gang dag log @44a * //
analyzed: blo gros ngan pa zhes bya ba ni / de dag las gang dag log @44a * //
translated: “Evil minds” means

original: par nges pa de dag go //
analyzed: par nges pa de dag go //
translated: those who are fixed in error.

original: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis so //
analyzed: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis so //
translated: “Disputation” means in the mind.

original: 'gyed par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gis so //
analyzed: 'gyed par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gis so //
translated: “Quarrel” means in words.

original: gcig la gcig kha stobs kyis gnod pa bgyis zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gcig la gcig kha stobs kyis gnod pa bgyis zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: “Harm each other with verbal abuse” is a statement.

original: zher 'debs par bgyis /
analyzed: zher 'debs par bgyis /
translated: “They slander” means

original: gab gab kyis mnan pa bgyis /
analyzed: gab gab kyis mnan pa bgyis /
translated: they suppress with lies.

original: tshar bcad par bgyis te zhes bya ba dag ni bshad pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: tshar bcad par bgyis te zhes bya ba dag ni bshad pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The words “we have defeated” are words of explanation.

original: de yang mi rigs par smras na ngag rtsub bo 'byin pas gnod par byas pa ni /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs par smras na ngag rtsub bo 'byin pas gnod par byas pa ni /
translated: Moreover, when they speak improperly, they are harmed by the harsh words they utter.

original: zher 'debs bar bgyis zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: zher 'debs bar bgyis zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the words “we have reviled.”

original: rigs par smras na spong ba la sogs pas gnod par byas pa ni /
analyzed: rigs par smras na spong ba la sogs pas gnod par byas pa ni /
translated: When they speak properly, they are harmed by the rejection of their words and so forth.

original: gab gab kyis mnan pa bgyis zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: gab gab kyis mnan pa bgyis zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the words “we have suppressed.”

original: de gnyis ka'i dus na gnyis kas gnod pa byas pa ni /
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i dus na gnyis kas gnod pa byas pa ni /
translated: When both of these are present, they are harmed by both.

original: tshar bcad par bgyis te zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: tshar bcad par bgyis te zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the words “we have defeated.”

original: so sor mchis pa dag cig mthong nas zhes bya bas ni phyogs so sor dong ba ste /
analyzed: so sor mchis pa dag cig mthong nas zhes bya bas ni phyogs so sor dong ba ste /
translated: “We have seen them scattered in all directions” indicates that they have gone off in different directions.

original: de ltar tshig gi don de dag gis ni rtog ge pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar tshig gi don de dag gis ni rtog ge pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: By these topics, the method of establishing the characteristics of sophistry has been taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag 'di snyam bgyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar rtog ge pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa de la ltos na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag 'di snyam bgyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar rtog ge pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa de la ltos na /
translated: The passage beginning Blessed One, I think thus shows that compared to the way of establishing the characteristics of logicians,

original: kye ma de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bas shin tu bde ba che ba dang / de dag byung bas don dam pa rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid 'di lta bu bstan pa shin tu phan 'dogs pa che ba dang /
analyzed: kye ma de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bas shin tu bde ba che ba dang / de dag byung bas don dam pa rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid 'di lta bu bstan pa shin tu phan 'dogs pa che ba dang /
translated: the appearance of the Tathagatas in the world is a great source of happiness, the teaching of this ultimate truth with characteristics that transcend all logic is a great source of benefit,

original: de rtogs pa dang mngon sum du bgyi ba'i thabs dang gnas skabs mchis pas shin tu dal 'byor che ba dang / de rtogs pa dang mngon sum du bgyi ba'i rnal 'byor ba de dag mchis pas shin tu mngon par rtogs pa che ba'i slad du ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba lags so snyam bgyid lags so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rtogs pa dang mngon sum du bgyi ba'i thabs dang gnas skabs mchis pas shin tu dal 'byor che ba dang / de rtogs pa dang mngon sum du bgyi ba'i rnal 'byor ba de dag mchis pas shin tu mngon par rtogs pa che ba'i slad du ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba lags so snyam bgyid lags so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: the existence of methods and occasions for realizing and actualizing it is a great source of leisure and opportunity, and the existence of yogis who realize and actualize it is a great source of realization. Thus, I think it is a great wonder and marvel.

original: de la rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: de la rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: Realization is by the path of seeing.

original: mngon sum du bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: mngon sum du bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: Direct realization is by the path of cultivation.

original: de dag ni rtog ge pa'i mtshan nyid la ltos na /
analyzed: de dag ni rtog ge pa'i mtshan nyid la ltos na /
translated: These are the characteristics of the Muni, the Sage, the Blessed One.🔽In relation to the characteristics of sophists, the Tathāgata is a wonder and marvel because he is the greatest benefactor, providing the highest bliss and benefit, and because he is the greatest in terms of the excellence of his life and his realization.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung ba la sogs pa shin tu bde ba dang phan 'dogs pa dang / dal 'byor dang mngon par rtogs ba che ba'i phyir ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba yin no zhes zhar la bstod pa dang / tshig 'og ma'i mgo 'dren pa tsam du zad kyi dngos @44b su rtog gi pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i gnas skabs yin pas na de ni rtog ge pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung ba la sogs pa shin tu bde ba dang phan 'dogs pa dang / dal 'byor dang mngon par rtogs ba che ba'i phyir ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba yin no zhes zhar la bstod pa dang / tshig 'og ma'i mgo 'dren pa tsam du zad kyi dngos @44b su rtog gi pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i gnas skabs yin pas na de ni rtog ge pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is merely a praise in passing and an introduction to the following verse. Since this is the occasion for teaching the characteristics of sophists, it is presented as the method of establishing the characteristics of sophists.

original: de'i 'og tu don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /🔽don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi so so rang gis rig pa'i tshul du mngon
analyzed: de'i 'og tu don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi so so rang gis rig pa'i tshul du mngon
translated: After that, the meaning of the words of the presentation of the method of the realization of the characteristic of the ultimate should be explained.

original: par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / tha snyad rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas gzhan la bsnyad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / tha snyad rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas gzhan la bsnyad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The presentation of the method of the realization of the characteristic of the ultimate is the method of the realization of the Tathāgata himself, in the manner of individual knowledge, of the ultimate endowed with the characteristic that is utterly beyond all speculation, and the presentation of the method of the realization of the characteristic of the teaching of that to others by way of the presentation of conventional expressions.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Having been thus requested, the Lord said to the bodhisattva Sublime Wisdom, “Sublime Wisdom, it is so, it is so.

original: de la chos 'phags de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de la chos 'phags de de bzhin no //
translated: Sublime Wisdom, it is so.

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya bas ni sngar rtog ge'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa la ltos na /
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya bas ni sngar rtog ge'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa la ltos na /
translated: ” By saying “it is so, it is so,” he refers to the previously presented method of establishing the characteristics of sophistry.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ba dang / don dam par rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid 'di lta bu ston pa dang / de rtogs pa dang mngon sum du bya ba'i thabs dang gnas skabs yod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ba dang / don dam par rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid 'di lta bu ston pa dang / de rtogs pa dang mngon sum du bya ba'i thabs dang gnas skabs yod pa dang /
translated: The appearance of the tathāgatas in the world, the teaching of this kind of characteristic that is utterly beyond all sophistry in the ultimate, the existence of the means and the occasion for realizing and actualizing that,

original: de rtogs pa dang mngon sum du byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag yod pa ni /
analyzed: de rtogs pa dang mngon sum du byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag yod pa ni /
translated: and the existence of yogis who realize and actualize that—

original: shin tu bde ba che ba dang / shin tu phan 'dogs pa che ba dang shin tu dal 'byor che ba dang / shin tu mngon par rtogs pa che ba'i phyir ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba lags so snyam bgyid lags so zhes gsol pa de nyid nges pa yin par mnan pa'i sgo nas don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par grub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa ston to //
analyzed: shin tu bde ba che ba dang / shin tu phan 'dogs pa che ba dang shin tu dal 'byor che ba dang / shin tu mngon par rtogs pa che ba'i phyir ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba lags so snyam bgyid lags so zhes gsol pa de nyid nges pa yin par mnan pa'i sgo nas don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par grub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa ston to //
translated: The Lord then confirmed the Bodhisattva Maitreya's statement by teaching the method of establishing the characteristic of the ultimate:🔽I have fully awakened to the characteristic of the ultimate, which is completely beyond all speculation.

original: ngas ni don dam par rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa nyid dmigs kyis bstan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: ngas ni don dam par rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa nyid dmigs kyis bstan pa yang yin la /
translated: This shows the method of establishing the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ba yod @45a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ba yod @45a * //
translated: It also shows that the appearance of the Tathagatas in the world is a great opportunity,

original: pas shin tu bde ba che ba yang bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pas shin tu bde ba che ba yang bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: and that it is a great bliss.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha snyad rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas gzhan la bsnyad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba nyid dmigs kyis bstan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha snyad rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas gzhan la bsnyad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba nyid dmigs kyis bstan pa yang yin la /
translated: And after fully and completely awakening, he taught it to others by means of conventional expressions such as “again,” and so on. The characteristics of such teaching and so on are also indicated.

original: don dam par rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid 'di lta bu ston pa yod pa la sogs pa shin tu phan 'dogs pa che ba la sogs pa yang bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid 'di lta bu ston pa yod pa la sogs pa shin tu phan 'dogs pa che ba la sogs pa yang bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this teaching, which has the characteristic of being utterly beyond all speculation in the ultimate, is also a great benefit and so on.

original: bsnyad cing zhes bya ba ni bsnyad pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: bsnyad cing zhes bya ba ni bsnyad pa'i tshig go //
translated: “Taught” is the word for teaching.

original: gsal bar byas /
analyzed: gsal bar byas /
translated: “Explained”

original: rnam par phye ste zhes bya ba gnyis ni bshad pa'i tshig gis gsal bar byas pa dang / rnam par phye ba gnyis kyis na bsnyad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par phye ste zhes bya ba gnyis ni bshad pa'i tshig gis gsal bar byas pa dang / rnam par phye ba gnyis kyis na bsnyad pa yin no //
translated: “Analyzed” — these two are the words for explaining. It is taught by means of the two: explaining and analyzing.

original: de la gsal bar byas zhes bya ba ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pas legs par gdags pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gsal bar byas zhes bya ba ni chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pas legs par gdags pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, “explained” means that it is well-designated by means of the presentation of the designation of phenomena.

original: rnam par phye zhes bya ba ni chos de dag gi don rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par phye zhes bya ba ni chos de dag gi don rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: “Discerns” means in order to teach the meaning of those dharmas.

original: de ltar na tshig dang po ni bar ma gnyis kyis bshad la /
analyzed: de ltar na tshig dang po ni bar ma gnyis kyis bshad la /
translated: Thus, the first term is explained by the two middle terms,

original: bar ma gnyis ni go rims bzhin du tha ma gnyis kyis bshad par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bar ma gnyis ni go rims bzhin du tha ma gnyis kyis bshad par blta bar bya'o //
translated: and the two middle terms are explained by the last two terms, respectively.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs rnam pa lngas ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa lnga ston te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs rnam pa lngas ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa lnga ston te /
translated: Why is it so? The five kinds of reasons teach the five kinds of principles for the establishment of the ultimate, higher and higher.

original: de yang rtog ge la brten nas don dam pa rnam par dpyod pa gzhan mu stegs can rnams la gang gis don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba'i nyes pa lnga yod pa'i gnyen por go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang rtog ge la brten nas don dam pa rnam par dpyod pa gzhan mu stegs can rnams la gang gis don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba'i nyes pa lnga yod pa'i gnyen por go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, in order to refute the five faults of the tīrthikas who, relying on sophistry, analyze the ultimate and thereby do not understand the ultimate, they are applied, respectively.

original: nyes pa lnga ni kun du tshol ba'i nyes pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi nyes pa dang / mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pa dang / 'dogs pa'i nyes pa dang / rtsod pa'i nyes pa ste /🔽de dag kyang gzhan gyis bstan pa tsam gyis don dam pa khong du chud par re ba dang zhig nas tsam thob na mtshan mar 'dzin pa tsam gyis don dam pa rtogs so snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i dbang gis ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du mngon bar zhen pa dang mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad la brten nas srog la sogs pa yod par rnam par 'jog pa 'dogs pa dang /
analyzed: nyes pa lnga ni kun du tshol ba'i nyes pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi nyes pa dang / mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pa dang / 'dogs pa'i nyes pa dang / rtsod pa'i nyes pa ste /🔽de dag kyang gzhan gyis bstan pa tsam gyis don dam pa khong du chud par re ba dang zhig nas tsam thob na mtshan mar 'dzin pa tsam gyis don dam pa rtogs so snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i dbang gis ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du mngon bar zhen pa dang mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad la brten nas srog la sogs pa yod par rnam par 'jog pa 'dogs pa dang /
translated: The five faults are the fault of seeking, the fault of manifest pride, the fault of manifest clinging, the fault of imputation and the fault of dispute.🔽The five faults are the fault of seeking, the fault of manifest pride, the fault

original: phan tshun mi mthun par 'dogs pa bdag dang gzhan gyi phyogs la rjes su @45b chags pa dang khong khro bar gyur pa rtsod par 'gyur ba dang / go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: phan tshun mi mthun par 'dogs pa bdag dang gzhan gyi phyogs la rjes su @45b chags pa dang khong khro bar gyur pa rtsod par 'gyur ba dang / go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The fault of disagreement is the dispute that arises from mutual disagreement about the positions of self and others, which is due to attachment and aversion.

original: rtog ge la brten pa'i nyes pa de lngas khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba nyid don dam pa rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rtog ge la brten pa'i nyes pa de lngas khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba nyid don dam pa rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the ultimate, which is endowed with the characteristic of being utterly beyond the domain of sophistry, is not understood due to these five faults based on sophistry.

original: de la don dam pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi so so rang gis rig pa yin par ngas bshad la /🔽so so'i skye bo rnams kyis phan tshun rig par bya ba ni rtog ge'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bstan pa tsam gyis don dam pa khong du chud par re ba'i kun du tshol ba'i nyes pas don dam pa khong du
analyzed: de la don dam pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi so so rang gis rig pa yin par ngas bshad la / so so'i skye bo rnams kyis phan tshun rig par bya ba ni rtog ge'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bstan pa tsam gyis don dam pa khong du chud par re ba'i kun du tshol ba'i nyes pas don dam pa khong du
translated: In this regard, I have explained that the ultimate is the individual knowledge of the noble ones.

original: chud par mi 'gyur ba bstan te /
analyzed: chud par mi 'gyur ba bstan te /
translated: Since the mutual understanding of ordinary beings is the domain of sophistry, the phrase “it is not understood” teaches that the ultimate is not understood due to the fault of seeking the ultimate through mere instruction by others, hoping to understand the ultimate.

original: gzhan gyis bstan pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni rtog ge las byung ba'i don gcig la gcig ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni rtog ge las byung ba'i don gcig la gcig ston par byed pa ste /
translated: “Merely taught by another” means that the meaning that arises from sophistry is taught by one to another.

original: des don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bas de nyid kun du tshol ba'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: des don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bas de nyid kun du tshol ba'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: Since one does not thereby comprehend the ultimate, that is the fault of the investigation of thatness.

original: de la don dam pa zhes bya bas ni sngar dngos po de 'phags pa'i shes pa dang mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing zhes smos pa ste /
analyzed: de la don dam pa zhes bya bas ni sngar dngos po de 'phags pa'i shes pa dang mthong bas brjod du med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing zhes smos pa ste /
translated: “The ultimate” refers to the previously mentioned “having fully awakened to the inexpressible reality by means of the noble knowledge and vision.”

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bzhed do //
translated: The ultimate is the perfected nature, which is the non-existence of the dependent nature, and the non-erroneous perfected nature.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi so so rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid las tha mi dad pa de nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang rig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi so so rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid las tha mi dad pa de nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang rig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
translated: The so-called self-realization of the noble ones is the very essence of the aspect of suchness, which is the nature of correct direct intuition, and is not different from it. It is the very self-realization of correct direct intuition.

original: // so so'i skye bo rnams kyis phan tshun rig par bya ba zhes bya ba ni rtog ge las byung ba'i don gcig la gcig ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: // so so'i skye bo rnams kyis phan tshun rig par bya ba zhes bya ba ni rtog ge las byung ba'i don gcig la gcig ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The so-called mutual realization of ordinary people is the mutual teaching of one to another of the meaning that arises from reasoning.

original: rtog ge'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni kun du tshol ba'i nyes pa dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni kun du tshol ba'i nyes pa dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the domain of reasoning, it is possessed of the fault of investigation.

original: chos 'phags de'i phyir rnam grangs des zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: chos 'phags de'i phyir rnam grangs des zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Dharmodgata, for this reason, by this method, etc.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrubs pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa ston to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrubs pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa ston to //
translated: He teaches the establishment of the method of the realization of the characteristics of the ultimate, which is progressively higher.

original: de ltar kun du tshol ba'i nyes pas khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba nyid dam pa'i rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar kun du tshol ba'i nyes pas khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba nyid dam pa'i rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the ultimate is endowed with the characteristic of being utterly beyond the domain of logicians, since it is not comprehended due to the fault of thorough searching.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //🔽chos 'phags gzhan yang don dam pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul yin @46a * //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro // chos 'phags gzhan yang don dam pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul yin @46a * //
translated: The same should be applied in the appropriate way to the remaining perfections.

original: par ngas bshad la /
analyzed: par ngas bshad la /
translated: Subhūti, furthermore, I have explained that the ultimate is the domain of signlessness,🔽but the domain of logicians is the domain of signs.

original: rtog ge'i mtshan ma'i spyod yul yin te zhes bya bas ni zhi gnas tsam thob nas mtshan mar 'dzin pa tsam gyis don dam pa rtogs so snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi nyes pas don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bar bstan te /
analyzed: rtog ge'i mtshan ma'i spyod yul yin te zhes bya bas ni zhi gnas tsam thob nas mtshan mar 'dzin pa tsam gyis don dam pa rtogs so snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi nyes pas don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bar bstan te /
translated: This shows that the ultimate is not comprehended due to the fault of the conceit of thinking that one has realized the ultimate through mere meditative serenity and the mere apprehension of signs.

original: zhi gnas tsam thob nas mtshan mar 'dzin pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa tsam thob pa nas de nyid don dam pa yin par mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas tsam thob nas mtshan mar 'dzin pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa tsam thob pa nas de nyid don dam pa yin par mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: through mere apprehension of signs.

original: des kyang don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bas de nyid mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi nyes pa yin no //🔽de la mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul yin pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bas de nyid mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi nyes pa yin no // de la mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul yin pa'o //
translated: One does not understand the ultimate, and that is the fault of manifest conceit.🔽The domain of signlessness is the domain of the concentration of signlessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul yin te zhes bya ba ni de la mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul can yin pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul yin te zhes bya ba ni de la mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul can yin pa ste /
translated: The domain of signlessness is the domain of that concentration.

original: de ni byis pa'i shes pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni byis pa'i shes pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the domain of the consciousness of the foolish.

original: chos 'phags gzhan yang don dam pa ni brjod du med pa yin par ngas bshad la /
analyzed: chos 'phags gzhan yang don dam pa ni brjod du med pa yin par ngas bshad la /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, I have explained that the ultimate is inexpressible.

original: rtog ge ni brjod pa'i yul yin te zhes bya bas ni rnam par 'jog pa'i dbang gis ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pas don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bar bstan te /
analyzed: rtog ge ni brjod pa'i yul yin te zhes bya bas ni rnam par 'jog pa'i dbang gis ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pas don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bar bstan te /
