translated: The phrase conceptual thought is the domain of expression indicates that one does not understand the ultimate by the fault of adherence to the way things are expressed by the power of verbal designation.

original: rnam par 'jog pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs kyi sgo nas brjod pa rnam par 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'jog pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs kyi sgo nas brjod pa rnam par 'jog pa ste /
translated: The phrase by the power of verbal designation means that expression is established by means of the collection of names, expressions, and letters.

original: brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa des kyang don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bas de nyid mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa des kyang don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bas de nyid mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: Since one does not understand the ultimate by the adherence to expression, that is the fault of adherence to that.

original: de la brjod du med pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pas thog tu mi phebs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brjod du med pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pas thog tu mi phebs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase inexpressible means that expression does not reach it.

original: brjod pa'i spyod yul yin te zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i sgo nas don rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa'i spyod yul yin te zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i sgo nas don rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the domain of expression means that one understands the object by means of expression.

original: chos 'phags gzhan yang don dam pa ni tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa yin par ngas bshad la /🔽rtog ge ni tha snyad kyi spyod yul de zhes bya bas ni mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad la brten nas srog la sogs pa yod par rnam par 'jog pa 'dogs pa'i nyes pas don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba bstan te /🔽mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad la brten nas zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad la brten nas za ba po dang / byed pa por 'dzin pa'i sgo nas bdag dang /
analyzed: chos 'phags gzhan yang don dam pa ni tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa yin par ngas bshad la / rtog ge ni tha snyad kyi spyod yul de zhes bya bas ni mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad la brten nas srog la sogs pa yod par rnam par 'jog pa 'dogs pa'i nyes pas don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba bstan te / mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad la brten nas zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad la brten nas za ba po dang / byed pa por 'dzin pa'i sgo nas bdag dang /
translated: “Dharmôdgata, furthermore, I explain that the ultimate is the complete cessation of all conventions.🔽“The domain of conceptual thought is the domain of conventions” indicates that one does not understand the ultimate because of the fault of superimposition, which posits the existence of life and so on in dependence on the conventions of seeing and so on.

original: sems can dang / @46b srog dang / gang zag la sogs pa yod par 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can dang / @46b srog dang / gang zag la sogs pa yod par 'dogs pa ste /
translated: “In dependence on the conventions of seeing and so on” means that in dependence on the conventions of seeing, hearing, distinguishing, and cognizing, one imputes the existence of a self, a sentient being, a life, a person, and so on by way of apprehending an experiencer and an agent.

original: bdag tu 'dogs pa des kyang don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bas de nyid 'dogs pa'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dogs pa des kyang don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bas de nyid 'dogs pa'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: Since one does not understand the ultimate by means of the designation of self, that is the fault of the designation itself.

original: de la tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i tha snyad lta ga la yod kyi /
analyzed: de la tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i tha snyad lta ga la yod kyi /
translated: As for the statement, “all conventional expressions are completely severed,” how could there be any conventional expressions of speech?

original: brjod pa las gzhan pa mig brda la sogs pa'i tha snyad gang dag yin pa de dag kyang de la med pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa las gzhan pa mig brda la sogs pa'i tha snyad gang dag yin pa de dag kyang de la med pa'o //
translated: Even those conventional expressions that are not speech, such as winking, do not exist for him.

original: tha snyad kyi spyod yul yin te zhes bya ba ni brjod pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis gdags pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi spyod yul yin te zhes bya ba ni brjod pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis gdags pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate is the domain of activity of conventional expressions” means that it is the domain of activity of conventional expressions such as speech.

original: chos 'phags gzhan yang don dam pa ni rtsod pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa yin pas ngas bshad pa /
analyzed: chos 'phags gzhan yang don dam pa ni rtsod pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa yin pas ngas bshad pa /
translated: Dharmôdgata, moreover, the ultimate is completely severed from all disputes. I have explained it

original: rtog ge ni rtsod pa'i spyod yul te zhes bya bas ni phan tshun mi mthun par 'dogs pa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi phyogs la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bar gyur pa'i rtsod pa'i nyes pas don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba bstan te /🔽phan tshun mi mthun par 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis grub pa'i mtha' dang gzhung lugs mi mthun par 'dogs shing gzhi des bdag gi phyogs la rjes su chags pa dang / gzhan gyi phyogs la khong khro bar gyur pas rtsod pa ste /
analyzed: rtog ge ni rtsod pa'i spyod yul te zhes bya bas ni phan tshun mi mthun par 'dogs pa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi phyogs la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bar gyur pa'i rtsod pa'i nyes pas don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba bstan te / phan tshun mi mthun par 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis grub pa'i mtha' dang gzhung lugs mi mthun par 'dogs shing gzhi des bdag gi phyogs la rjes su chags pa dang / gzhan gyi phyogs la khong khro bar gyur pas rtsod pa ste /
translated: “Logic is the domain of debate” shows that one does not comprehend the ultimate because of the fault of debate, which is the mutual attachment to one’s own position and aversion to the position of others, which are the superimpositions of mutual disagreement.🔽“Mutual disagreement” means that due to the power of attachment to things, one superimposes disagreement with tenets and scriptural systems, and due to that basis, one is attached to one’s own position and averse to the position of others, and thus one debates.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pas phyogs la chags shing rtsod par gyur pa des kyang don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bas de nyid rtsod pa'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pas phyogs la chags shing rtsod par gyur pa des kyang don dam pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur bas de nyid rtsod pa'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: Since one does not comprehend the ultimate due to that debate, which is attachment to one’s own position and aversion to the position of others due to attachment to things, that itself is the fault of debate.

original: de la rtsod pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa'am log par rtogs pa mi mthun pa la ni rtsod pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de la rtsod pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa'am log par rtogs pa mi mthun pa la ni rtsod pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: “All disputes are completely cut off” means that disputes arise from non-understanding or wrong understanding, but

original: 'di ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir rtsod pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir rtsod pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa yin no //
translated: this is the opposite of that, and therefore all disputes are completely cut off.

original: rtsod pa'i spyod yul yin te zhes bya ba ni yul gang la rtsod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul der rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i spyod yul yin te zhes bya ba ni yul gang la rtsod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul der rtogs pa ste /
translated: “The domain of dispute” means that the domain of dispute is the domain in which disputes arise.

original: de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the domain of that.

original: chos 'phags de'i phyir rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gong nas gong du mngon
analyzed: chos 'phags de'i phyir rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gong nas gong du mngon
translated: “Subhūti, for that reason, by this explanation you should understand that the ultimate is the characteristic that completely transcends all reasoning.”

original: par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa lnga pa ston te /
analyzed: par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa lnga pa ston te /
translated: This shows the fifth presentation of the method of establishing the ultimate more and more.

original: de ltar rtsod pa'i nyes pas khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba nyid don dam pa rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid @47a * //
analyzed: de ltar rtsod pa'i nyes pas khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba nyid don dam pa rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid @47a * //
translated: Thus, one will not understand the ultimate, which is the perfect transcendence of the domain of sophistry.🔽

original: dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the ultimate is endowed with the characteristic of being utterly beyond the domain of sophistry, since it cannot be comprehended through the faults of dispute.

original: de ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the method of establishing the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: de'i 'og tu dpe'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dpe'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the words of the presentation of the method of establishing the characteristic of the example should be explained.

original: dpe'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam pa lnga sngar bstan pa de dag rtog ge pa nyes pa lnga dang ldan pa de dag gis khong du
analyzed: dpe'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam pa lnga sngar bstan pa de dag rtog ge pa nyes pa lnga dang ldan pa de dag gis khong du
translated: The so-called presentation of the characteristic of the example is as follows: The five aspects of the method of establishing the characteristic of the ultimate, which were previously explained, are not comprehended by sophists who possess the five faults.

original: chud par mi 'gyur ba'i dpe mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chud par mi 'gyur ba'i dpe mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the system of establishing the fivefold character of the unexhausted example.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: chos 'phags 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos 'phags 'di lta ste /
translated: it is said: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de la dpe lnga ni mos pa rnam pa lnga po yod pas sel bar mos pa dang / 'dod pa la mos pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la mos pa dang / tha snyad la mos pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa la mos pa rnam pa lngas brtsams nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de la dpe lnga ni mos pa rnam pa lnga po yod pas sel bar mos pa dang / 'dod pa la mos pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la mos pa dang / tha snyad la mos pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa la mos pa rnam pa lngas brtsams nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: For example,” and so on.🔽Therein, the five examples are established by way of the five kinds of interest: interest in elimination, interest in desire, interest in conception, interest in convention, and interest in self-grasping.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam pa lngas bstan pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam pa lngas bstan pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The five aspects of the system of establishing the ultimate characteristic are taught in order, respectively.

original: de la skyes bu gang zag ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yod pa sel ba'i mos pa'i dpe ston te /
analyzed: de la skyes bu gang zag ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yod pa sel ba'i mos pa'i dpe ston te /
translated: The passage beginning “As for the person, for as long as he lives” and so on teaches the example of the intention to eliminate existence.

original: yod pa sel bar mos pa zhes bya ba ni mthu chen pos mthu chung ngu yod bzhin du zil gyis mnan par mos pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa sel bar mos pa zhes bya ba ni mthu chen pos mthu chung ngu yod bzhin du zil gyis mnan par mos pa ste /
translated: The “intention to eliminate existence” is the intention that a powerful person suppresses a weaker person, even though the latter exists.

original: dper na yun ring po nas kha ba dang tsha ba'i ro la brten brten pas /
analyzed: dper na yun ring po nas kha ba dang tsha ba'i ro la brten brten pas /
translated: For example, because of long reliance on the tastes of hot and cold,

original: sbrang rtsi la sogs pa'i ro yod bzhin du mi rtogs pa'i ro chen po la mos pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi la sogs pa'i ro yod bzhin du mi rtogs pa'i ro chen po la mos pa lta bu'o //
translated: one is not aware of the taste of honey and so on, even though it exists, and one intends that the taste is not great.

original: de ltar ro chen po la brten brten pas ro chung ngu mi rtogs pa bzhin du rtog ge ba kun du tshol ba'i nyes pa dang ldan pas kyang don dam pa 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang rig pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus so
analyzed: de ltar ro chen po la brten brten pas ro chung ngu mi rtogs pa bzhin du rtog ge ba kun du tshol ba'i nyes pa dang ldan pas kyang don dam pa 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang rig pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus so
translated: Just as one is not aware of a small taste because of relying on a great taste, in the same way, because of the fault of thorough investigation by logicians, one is not able to understand the ultimate truth, which is the object of the individual intuitive knowledge of the āryas.

original: zhes sbyar ro ;
analyzed: zhes sbyar ro ;
translated: This is how it should be applied.

original: / sbrang rtsi'i ro 'am sha ka ra'i ro zhes bya ba'i ro ni so so rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽brtag pa'am / rjes su dpag pa 'am /
analyzed: / sbrang rtsi'i ro 'am sha ka ra'i ro zhes bya ba'i ro ni so so rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro // brtag pa'am / rjes su dpag pa 'am /
translated: The taste of honey or the taste of sugar cane is to be personally experienced.🔽It cannot be imagined, inferred,🔽or believed.

original: mos par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni rtog ge dang rjes su dpag pa'i stobs dang / mos pa'i stobs kyis te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: mos par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni rtog ge dang rjes su dpag pa'i stobs dang / mos pa'i stobs kyis te go rims bzhin no //
translated: It cannot be imagined, inferred, or believed by the power of reasoning, by the power of inference, or by the power of belief, respectively.

original: yun ring po nas 'dod @47b pa'i 'dod chags la mos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod pa la mos pa'i dpe ston te /
analyzed: yun ring po nas 'dod @47b pa'i 'dod chags la mos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod pa la mos pa'i dpe ston te /
translated: The example of belief in sense objects is taught by the passage beginning with “For a long time he has been devoted to the passion of desire” and so on.

original: 'dod pa la mos pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la mos pa nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang / dngos po'i 'dod pa'i yongs su gdung ba dag gis yongs su gdung ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la mos pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la mos pa nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang / dngos po'i 'dod pa'i yongs su gdung ba dag gis yongs su gdung ba ste /
translated: “Devoted to the passion of desire” means that for a long time he has been devoted to the five sense objects, and he is tormented by the torment of the passion of affliction and the torment of the passion of things.

original: des nang gi rab tu dben pa'i bde ba la rtog pa la sogs par mi nus pa bzhin du rtog ge pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi nyes pa dang ldan pas kyang don dam pa mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul la 'jug pa la sogs par mi nus
analyzed: des nang gi rab tu dben pa'i bde ba la rtog pa la sogs par mi nus pa bzhin du rtog ge pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi nyes pa dang ldan pas kyang don dam pa mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul la 'jug pa la sogs par mi nus
translated: in the same way, the logicians, who are possessed of the fault of manifest pride, are not able to enter into the domain of the ultimate, which is signless, etc.

original: so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is how it should be applied.

original: nang gi rab tu dben pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi thob pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi rab tu dben pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi thob pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: The bliss of inner solitude is the bliss of one who has attained the actual basis of meditative concentration.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba de ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag gis bskyed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba de ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag gis bskyed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is free from all signs of form, sound, smell, taste, and tactile objects because it is not produced by the five sense pleasures.

original: yun ring po nas kun du smra ba la mos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par rtog pa la mos pa'i dpe ston te /
analyzed: yun ring po nas kun du smra ba la mos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par rtog pa la mos pa'i dpe ston te /
translated: For a long time, one has been devoted to verbal proliferation, etc. This shows an example of devotion to discursive thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa la mos pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu rnam par rtog pas ngag kun nas bslang ba'i brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la mos pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu rnam par rtog pas ngag kun nas bslang ba'i brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: “Addicted to conceptual thoughts” means to be attached to expressions that are motivated by conceptual thoughts about entities and attributes.

original: des nang gi mi smra ba 'phags pa'i bde ba la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus pa bzhin du /
analyzed: des nang gi mi smra ba 'phags pa'i bde ba la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus pa bzhin du /
translated: Because of that, one is unable to investigate, etc., the happiness of the noble silence within.

original: rtog ge mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pas kyang don dam pa brjod du med pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtog ge mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pas kyang don dam pa brjod du med pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, one who is addicted to sophistry is unable to investigate, etc., the inexpressible ultimate.

original: nang gi mi smra ba 'phags pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings la mnyam bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi mi smra ba 'phags pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings la mnyam bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: “The happiness of the noble silence within” means to be equipoised in the uncontaminated realm.

original: yun ring po nas mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed ba dang rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad la mos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tha snyad la mos pa'i dpe ston te /
analyzed: yun ring po nas mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed ba dang rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad la mos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tha snyad la mos pa'i dpe ston te /
translated: “Addicted to the conventions of seeing, hearing, distinguishing, and cognizing for a long time” and so on teaches the example of addiction to conventions.

original: tha snyad la mos pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad la mos pa ste /🔽des tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa 'jig tshogs 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus pa bzhin du rtog ge ba 'dogs pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pas kyang don dam pa tha snyad thams cad yang dag par
analyzed: tha snyad la mos pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad la mos pa ste / des tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa 'jig tshogs 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus pa bzhin du rtog ge ba 'dogs pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pas kyang don dam pa tha snyad thams cad yang dag par
translated: “Belief in conventional expressions” means belief in the conventional expressions of seeing and so on for a long time.

original: chad pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽'jig tshogs 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan @48a * //
analyzed: chad pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus so zhes bya bar sbyar ro // 'jig tshogs 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan @48a * //
translated: Just as one who believes in conventional expressions cannot conceive of the cessation of the perishing aggregates, the transcendence of suffering, which is the complete cessation of all conventional expressions, in the same way, the logicians, who are guilty of the error of postulation, cannot conceive of the ultimate, the complete cessation of all conventional expressions.

original: las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
translated: The “cessation of the perishing aggregates” is the realm of the transcendence of suffering, the nirvāṇa without remainder of the aggregates.🔽“For a long time” refers to the beginningless cycle of existence.

original: yun ring po nas bdag gir yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyis rtsod pa la brtson pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag gir 'dzin pa la mos pa'i dpes ston te /
analyzed: yun ring po nas bdag gir yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyis rtsod pa la brtson pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag gir 'dzin pa la mos pa'i dpes ston te /
translated: “Zealously disputing” and so on illustrate the belief in the possession of the self, because of the long-standing grasping at “mine.”

original: bdag gir 'dzin pa la mos pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas bdag gir 'dzin pas bdag gi phyogs la rjes su chags pa dang / gzhan gyi phyogs la khong khro bas rtsod par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gir 'dzin pa la mos pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas bdag gir 'dzin pas bdag gi phyogs la rjes su chags pa dang / gzhan gyi phyogs la khong khro bas rtsod par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “Those who are devoted to the belief in mine” are those who, for a long time, have been attached to their own side through the belief in mine and are hostile to the other side.

original: des byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dag gi bdag gir 'dzin pa med pas rtsod pa med pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus ba bzhin du rtog ge pa rtsod pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pas kyang don dam pa rtsod pa med pa thams cad yang🔽dag par chad pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: des byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dag gi bdag gir 'dzin pa med pas rtsod pa med pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus ba bzhin du rtog ge pa rtsod pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pas kyang don dam pa rtsod pa med pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Just as the people of Uttarakuru, because they have no belief in mine, cannot be investigated, etc., and cannot be quarrelsome, in the same way, the logicians, because they have the fault of quarreling, cannot investigate, etc., the ultimate, which is free from all dispute.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dag gi bdag gir yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid dang rtsod pa med pa nyid ces bya ba ni de na bdag gir 'dzin pa med pas rtsod pa med de /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dag gi bdag gir yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid dang rtsod pa med pa nyid ces bya ba ni de na bdag gir 'dzin pa med pas rtsod pa med de /
translated: “The people of Uttarakuru have no belief in mine and are free from dispute” means that because they have no belief in mine, they are free from dispute.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no basis for dispute.

original: chos 'phags de bzhin du rtog ge pa thams cad kyis kyang don dam pa rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid la brtag pa'am /🔽rjes su dpag pa'am /
analyzed: chos 'phags de bzhin du rtog ge pa thams cad kyis kyang don dam pa rtog ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid la brtag pa'am / rjes su dpag pa'am /
translated: infer, or believe the ultimate, which is characterized by transcendence of all logicians.

original: mos par mi nus so zhes bya bas ni de ltar gang zag yod pa sel bar mos pa dang / 'dod pa la mos pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la mos pa dang / tha snyad la mos pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa la mos pa dag gis rang rig pa'i ro dang /
analyzed: mos par mi nus so zhes bya bas ni de ltar gang zag yod pa sel bar mos pa dang / 'dod pa la mos pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la mos pa dang / tha snyad la mos pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa la mos pa dag gis rang rig pa'i ro dang /
translated: Those who believe in the existence of the person, who believe in desire, who believe in conception, who believe in convention, and who believe in grasping as mine are unable to experience the taste of self-awareness,

original: nang gi rab tu dben pa'i bde ba dang / nang gi mi smra ba 'phags pa'i bde ba dang / tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa 'jig tshogs 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dag gi bdag gir yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: nang gi rab tu dben pa'i bde ba dang / nang gi mi smra ba 'phags pa'i bde ba dang / tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa 'jig tshogs 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dag gi bdag gir yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid dang /
translated: the inner bliss of solitude, the inner bliss of noble silence, the nirvana of the cessation of the view of the transitory collection that is the complete cessation of all conventions, and the absence of grasping as mine of the northern continent of Kuru.

original: rtsod pa med pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus pa bzhin du rtog ge pa kun du tshol ba'i nyes pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi nyes pa dang / 'dogs pa'i nyes pa dang / rtsod pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pa dag gis kyang don dam pa so so rang rig pa dang /
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa la brtag pa la sogs par mi nus pa bzhin du rtog ge pa kun du tshol ba'i nyes pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi nyes pa dang / 'dogs pa'i nyes pa dang / rtsod pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pa dag gis kyang don dam pa so so rang rig pa dang /
translated: Just as it is impossible for those who are not engaged in debate to engage in analysis and so on, it is also impossible for those who are endowed with the faults of logicians, such as searching for faults, the fault of overconfidence, the fault of superimposition, and the fault of debate, to engage in analysis and so on with regard to the ultimate, which is to be personally experienced,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul dang / brjod du med pa dang / tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa dang / rtsod pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa las brtag pa la sogs par mi nus so zhes dpes mtshon pa'i don gyi mjug bsdu ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul dang / brjod du med pa dang / tha snyad thams cad yang dag par chad pa dang / rtsod pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa las brtag pa la sogs par mi nus so zhes dpes mtshon pa'i don gyi mjug bsdu ba bstan pa ste /
translated: the domain of the absence of marks, the inexpressible, the complete cessation of all conventions, and the complete cessation of all disputes.🔽This is the explanation of the summary of the meaning illustrated by the example.

original: @48b de ni dpe'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: @48b de ni dpe'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is presented as the method of accomplishing the characteristics of the example.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid mngon bar bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /🔽de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa rtog ge pa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa sngar bstan pa'i tshig gi don de dag gi dngos
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid mngon bar bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste / de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa rtog ge pa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa sngar bstan pa'i tshig gi don de dag gi dngos
translated: Then, after that, the meaning of the words of the system of the accomplishment of the nature of their inclusion should be explained.

original: po tshigs su bcad pas mdor bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: po tshigs su bcad pas mdor bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The system of the accomplishment of the nature of the inclusion of those things that were previously taught as the meaning of the words that have the characteristic of being beyond the domain of logicians’ thought is the system of the accomplishment of the nature of the inclusion of those things in a verse.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
translated: the Bhagavān spoke this single verse beginning, “Then the Bhagavān spoke this verse at that time.”

original: de la so so rang rig mtshan med spyod yul te //
analyzed: de la so so rang rig mtshan med spyod yul te //
translated: It is the domain of self-cognizance, free of characteristics.

original: brjod du med cing tha snyad yongs bcad pa //
analyzed: brjod du med cing tha snyad yongs bcad pa //
translated: It is inexpressible, beyond all conventions.

original: rtsod dang bral ba don dam chos nyid de //
analyzed: rtsod dang bral ba don dam chos nyid de //
translated: Free of dispute, it is the ultimate reality.

original: de ni rtog ge kun las 'das mtshan nyid //
analyzed: de ni rtog ge kun las 'das mtshan nyid //
translated: It is the characteristic that transcends all speculation.

original: ces gsungs pa'i don lnga dang sngar don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam pa lnga bstan par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i don lnga dang sngar don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam pa lnga bstan par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The meaning of this passage is to be applied in order to the five topics taught above, the five ways of accomplishing the ultimate more and more.

original: don dam pa rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan par bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan par bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it teaches the ultimate to be endowed with the characteristic of being utterly beyond the domain of speculation.

original: le'u gnyis pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the meaning of the words of the second chapter and so on.

original: // / de ltar rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the topic of the ultimate truth, which is endowed with the characteristic of being utterly beyond the domain of speculation,

original: da ni tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the characteristic of ultimate truth, which is beyond being different or non-different, will be explained, beginning with the meaning of the words.🔽

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Now, in order to teach the characteristic of ultimate reality by means of the characteristic that transcends sameness and difference, the meaning of the words of the teaching, and so forth, are to be explained.🔽Therefore, in order to teach that, the third chapter, the chapter of the noble Pure Understanding, is taught, beginning with the passage:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' blo gros shin tu rnam dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa blo gros shin tu rnam dag gi le'u gsum pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' blo gros shin tu rnam dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa blo gros shin tu rnam dag gi le'u gsum pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Pure Understanding asked the Lord:

original: de la le'u gsum pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni mdor bsdu na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //🔽de yang rnam par @49a * //
analyzed: de la le'u gsum pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni mdor bsdu na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no // de yang rnam par @49a * //
translated: In this third chapter, the condensed meaning is as follows: In brief, the characteristic that transcends sameness and difference is taught.

original: dbye na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dbye na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: That is also divided into four parts.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / de la shin tu rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dag gi dpa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / de la shin tu rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dag gi dpa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the definition of the ultimate, the definition of the extreme of error, the definition of the inclusion of their entities, and the definition of the inclusion of their synonyms.

original: de la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The definition of the ultimate is taught

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gi slad du 'di skad ces bya ba nas ji tsam du bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par gsungs pa de ni ngo mtshar lags so zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gi slad du 'di skad ces bya ba nas ji tsam du bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par gsungs pa de ni ngo mtshar lags so zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: by the passage beginning “Bhagavan, the Bhagavan has said” and ending “the Bhagavan’s good teachings are amazing.”

original: de la shin tu rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la shin tu rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The definition of the extreme of error is taught

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni bdag gis sa phyogs zhig na zhes bya ba nas tshul bzhin du zhugs pa ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i tshar tha ma'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni bdag gis sa phyogs zhig na zhes bya ba nas tshul bzhin du zhugs pa ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i tshar tha ma'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: by the passage beginning “Bhagavan, this is the place where I saw” and ending “should be understood as not being engaged in proper investigation.”🔽The definition of the inclusion of their entities is taught🔽by the passage beginning “Bhagavan, the Bhagavan has said” and ending “the Bhagavan’s good teachings are amazing.”

original: de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /🔽blo gros shin tu rnam dag 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang bsnyad pa'i gsal bar byas /
analyzed: de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni / blo gros shin tu rnam dag 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang bsnyad pa'i gsal bar byas /
translated: The definition of their example is presented as follows:

original: rnam par phye /
analyzed: rnam par phye /
translated: O Suviśuddhamati, it is thus. For example, from “having fully awakened to perfect buddhahood, he also clarified what was to be stated” up to “he fully taught,” it is taught.

original: gdags pa byas /
analyzed: gdags pa byas /
translated: He fully explained,🔽he fully designated,

original: rab tu bstan to zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //🔽de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis don dam pa tha dad pa dang tha
analyzed: rab tu bstan to zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to // de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis don dam pa tha dad pa dang tha
translated: he fully revealed.

original: dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i tshig gi don de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i tshig gi don de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The definition of the collection of their entities is presented by the two verses beginning with “Then the Blessed One spoke these verses at that time,” which connect the collection of the entities of those topics with the characteristic of the ultimate that transcends being different or not different.

original: de la dang por don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang por don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: First, the meaning of the words of the presentation of the definition of the ultimate should be explained.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir don dam pa tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phra ba /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir don dam pa tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phra ba /
translated: The presentation of the definition of the ultimate is the brief mention here of the definition of the ultimate that transcends being different or not different, and the nature of the ultimate that is subtle,

original: zab pa / rtogs par dka' ba'i rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde de dang de dag tu bka' stsal pa nyid 'dir mdor smos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zab pa / rtogs par dka' ba'i rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde de dang de dag tu bka' stsal pa nyid 'dir mdor smos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: profound, and difficult to realize, as taught by the Transcendent Conqueror in this and that sūtra.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: 'dir 'phags pa blo gros shin tu rnam dag gis bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa blo gros shin tu rnam dag gis bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: the noble one, the pure intellect, asked the Transcendent Conqueror,

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gi slad du 'di skad ces @49b bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gi slad du 'di skad ces @49b bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: Transcendent Conqueror, why did you say this? and so on.

original: de la gang gi slad du zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la gang gi slad du zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Here, for the sake of which is to be connected with in order to teach the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: phra ba / zab pa /
analyzed: phra ba / zab pa /
translated: Subtle, profound,

original: rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du bye brag tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du bye brag tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: difficult to realize are taught as progressively distinguishing [the ultimate].

original: ngo mtshar lags so zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba dang / zab pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: ngo mtshar lags so zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba dang / zab pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Wonderful is a statement of praise in terms of its vastness and profundity.

original: de ni dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: de'i 'og tu de la shin tu rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de la shin tu rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the explanation of the meaning of the presentation of the characteristic of complete delusion should be given.

original: de la shin tu rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam pa tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de ni nges pa'i don du rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de la shin tu rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam pa tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de ni nges pa'i don du rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: Here, presentation of the characteristic of complete delusion means that the ultimate, which thus possesses the characteristic of transcending being the same as or different from [the seeming], is presented as having a definitive meaning.

original: sar chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul yin pas de la dang po'i don rnam par gzhag pa la mngon par zhen pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams shin tu rmongs par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag
analyzed: sar chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul yin pas de la dang po'i don rnam par gzhag pa la mngon par zhen pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams shin tu rmongs par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag
translated: Since it is the domain of the bodhisattvas who have entered the levels, the first topic is the characteristic of the extreme confusion of the bodhisattvas who abide on the level of practice through devoted interest, who are attached to the presentation of the first topic.

original: pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That is presented.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di na bdag gis sa phyogs shig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di na bdag gis sa phyogs shig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Bhagavan said, “Bhagavan, here I saw in a certain place…” and so on.

original: de yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shin tu rmongs pa gnyis kyis shin tu rmongs nas don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pas sems te /
analyzed: de yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shin tu rmongs pa gnyis kyis shin tu rmongs nas don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pas sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas who abide on the level of practice through devoted interest are extremely confused by two kinds of confusion and think about the ultimate in an incorrect manner.

original: gdags pa la shin tu rmongs pa dang / rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pas so //
analyzed: gdags pa la shin tu rmongs pa dang / rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pas so //
translated: They are confused about designation and confused about reasoning.

original: de la gdags pa la shin tu rmongs pas don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pa pas sems pa ni /🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' kha cig 'di skad ces bya ba nas don dam pa mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de la gdags pa la shin tu rmongs pas don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pa pas sems pa ni / de la byang chub sems dpa' kha cig 'di skad ces bya ba nas don dam pa mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: As to that, the one who is very confused about the designation, and who thinks about the ultimate in a way that is not correct,🔽as to that, some bodhisattvas say this, up to: because it is not the direct realization of the ultimate.🔽🔽

original: rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pas don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pas sems pa ni /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pas don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pas sems pa ni / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The first is taught by the passage beginning “Here, some bodhisattvas, due to their extreme confusion about designations…” and ending “…because they do not directly perceive the ultimate.”

original: blo gros shin tu rnam dag ces bya ba nas tshul bzhin du bzhugs pa ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i tshar tha ma'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: blo gros shin tu rnam dag ces bya ba nas tshul bzhin du bzhugs pa ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i tshar tha ma'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: The second is taught by the passage beginning “Due to their extreme confusion about reasoning…” and ending “…they should be known as not abiding properly.”

original: de la gdags pa la shin tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la gdags pa la shin tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Here, “extreme confusion about designations” means that they are outside the sūtras of definitive meaning.

original: de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde @50a * //
analyzed: de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde @50a * //
translated: The Bhagavān says that they are outside the sūtras of definitive meaning.

original: gdags pa mdzad pa'i rjes su 'brang pa yin pas nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde gdags pa mdzad pa la shin tu rmongs shing nga las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don dam pa la tshul bzhin du ma yin par sems par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro
analyzed: gdags pa mdzad pa'i rjes su 'brang pa yin pas nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde gdags pa mdzad pa la shin tu rmongs shing nga las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don dam pa la tshul bzhin du ma yin par sems par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro
translated: because they follow the one who composed the Scripture on the Designation of the Factors of Existence, they are utterly confused about the one who composed the Scripture of Ultimate Meaning, and they think improperly about the ultimate, which is outside of me.

original: // de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: // de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma lags so zhes mchi zhes bya ba dang / tha dad pa lags so zhes mchi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma lags so zhes mchi zhes bya ba dang / tha dad pa lags so zhes mchi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “They say, ‘The characteristic of the conditioned and the characteristic of the ultimate are not different,’ and ‘They are different,’ and so on.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the conditioned is the arising, enduring, and ceasing of the dependent nature, which is the aggregates and so on.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi chos bdag med pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi chos bdag med pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the ultimate is the realitylessness of phenomena, which is the perfected nature.

original: de gnyis ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde las 'du byed rnams kyi bdag med pa tsam dang / ngo bo med pa tsam nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid yin par gsungs na /
analyzed: de gnyis ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde las 'du byed rnams kyi bdag med pa tsam dang / ngo bo med pa tsam nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid yin par gsungs na /
translated: In the sutras of definitive meaning, the ultimate is said to be the characteristic that transcends being either the same as or different from the mere selflessness of compounded phenomena and the mere absence of essence of compounded phenomena.

original: de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde las kha cig tu 'du byed ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde las kha cig tu 'du byed ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: Since these are outside the sutras of definitive meaning, in some of the sutras of provisional meaning, the ultimate is said to be the dependent nature.

original: don dam pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: don dam pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: Since the ultimate is the consummate nature,

original: ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa skad kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa skad kyang bka' stsal /
translated: it is said to be different from the dependent nature in terms of the presentation of the natures.

original: kha cig tu gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su dag pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rang bzhin gcig pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa ma yin pa skad kyang bka' stsal pa'i mdo de nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba sgra ji
analyzed: kha cig tu gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su dag pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rang bzhin gcig pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa ma yin pa skad kyang bka' stsal pa'i mdo de nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba sgra ji
translated: In some places, the thoroughly pure dependent nature is the perfected nature, and they are not different in terms of their single nature.

original: bzhin du 'dzin pas kha cig ni tha dad pa ma yin zhes zer te /
analyzed: bzhin du 'dzin pas kha cig ni tha dad pa ma yin zhes zer te /
translated: Some people, who take the literal meaning of that sutra, say that they are not different.

original: de gnyis ka yang gdags pa la gcig tu rmongs pa don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pas sems pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang gdags pa la gcig tu rmongs pa don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pas sems pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Both of them are confused about the single designation, and they think about the ultimate in an improper way. This is the meaning.

original: the tshom du gyur pa'i blo gros can yid gnyis su gyur pa zhes bya ba dag kyang de nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: the tshom du gyur pa'i blo gros can yid gnyis su gyur pa zhes bya ba dag kyang de nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin no //
translated: Those who have a doubting mind, who are of two minds, are also included in that category.

original: gang ni med par mchi ba lags gang ni sho be mchi ba lags zhes bya ba ni 'dir nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde bsam pa'i skabs su gnyis ka yang brdzun pa yin par bya'o //
analyzed: gang ni med par mchi ba lags gang ni sho be mchi ba lags zhes bya ba ni 'dir nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde bsam pa'i skabs su gnyis ka yang brdzun pa yin par bya'o //
translated: What is non-existent? What is about to be destroyed? Here, in the context of the sutra of definitive meaning, both should be taken as false.

original: gang ni tshul bzhin du zhugs pa lags /
analyzed: gang ni tshul bzhin du zhugs pa lags /
translated: Who are those who have entered correctly?🔽Who are those who have entered incorrectly?

original: gang ni tshul bzhin ma lags par zhugs pa lags zhes bya ba yang gnyi ga nges pa'i don la tshul bzhin ma yin par zhugs pa yin @50b par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang ni tshul bzhin ma lags par zhugs pa lags zhes bya ba yang gnyi ga nges pa'i don la tshul bzhin ma yin par zhugs pa yin @50b par sbyar ro //
translated: Both of them have entered incorrectly in regard to the definitive meaning.🔽I think thus, etc.

original: bdag 'di snyam bgyid de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de dag nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde las phyi rol du gyur pa dngos su ston to //
analyzed: bdag 'di snyam bgyid de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de dag nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde las phyi rol du gyur pa dngos su ston to //
translated: directly shows that they are outside the sūtras of definitive meaning.

original: byis pa rmongs pa mi gsal ba /
analyzed: byis pa rmongs pa mi gsal ba /
translated: Fools, confused, unclear,

original: mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs so //
translated: unskilled, are synonyms.🔽Realization and actualization are as explained above.

original: rtogs pa dang mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin te de dag ni gdags pa las shin tu rmongs pa'i tshig gi don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin te de dag ni gdags pa las shin tu rmongs pa'i tshig gi don bshad pa yin no //
translated: These are the explanations of the meanings of the words of the very confused in the Lakṣaṇakṣaṇikā.

original: de la rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pa la zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs dang dpe'i yan lag mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pa la zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs dang dpe'i yan lag mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Among them, being very confused about reasoning is due to not understanding the branches of reasoning and examples.

original: gtan tshigs kyi yan lag rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa dang / dpe'i yan lag chos mthun pa'i dpe dang / chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dag mi shes pas na gal te tha dad pa ma yin par gyur na ni skyon 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi yan lag rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa dang / dpe'i yan lag chos mthun pa'i dpe dang / chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dag mi shes pas na gal te tha dad pa ma yin par gyur na ni skyon 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were not different, this error would occur.🔽If they were different, this error would occur.

original: gal te tha dad pa yin par gyur na ni skyon 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pas don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pas sems pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa yin par gyur na ni skyon 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pas don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pas sems pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since they are completely confused about this reasoning, they think about the ultimate in an improper manner.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: de'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Therefore, why is that?

original: blo gros shin tu rnam dag ces bya ba la sogs pas tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i gtan tshigs ston te /
analyzed: blo gros shin tu rnam dag ces bya ba la sogs pas tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i gtan tshigs ston te /
translated: Because of the statement, “due to the complete purity of mind and wisdom,” he teaches a reason that transcends being the same or different.

original: bsgrim mi dgos par shes pa dang / bsgrims kyang mi shes pa ni gtan tshigs nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba med pas gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: bsgrim mi dgos par shes pa dang / bsgrims kyang mi shes pa ni gtan tshigs nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba med pas gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: And it is a reason because it is not the case that it is not a reason due to the fault of being unestablished.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sar chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa rnams kyis ni sngon goms pa'i dbang gis bsgrim mi dgos pa don 'di shes pas de dag la yang gtan tshigs 'di nyes par thal bar 'gyur pa med pas gtan tshigs yongs su dag🔽pa yin la /
analyzed: sar chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa rnams kyis ni sngon goms pa'i dbang gis bsgrim mi dgos pa don 'di shes pas de dag la yang gtan tshigs 'di nyes par thal bar 'gyur pa med pas gtan tshigs yongs su dag pa yin la /
translated: Those bodhisattvas who have entered the levels and are skilled in the characteristics of the ultimate understand this meaning without needing to apply themselves due to the power of their previous habituation.🔽Therefore, since this reason is not a reason due to the fault of being unestablished for them, it is a completely pure reason.🔽Those abiding on the level of earnest aspiration who are not skilled in the characteristics of the ultimate do not understand this meaning even if they apply themselves because they have not previously habituated themselves to it.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la mi mkhas pa rnams kyis ni sngon ma goms pa'i phyir bsgrims kyang don 'di mi shes te mi shes pa ni de dag nyid kyi nyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la mi mkhas pa rnams kyis ni sngon ma goms pa'i phyir bsgrims kyang don 'di mi shes te mi shes pa ni de dag nyid kyi nyes pa yin gyi /
translated: Their lack of understanding is their own fault.

original: gtan tshigs kyi nyes pa ma yin pas de dag la yang /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi nyes pa ma yin pas de dag la yang /
translated: It is not the fault of the reason.

original: yang gtan tshigs kyi nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba med pas gtan tshigs yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang gtan tshigs kyi nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba med pas gtan tshigs yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Moreover, since there is no fault of the reason, the reason is completely pure. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar gtan tshigs yongs su dag pa 'dis brtags na tha dad pa yin par gyur @51a * //
analyzed: de ltar gtan tshigs yongs su dag pa 'dis brtags na tha dad pa yin par gyur @51a * //
translated: Thus, when examined by this completely pure reason, if they were different,

original: na yang skyon du 'gyur la /
analyzed: na yang skyon du 'gyur la /
translated: there would be a fault.

original: tha dad pa ma yin par gyur na yang skyon du 'gyur bar snang ba lags na /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin par gyur na yang skyon du 'gyur bar snang ba lags na /
translated: If they were not different, there would also be a fault.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa de dag gis tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i skyon ma rtogs na mtha' gnyis su so sor smra ba ni rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pas don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sems pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa de dag gis tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i skyon ma rtogs na mtha' gnyis su so sor smra ba ni rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pas don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sems pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If those abiding on the level of practice through belief do not understand the faults of difference and non-difference, then those who speak of the two extremes individually are extremely confused about reasoning and are improperly reflecting on the ultimate. This is how it should be applied.

original: de la gal te 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin par gyur na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshar gyis ni tha dad pa ma yin par gyur na bden pa mthong ba rnams 'du byed kyi mtshan ma dang ma bral bar gyur pa la sogs pa smras
analyzed: de la gal te 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin par gyur na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshar gyis ni tha dad pa ma yin par gyur na bden pa mthong ba rnams 'du byed kyi mtshan ma dang ma bral bar gyur pa la sogs pa smras
translated: If the characteristic of the compounded and the characteristic of the ultimate were not different, then, etc.

original: par thal bar 'gyur ba ston to //
analyzed: par thal bar 'gyur ba ston to //
translated: This verse shows that if they were not different, it would follow that those who see the truth would not be free from the signs of the compounded, and so on.

original: da ni tshig gi don bshad par bya sta /
analyzed: da ni tshig gi don bshad par bya sta /
translated: Now the meaning of the words will be explained.

original: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad bden pa mthong ba yin par yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de dag gis mtshan ma dang bral bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad bden pa mthong ba yin par yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de dag gis mtshan ma dang bral bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, all foolish ordinary beings would be those who see the truth, because they would realize the freedom from signs.

original: so so'i skye bo kho nar 'gyur bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba ma brtsams pa kho nar ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo kho nar 'gyur bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba ma brtsams pa kho nar ro //
translated: They would be only ordinary beings, because they would not begin practice in order to realize the truth.

original: grub pa dang bde ba zhes bya ba lam ma thob pa thob pa ni grub pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba zhes bya ba lam ma thob pa thob pa ni grub pa'o //
translated: “Accomplishment and happiness” means that one who has not obtained the path obtains it, which is accomplishment.

original: thob pa chud mi za ba ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: thob pa chud mi za ba ni bde ba'o //
translated: Non-wastage of attainment is happiness.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma dang ma bral bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan mthong bas gzhan dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma dang ma bral bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan mthong bas gzhan dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They will not be free from the sign of formative influence means that by seeing one thing, one is not free from another.

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las rnam par ma grol bar yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma dang ma bral ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma las rnam par mi grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las rnam par ma grol bar yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma dang ma bral ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma las rnam par mi grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They will not be free from the bondage of signs means that they will not be free from the sign of form etc. because they are not free from the sign of formative influence.

original: gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las kyang rnam par ma grol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma ma spangs pas de yang ma spangs par rjes su dpag pa'i phyir yin gyi /🔽'di ni spong ba ni de la spong ba la rag las pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las kyang rnam par ma grol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma ma spangs pas de yang ma spangs par rjes su dpag pa'i phyir yin gyi / 'di ni spong ba ni de la spong ba la rag las pa ma yin te /
translated: They will not be free from the bondage of negative conditioning means that because the sign is not relinquished, it is inferred that this is not relinquished.

original: de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, the relinquishment of the latter is not dependent on the relinquishment of the former because it is the opposite of that.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pa snga ma dag go //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pa snga ma dag go //
translated: Those refers to those who are confused about the reasoning on the spiritual level of action through faith.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The characteristic of the formative forces is understood as the characteristic of defilement, because it is not real.

original: kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said to be endowed with the characteristic of imagination.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa yin na /
translated: It would not be a universal characteristic, because it is not a universal.

original: dpe gzugs dri la sogs pa gzhan gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin par grags pa med pa lta bur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dpe gzugs dri la sogs pa gzhan gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin par grags pa med pa lta bur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it were different, it would be like the universal characteristics of form, sound, etc. which are not acknowledged as being different.🔽It is not a particular characteristic, because it is not a particular.

original: bye brag med par zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid @51b kyi 'du byed thams cad la spyir khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag med par zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid @51b kyi 'du byed thams cad la spyir khyab pa'o //
translated: It is not a universal characteristic, because it is not a universal.

original: gong du don dam pa yongs su tshol bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma rtogs nas de'i gong du de bzhin nyid yongs su tshol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gong du don dam pa yongs su tshol bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma rtogs nas de'i gong du de bzhin nyid yongs su tshol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be investigated as the ultimate, because it would not be investigated as thusness after the investigation of the sign.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi bdag med pa tsam dang / ngo bo nyid med pa tsam nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid yin par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa brgyud na zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi bdag med pa tsam dang / ngo bo nyid med pa tsam nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid yin par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa brgyud na zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The mere selflessness of compounded phenomena and the mere essencelessness of compounded phenomena would not be the characteristics of the ultimate.🔽The characteristic of the afflictions and the characteristic of purification would be established as different characteristics at the same time.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyang dus gcig tu mtshan nyid tha dad du grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni gang la mtshan ma las de bzhin nyid tha mi dad pa de la ni dus gcig tu 'grub par🔽brtag mi nus so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyang dus gcig tu mtshan nyid tha dad du grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni gang la mtshan ma las de bzhin nyid tha mi dad pa de la ni dus gcig tu 'grub par brtag mi nus so //
translated: If the suchness that is not different from the sign were in that, it could not be ascertained as established at the same time.

original: yang na mtshan ma rnam par gzhig pa de bzhin nyid yin na yang mtshan ma'i dus na ni de bzhin nyid med la de bzhin nyid kyi dus na yang mtshan ma med pa kho na yin pas dus gcig tu 'grub tu mi rung ba de dus gcig tu
analyzed: yang na mtshan ma rnam par gzhig pa de bzhin nyid yin na yang mtshan ma'i dus na ni de bzhin nyid med la de bzhin nyid kyi dus na yang mtshan ma med pa kho na yin pas dus gcig tu 'grub tu mi rung ba de dus gcig tu
translated: Moreover, if suchness is the destruction of signs, then at the time of the sign, suchness would not exist, and at the time of suchness, there would be no sign. Therefore, it would not be suitable for them to be established at the same time.

original: 'grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The error of their establishment at the same time would ensue.

original: tshul bzhin du zhugs pa ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gdags pa la shin tu rmongs pa dang / rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pas nges pa'i don la tshul bzhin du zhugs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du zhugs pa ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gdags pa la shin tu rmongs pa dang / rigs pa la shin tu rmongs pas nges pa'i don la tshul bzhin du zhugs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This means that they have not properly engaged the definitive meaning because they are confused about designations and confused about reasoning.

original: de ni de la shin tu rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de la shin tu rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the characteristics of their confusion.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the words of the presentation of their examples should be explained.

original: de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa sngar bstan pa'i gtan tshigs de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa sngar bstan pa'i gtan tshigs de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The presentation of the characteristics of their examples refers to the presentation of the characteristics of the examples of those reasons that were previously taught to have the characteristic of transcending the ultimate, which is beyond being the same or different.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that, it says:

original: blo gros shin tu rnam par dag pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: blo gros shin tu rnam par dag pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The characteristic of the example is as follows.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: For example, etc.

original: de la dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni gdul ba'i bsam pa dang / mos pa tha dad pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'jig rten la grags pa'i gzugs dang sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang /
analyzed: de la dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni gdul ba'i bsam pa dang / mos pa tha dad pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'jig rten la grags pa'i gzugs dang sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang /
translated: Therein, the characteristic of the example is as follows. In order to control the various inclinations and interests of those to be trained, the Buddha has taught that the examples of form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects, which are well known in the world, are characterized by identity and difference, and also by the absence of identity and difference.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rnams rmongs so //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rnams rmongs so //
translated: The ignorant, however, are confused about this.

original: de la dung dang gser ni gzugs so //
analyzed: de la dung dang gser ni gzugs so //
translated: Therein, the conch and gold are examples of form.

original: pi wang gi sgra ni sgra'o //🔽aa ka ru nag po'i dri ni dri'o //
analyzed: pi wang gi sgra ni sgra'o // aa ka ru nag po'i dri ni dri'o //
translated: The sound of the lute is an example of sound.🔽The smell of black agarwood is an example of smell.

original: @52a * // na le sham gyi tsha ba dang aardura'i mngar ba ni ro'o //
analyzed: @52a * // na le sham gyi tsha ba dang aardura'i mngar ba ni ro'o //
translated: The hot taste of ginger and the sweet taste of sugar are examples of taste.

original: shing bal gyi 'dab ma'i 'jam pa ni reg bya'o //
analyzed: shing bal gyi 'dab ma'i 'jam pa ni reg bya'o //
translated: The softness of cotton is an example of touch.

original: mar la sogs pa lhag ma rnams ni chos te /
analyzed: mar la sogs pa lhag ma rnams ni chos te /
translated: The remaining examples such as butter are examples of mental objects.

original: chos de dag kyang /
analyzed: chos de dag kyang /
translated: These phenomena are

original: gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: form, mind, mental factors, and defiled and purified phenomena, as appropriate.

original: de dag gi tshig gi don ni dung gi 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dkar po nyid dang tha dad pa yang ma yin tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi tshig gi don ni dung gi 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dkar po nyid dang tha dad pa yang ma yin tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of their words is that because the characteristics of the collection of the elements and the derivative elements of a conch are not different from whiteness, nor are they not different,

original: de'i phyir dung gi rdzas ni 'byung ba las gyur pa kha dog tsam du zad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dung gi rdzas ni 'byung ba las gyur pa kha dog tsam du zad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: therefore the substance of a conch is not merely the color of the elements.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the rest as appropriate.

original: blo gros shin tu rnam dag de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpes mtshon pa'i don ni gtan tshigs sngar bstan pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: blo gros shin tu rnam dag de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpes mtshon pa'i don ni gtan tshigs sngar bstan pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning illustrated by the example of pure intelligence and so on is to be applied according to the previously stated reasons.

original: blo gros shin tu rnam dag ngas ni don dam par zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ngon dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa sngar bstan pa de nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: blo gros shin tu rnam dag ngas ni don dam par zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ngon dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa sngar bstan pa de nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: I, Suviśuddhamati, have taught the characteristics of the ultimate, etc.🔽subtle,

original: phra ba / mchog tu phra ba /
analyzed: phra ba / mchog tu phra ba /
translated: supremely subtle,🔽profound,
