original: zab pa / mchog tu zab pa /
analyzed: zab pa / mchog tu zab pa /
translated: supremely profound,

original: rtogs par dka' ba /
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba /
translated: difficult to realize,

original: mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: supremely difficult to realize.

original: phra ba dang / zab pa dang / rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum ni phra ba nyid bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir zab pa zhes bya ba gsungs la /
analyzed: phra ba dang / zab pa dang / rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum ni phra ba nyid bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir zab pa zhes bya ba gsungs la /
translated: The three terms “subtle,” “profound,” and “difficult to realize” are stated because subtlety is to be specified.🔽Profound is stated because profundity is to be specified.

original: zab pa nyid bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zab pa nyid bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: Difficult to realize is stated because difficulty to realize is to be specified.

original: de dag ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood as shared in common with śrāvakas and so on.

original: mchog tu phra ba dang / mchog tu zab pa dang / mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum yang snga ma bzhin du gcig las gcig tu bye brag tu bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mchog tu phra ba dang / mchog tu zab pa dang / mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum yang snga ma bzhin du gcig las gcig tu bye brag tu bya ba yin te /
translated: The three terms, “supreme subtlety,” “supreme profundity,” and “supreme difficulty of realization” are to be distinguished from each other in the same way as the previous three terms.

original: de dag ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as not being common to the śrāvakas, etc.

original: bsnyad cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsnyad cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the terms “is taught” and so on is to be applied as explained above.

original: de dag ni dpes mtshon pa'i don gyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir zhar la bzlas pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni dpes mtshon pa'i don gyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir zhar la bzlas pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: These are merely repetitions in passing, for the purpose of summarizing the meaning illustrated by the similes.

original: gtso cher dper bstan pa'i gnas skabs yin pas na de ni de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gtso cher dper bstan pa'i gnas skabs yin pas na de ni de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Since this is the main section on the teaching of the similes, this is the presentation of the characteristics of the similes.

original: de'i 'og tu da dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu da dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the terms, etc., should be explained in the presentation of the characteristic of the collection of their entities.

original: de dag gi dngos po bsdu @52b ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa sngar bstan pa tshig gi don de dag gi dngos po tshigs su bcad pas mdor bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid rnam bar gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po bsdu @52b ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa sngar bstan pa tshig gi don de dag gi dngos po tshigs su bcad pas mdor bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid rnam bar gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The reality of those topics is the characteristic of the summary of those topics in verse.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,🔽the Bhagavān spoke these verses at that time, and so on.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs te /🔽de la / 'du byed khams dang don dam mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs te / de la / 'du byed khams dang don dam mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The two verses that were spoken are:

original: gcig dang tha dad bral ba'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: gcig dang tha dad bral ba'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: The characteristic of the ultimate is the characteristic of the freedom from sameness and difference🔽With regard to the compounded element.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i rtsa ba gong ma gnyis kyis ni don dam pa'i tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa sngar bstan pa'i dngos po bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i rtsa ba gong ma gnyis kyis ni don dam pa'i tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa sngar bstan pa'i dngos po bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: The first two lines of the first verse indicate the inclusion of the entities that were previously taught in the presentation of the characteristic of possessing the characteristic that has the characteristic of transcending ultimate difference and non-difference.

original: des rnam par byang ba'i phyogs thams cad kyi dngos po bsdu ba yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des rnam par byang ba'i phyogs thams cad kyi dngos po bsdu ba yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: By that, the inclusion of the entities of the entire side of purification is also taught.

original: gcig dang tha dad nyid du gang rtog pa //
analyzed: gcig dang tha dad nyid du gang rtog pa //
translated: Those who conceive of sameness and difference

original: de dag tshul bzhin ma yin zhugs pa yin //
analyzed: de dag tshul bzhin ma yin zhugs pa yin //
translated: are engaged in what is incorrect.

original: zhes bya ba rtsa ba 'og ma 'di gnyis kyis ni shin tu rmongs pa gnyis kyis shin tu rmongs nas don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pas sems pa'i shin tu rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i dngos po bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rtsa ba 'og ma 'di gnyis kyis ni shin tu rmongs pa gnyis kyis shin tu rmongs nas don dam pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pas sems pa'i shin tu rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i dngos po bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: These two lower lines indicate the inclusion of the entities that were previously taught in the presentation of the characteristic of the misconception that is thoroughly confused about the ultimate due to incorrect thought.

original: des kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs thams cad kyi dngos po bsdu ba yang bstan pa yin no //🔽skye bo'i sa la lhag mthong dang // zhi gnas goms par byas pas ni //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i rtsa ba gong ma 'di gnyis kyis ni de ltar bsdu /
analyzed: des kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs thams cad kyi dngos po bsdu ba yang bstan pa yin no // skye bo'i sa la lhag mthong dang // zhi gnas goms par byas pas ni // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i rtsa ba gong ma 'di gnyis kyis ni de ltar bsdu /
translated: This also shows the inclusion of the things of the entire side of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la gnas pa de dag gi gnyen po bsgom pa'i dngos po bsdu ba bstan pa'o //🔽gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba dang // mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las grol 'gyur //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la gnas pa de dag gi gnyen po bsgom pa'i dngos po bsdu ba bstan pa'o // gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba dang // mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las grol 'gyur //
translated: The two root verses beginning with “On the stage of ordinary people, through cultivating insight and serenity” show the inclusion of the things of the cultivation of the counteragent to those who abide in the side of affliction.

original: zhes bya ba'i rtsa ba 'og ma 'di gnyis kyis ni de ltar gnyen po bsgom pa de'i phan yon gyi dngos po bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rtsa ba 'og ma 'di gnyis kyis ni de ltar gnyen po bsgom pa de'i phan yon gyi dngos po bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: The two root verses beginning with “Liberated from the bondage of the bad and the bondage of signs” show the inclusion of the things of the benefit of that cultivation of the counteragent.

original: de ni de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the characteristic of the inclusion of those things.

original: le'u gsum pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: le'u gsum pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the third chapter and so forth have been explained.

original: // / de ltar tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don dam pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba @53a * //
analyzed: // / de ltar tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don dam pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba @53a * //
translated: Thus, having taught the characteristic of the ultimate through the characteristic that transcends difference and non-difference,

original: bstan nas / da ni thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bstan nas / da ni thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: now, in order to teach the characteristic of the ultimate truth through the characteristic of being of one taste everywhere, the meaning of the words and so on are to be explained.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa rab 'byor gyi le'u bzhi pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa rab 'byor gyi le'u bzhi pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: this chapter of Subhūti, the fourth, was spoken, beginning with Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti... and so on.

original: de la le'u bzhi pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni mdor bsdu na thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la le'u bzhi pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni mdor bsdu na thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the condensed meaning of this fourth chapter is, in brief, the teaching on the characteristic of being of one taste everywhere.

original: de yang rnam par dbye na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam par dbye na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: That is also classified into four parts:

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dgag dngos po bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dgag dngos po bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the definition of manifest pride, the definition of the antidote to manifest pride, the definition of the example of those, and the definition of the inclusion of the negatee.

original: de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni ;
analyzed: de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni ;
translated: The definition of manifest pride is

original: rab 'byor khyod kyis sems can gyi khams na gang dag mngon pa'i nga rgyal can zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod kyis sems can gyi khams na gang dag mngon pa'i nga rgyal can zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, in the realm of sentient beings, those who are called proud, up to

original: 'di nas slad rol pa'i mu stegs can rnams kyis smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'di nas slad rol pa'i mu stegs can rnams kyis smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: what need is there to speak of the non-Buddhist tīrthikas?

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The definition of the antidote to manifest pride is

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhuti, it is so.

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i tshar thar ma'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba nas rab 'byor rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i tshar thar ma'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: It is just so, from Subhuti, by this one of many explanations you should know that the ultimate is the characteristic of all-pervading sameness.

original: de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de dag gi dpe'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The characteristic of their example is presented:

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba nas thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba nas thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: Subhuti, it is like this, from space up to the characteristic of all-pervading sameness should be seen.

original: de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The characteristic of their inclusion is presented:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis don dam pa thams cad ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i tshig gi don de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis don dam pa thams cad ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i tshig gi don de dag gi dngos po bsdu ba
translated: This one verse summarizes the topics of the meaning of the words that possess the characteristic of the single taste of all ultimate reality.

original: bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bstan pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to the teaching.

original: de la dang por mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi @53b mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /🔽mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag kha cig chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa khong du ma chud par phung po la
analyzed: de la dang por mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi @53b mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag kha cig chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa khong du ma chud par phung po la
translated: First, the meaning of the words and so on should be explained in the context of the presentation of the characteristic of manifest pride.

original: sogs pa dngos po re re'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa rtogs pa tsam gyi sgo nas /
analyzed: sogs pa dngos po re re'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa rtogs pa tsam gyi sgo nas /
translated: The presentation of the characteristic of manifest pride is as follows: Some individuals, without comprehending the suchness of phenomena, the ultimate, which possesses the characteristic of the single taste of all forms of selflessness of phenomena, merely realize the individual characteristics of each thing, such as the aggregates,🔽and so on.

original: don dam pa rtogs so snyam du sems shing rang gi shes pa gzhan la brda sprod par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa rtogs so snyam du sems shing rang gi shes pa gzhan la brda sprod par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: One thinks, I have realized the ultimate, and one communicates one's understanding to others.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, with reference to that, it is said:

original: rab 'byor khyod kyis sems can gyi khams na gang dag mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du zin cing shes pa brda sprod par byed pa'i sems can ni ji tsam zhig yod par shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod kyis sems can gyi khams na gang dag mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du zin cing shes pa brda sprod par byed pa'i sems can ni ji tsam zhig yod par shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Subhuti, how many beings do you think there are in the world-system of three-thousand great thousand worlds who are not devoid of the thought of the perfection of wisdom?

original: de la 'dir mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste gzung ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ; 'dzin pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: de la 'dir mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste gzung ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ; 'dzin pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Here, the characteristic of pride is established in three ways: pride of grasping, pride of the grasper, and pride of the differentiation of characteristics.

original: de la gzung ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni phung po la sogs pa gzung ba'i chos rnams sna tshogs dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ston pas /
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni phung po la sogs pa gzung ba'i chos rnams sna tshogs dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ston pas /
translated: The pride of the realization of the object is the pride of the realization of the object of the various objective phenomena such as the aggregates, etc.

original: don dam pa rtogs so snyam du sems shing rang gi shes pa gzhan la brda sprod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa rtogs so snyam du sems shing rang gi shes pa gzhan la brda sprod par byed pa'o //
translated: One thinks, “I have realized the ultimate,” and one makes one’s knowledge known to others.🔽The pride of the realization of the subject is the pride of the realization of the ultimate, the selflessness of phenomena, in the suchness of one phenomenon, such as the aggregates, etc.

original: 'dzin pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni phung po la sogs pa chos gcig gi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med par rab tu rtogs nas yang de las gzhan pa'i chos so so la de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yongs su tshol🔽bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni phung po la sogs pa chos gcig gi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med par rab tu rtogs nas yang de las gzhan pa'i chos so so la de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yongs su tshol bar byed pa'o //
translated: Then, one seeks the suchness, the ultimate, the selflessness of phenomena, in other phenomena.

original: mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni phung po la sogs pa chos rnams phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin pa de bzhin du chos de dag gi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yang mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin
analyzed: mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni phung po la sogs pa chos rnams phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin pa de bzhin du chos de dag gi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yang mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin
translated: The pride of the differentiation of characteristics is the pride of the differentiation of the characteristics of phenomena such as the aggregates, etc., and the pride of the differentiation of the characteristics of the suchness of those phenomena, the ultimate, the selflessness of phenomena.

original: par sems pa ste /
analyzed: par sems pa ste /
translated: and the mind.

original: de dag gi 'og nas chos rnam pa sna tshogs dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ston pas shes pa brda sprod par bgyid de zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa'i skabs dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'og nas chos rnam pa sna tshogs dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ston pas shes pa brda sprod par bgyid de zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa'i skabs dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: After those, the various aspects of the Dharma are revealed by the clear realization that observes them, and thus the knowledge is taught.

original: de ltar spyi'i don bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar spyi'i don bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the general meaning,

original: da ni tshig gi don bshad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: da ni tshig gi don bshad par bya ba ste /
translated: now the meaning of the words will be explained.

original: de la sems can gyi khams na zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: de la sems can gyi khams na zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: In that regard, the “realm of sentient beings” is the immeasurable realm of sentient beings.

original: de yang @54a * //
analyzed: de yang @54a * //
translated: That is also

original: sems can gyi rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: the sixty-four types of sentient beings, as follows:

original: sems can dmyal ba pa dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dags rnams dang / lha rnams dang / mi rnams dang / rgyal rigs rnams dang / bram ze rnams dang / rje'u rigs rnams dang / dmangs rigs rnams dang / skyes pa rnams dang /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dags rnams dang / lha rnams dang / mi rnams dang / rgyal rigs rnams dang / bram ze rnams dang / rje'u rigs rnams dang / dmangs rigs rnams dang / skyes pa rnams dang /
translated: hell beings, animals, pretas, gods, humans, the kṣatriya class, the brahmin class, the vaiśya class, the śūdra class, males,

original: bud med rnams dang / ma ning rnams dang / ngan pa rnams dang / 'bring rnams dang / bzang po rnams dang / khyim pa rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang / dka' thub drag po can rnams dang / dka' thub drag po can ma yin pa rnams dang /🔽sngom pa can rnams dang / sdom pa can ma yin pa rnams dang / sdom pa can yang ma yin sdom pa can ma yin pa yang ma yin pa rnams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa rnams dang /
analyzed: bud med rnams dang / ma ning rnams dang / ngan pa rnams dang / 'bring rnams dang / bzang po rnams dang / khyim pa rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang / dka' thub drag po can rnams dang / dka' thub drag po can ma yin pa rnams dang / sngom pa can rnams dang / sdom pa can ma yin pa rnams dang / sdom pa can yang ma yin sdom pa can ma yin pa yang ma yin pa rnams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa rnams dang /
translated: women, eunuchs, the wicked, the middling, the good, householders, renunciates, those with intense austerities, those without intense austerities,🔽those with vows, those without vows, those neither with nor without vows, those free from desire, those not free from desire,

original: log pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs rnams dang / yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs rnams dang / ma nges pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs rnams dang / dge slong rnams dang / dge slong ma rnams dang / dge tshul rnams dang / dge tshul ma rnams dang /
analyzed: log pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs rnams dang / yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs rnams dang / ma nges pa nyid du nges pa'i tshogs rnams dang / dge slong rnams dang / dge slong ma rnams dang / dge tshul rnams dang / dge tshul ma rnams dang /
translated: those in the assembly of the determined, those in the assembly of the undetermined, monks, nuns, male novices, female novices,

original: dge bsnyen rnams dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams dang / spangs pa rnams dang / kha thon pa rnams dang / zhal ta byed pa rnams dang / gnas brtan rnams dang / bar ma rnams dang / gsar bu rnams dang / slob dpon rnams dang /
analyzed: dge bsnyen rnams dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams dang / spangs pa rnams dang / kha thon pa rnams dang / zhal ta byed pa rnams dang / gnas brtan rnams dang / bar ma rnams dang / gsar bu rnams dang / slob dpon rnams dang /
translated: the male and female lay practitioners, the renunciates, the expounders, the administrators, the elders, the middle-aged, the novices, the masters,

original: mkhan po rnams dang / lhan cig gnas pa rnams dang / nye gnas rnams dang / glo bur du lhags pa rnams dang / dge 'dun gyi las byed pa rnams dang / rnyed pa 'dod pa rnams dang / bkur sti 'dod pa rnams dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: mkhan po rnams dang / lhan cig gnas pa rnams dang / nye gnas rnams dang / glo bur du lhags pa rnams dang / dge 'dun gyi las byed pa rnams dang / rnyed pa 'dod pa rnams dang / bkur sti 'dod pa rnams dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa rnams dang /
translated: the preceptors, the students, the pupils, the visitors, the monks who work for the saṅgha, those who desire gain, those who desire honor, those who have few possessions,

original: mang du thos pa rnams dang / mkhas shing bsong nams dang ldan pa rnams dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa rnams dang / mdo sde 'dzin pa rnams dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams dang ;
analyzed: mang du thos pa rnams dang / mkhas shing bsong nams dang ldan pa rnams dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa rnams dang / mdo sde 'dzin pa rnams dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams dang ;
translated: those who are learned, those who are wise and meritorious, those who practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, those who uphold the sūtras, those who uphold the vinaya, those who uphold the mātṛkā,🔽and those who uphold the commentaries.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams dang / bden pa mthong ba rnams dang / slob pa rnams dang / mi slob ba rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams dang / bden pa mthong ba rnams dang / slob pa rnams dang / mi slob ba rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang /
translated: ordinary beings, those who have seen the truth, those in training, those no longer in training, sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, tathagatas,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba rnams so //
translated: and wheel-turning kings.
